review_text:
Stepping into this restaurant immediately sets the tone for a refined yet warmly inviting dining experience. The high ceilings, exposed beams, and striking vertical pillars give the space a grand industrial-chic feel, complemented by warm amber lighting and neatly set tables. The open kitchen allows diners to watch the chefs in action, adding an engaging, lively atmosphere.

The food presentation is elegant and minimalist, allowing the quality of the ingredients to shine. The slices of beef are cooked to a perfect medium-rare, with a delicate char on the outside and a juicy, tender center, paired simply with fresh greens for a clean, balanced plate. Another standout is the richly glazed beef-topped toast, crowned with tart pickles and fresh chives—a harmonious combination of sweet, tangy, and savory notes.

The playful touch of charred marshmallows on skewers hints at the restaurant’s creative flair, blending nostalgic comfort with gourmet technique.

Service is very attentive and professional, with the chefs clearly passionate about their craft. Overall, this is a place that blends sophisticated dining with a relaxed ambience, making it perfect for both special occasions and indulgent casual meals.
author: Krison Tan

review_text:
Finally after months of waiting, secured a meal in this popular restaurant..

Burnt ends, actually served beyond steak as their signature..but smoked flavours in all their cuisine.

Grissini, crisp breadsticks, paired with taramasalata, a traditional Greek dip made from salted cod roe, olive oil, lemon juice, and crispy flat bread was refreshing great appetising starter.

Quail egg smoked giving an explosive smoky flavour on one bite, caviar was a great compliment to the texture and brings freshness to the smokeness.

Jamaica wings or rather a halved wing, looks too small for me, but it took me 3 bites , hahaha. Is because I totally loved that flavour and slowly tasted the wonderful wings flavour.

Eel and bone marrow, like the photos shows..seems normal like a unagi sushi , but this is done smoked flavour glazed in the special miso sauce that I consider 5 🌟 against any omakase japanese resturant.   The bone marrow was hidden as a base that did not really over power the eel.

Main course was WA Marron grill to perfection, like medium rare..that is preserved the softness of the body, the glazed sauce was amazing don’t even remember what was it.

Finally the Australian steak, it was ok, lack the punch of a wow for a steak

Concluded with smoked lava cake, this is totally amazingly different with a strong smoky smoke in ur mouth,  of course it has to be eaten with the ice cream.

I am thrilled by the different presentation of course that resembles smoky identity yet letting each element of food be amazingly created to refine texture and taste.
author: joe fong

review_text: Wonderful experience at Burnt Ends. Definitely worth the hype and the Michelin star. The food is delicious yet not over the top (like many other Michelin restaurants). The marbled beef is so flavorful and cooked to perfection.  We almost could not finish the whole plate. It was very hard to book but glad at least we managed to secure a booking for a weekday.
author: Andrew Poon

review_text: The idea of cooking over a flame of charcoal is well presented here. Even the restaurant with its dark walls and orange glow lights feels like you’re inside a charcoal oven. The food was amazing and the dinner course was well spaced out and fresh. Felt very full and satisfied after. Cocktails are great and we were recommended drinks to pair with our food courses. The steak was the star of the course, perfectly cooked with a delicious smokey char. The service was excellent as well with waitstaff explaining each dish and recommending how to eat each course to fully enjoy them. Definitely work a visit during a special occasion and lives up to its name being one of the top 100 restaurants in the world.
author: Thanesh Ganeson

review_text: The anticipation was well worth it! We finally had the pleasure of dining here and were delighted with every dish we ordered. The attentive staff enhanced the experience, and we're eager to return soon, especially to explore the chef's selection. If only we'd had more stomach space to sample additional items! A huge thank you to Chef Yvette and her team for making our evening so special and memorable.
author: Lily Loh

review_text:
After few years of attemp to make a booking to this restaurant, I have emailed the restaurant to find that booking slots open exactly 45 days in advance, at 10am sharp for lunch reservation. Slots are fully booked within a few hours. Tips for those looking to make reservation.

Food wise, what I love:
Beef cube roll (ribeye steak)
Grissini,
Beef and uni
Fennel (root vegetable)
Beef cube roll is the best steak we have ever had (we have ordered 200g). It was simple yet masterfully done. Right level of tenderness, high quality beef.
Their small dishes are surprisingly nice for a steak house. Right balance in flavour, leaving you wanting to come back for more.

For individuals who prefer food's natural flavour and not too overpowering taste, I would not recommend:
Flat iron
Marron (small lobster)
These two dishes are too flavourful for me - flavours are too rich that it was hard for me to finish my portion.
Their sourdough bread is too hard for me as well, I couldn't chew through the crust and it's hard and chewy. Had better bread elsewhere.

Their service was excellent! We were served by Tim Chew. He was very patient and detailed in offering food recommendations to us. Very genuine guy who made our visit there very pleasant and memorable. The service crew is generally very nice and attentive to details.

Overall, it is recommended to lower your expectations to this extremely hard to book restaurant, and you will be pleasantly surprised with the dining experience that you may have. As the dishes here varied (from super flavourful/rich to a more balanced taste), it is good to choose your side and let the service crew know such that you can have the recommended dishes accordingly. We couldn't make up our mind hence we tried the whole spectrum.
author: Yvonne Ng

review_text:
This was our second visit to Burnt Ends, and it was just as impressive as the first.

We brought our two teenage daughters to introduce them to fine dining. We ordered the tasting menu for four. The chef personally came to ask our daughters about their preferences, which made the experience feel very thoughtful.

As each dish arrived, it was great to see our daughters trying new flavours and enjoying the creative food.

Thank you, Brunt Ends! Tonight was a fun and memorable experience for the whole family.

Thumbs up for the whole team.
author: Don Thisayakorn

review_text: A real experience at this place where the food is excellent, albeit very expensive. As an Australian the wine prices were a bit too much for me but I did have a lovely Shiraz to go with our main meal. Starters are very well done and really enjoyed our meal.
author: Craig Broadbent

review_text: My partner and I had Saturday date night on the bar side and it was perfection. Normally I don’t love the idea of dinner “at the bar,” but this was no ordinary bar. The space is amazing, intimate, yet still vibey. The service throughout the night was just right— attentive but not pushy or rushed. My partner had the tasting menu, and I had the bar bites. Every single thing we ate was 10/10, some things 11/10, with some of our favorites being the smoked quail egg, the beef marmalade, the tenderloin, fried drumlet, and the beef empanada. No review would be complete without mentioning the amazing cocktails! My partner did the cocktail pairing with the tasting menu, which was a unique and enjoyable way to experience different flavors to accompany the meal. I tried a few different cocktails, all extremely flavorful, unique, and crafted to perfection. Shout out to Shak, for his craftsmanship! While pricey, the food, drinks, staff, and experience lived up to it all. High end dining at its best. Thank you, Burnt Ends!
author: Jessica K.

review_text: The service is impeccable. It was fun to watch the cooking over charcoal. We liked all the things we tried. The chicken rice is very unique for an Australian restaurant.
author: Li koon

review_text:
A very different kind of Michelin Restaurant experience. Expect a crowded kitchen filled with chefs, expect charcoal grilled food right infront of your eyes. U get to see ethg that’s happening!

Food is excellent, be sure to order thier king crab leg, it was SOOOOOO GOOD.

service was excellent too. We had an excellent waiter David that was serving us, knowledgeable and was super thoughtful during our whole 2hr there. Thank you for making our experience a memorable one!
author: Esther Teng

review_text:
I'm not sure about the full history of this restaurant, but among the many swanky spots in Singapore, this one seems to be a household name among those who like to spend money on food. Judging from the photos here, it looks like they used to operate out of a smaller place that looked a lot more casual than what it is today.

Was told that by several people that the starters were not the main attraction here, which was disappointing to me because I'm a huge fan of starters. Going with the majority, we went a bit light on the starters and focused on their steaks.

Overall, I'd say the food was great. The meats were done to perfection, probably one of the better if not best meats I've had in a while. Perfectly cooked and seasoned, and not left for the guests to mess it up themselves.

Service felt a wee bit curt, although with a lot of helpful suggestions. Not a huge fan of the ambience (a tad too dim for my liking and the choice of music). Would consider going for the chef's select option if I ever have the chance to revisit.
author: Kritz Yeoh

review_text: Amazing dinner experience. Truly worthy of the Michelin Star it has. Exquisite food, drinks and a counter experience that is quite theatrical to watch as you are served your meal.
author: Kevin Ang

review_text: 10/10 Absolutely amazing restaurant. If you plan to go here make your reservation at least two to three weeks in advance. You won't be disappointed. Favorite dish was the pulled pork and chicken wings tossed in 16 different spices. Really everything was good. It's a great experience with good food atmosphere and drinks.
author: Alison Foote

review_text:
Not my first time here and definitely not the last. Really appreciate how the kitchen always innovates and comes up with different plates whilst concurrently keeping the specials on.

Special shout to David who was excellent throughout the meal - little things like making sure any spills the table was quickly wiped away to ensuring our water glasses were never empty.

All in all, great experience, thank you Burnt Ends team!!
author: Jason Chan

review_text: Burntends has the best vegetarian menu in Singapore , period . This is the first time I have ever asked for a full vegetarian meal although I have been here many times . Chef Patrick just whipped out a very wicked vegetarian menu . Oh boy , my friend who is a vegetarian love every single dish . I particularly love the white asparagus, the  tomato and the egg rice with mushroom . Oh and that cheese on the sourdough is to die for too . You just have to know it’s so damn difficult to get a reservation but it’s all worth it . Till next dinner again I will have this vegetarian menu again . ❤️
author: Benjamin Goh

review_text: No wonder it’s always so difficult to get a table with them. The burnt ends never disappoint, featuring their char-grilled specialty, creative cocktails, an interesting menu, and extremely good service! I love the dishes, and I think they are worth trying!
author: Empress Ker

review_text: I showed up without a reservation and scored a spot at the bar. What a lucky break. The bartender was incredibly helpful. I wish I’d gotten his name. He improvised a cocktail that I shared with him, and blew it away. His take on the chocolate negroni was so good, I asked him to write down his recipe. Then of course, as you probably know, if you’re looking at this place - the food was amazing. The flavors packed into small bites put this on my map for a much longer, proper sit down next time I’m in Singapore. This was a highlight on my trip and has left an indelible impression on my palate. If you like savory, flavorful, and complex tasting food and drinks to match be sure to put this restaurant on your itinerary.
author: Richard De La Rosa

review_text: This was one of the greatest dinners of my life and I have eaten at a lot of great restaurants, I am from Austin TX so would like to think I know good BBQ…first the restaurant is beautiful, also do not miss the bar next door. Service was top notch thank you Lyon. Had the honor of meeting Chef…where to start? Pulled pork sandwich and Brisket were delicious…lamb chops were the best I have ever had, 43 day dry aged sirloin was melt in your mouth. When in Singapore you have 1 job, get a reservation at Burnt Ends!
author: Zack Baker

review_text:
Took me how many tries before getting a reservation on this restaurant. The dining experience is top tier, the food is amazing. Kudos to the team and thank you Mr. Neil for the good service. Also have lady server but didn’t get the name. Will definitely be back again.

Ordered the following:
Smoked Quail Egg Caviar
Grissini
Pork Taco
Pulled Pork Sanger
Pakistani Lamb Chop
Flat iron
Chocolate & Coconut (for dessert)
author: Jec-Jec Suetos

review_text: One of the best and reasonable price restaurants service excellent and good recommendation by the staff on their menu. Love their grissini, white pepper chicken neck the cooking just nice and meat so tender and juicy and their flat iron beef cooked to perfection rich flavour and tender texture. Will definitely come back again to try their pulled pork sandwich
author: julie leong

review_text: amazing meal and great service by david!! every dish was just 10/10 and i especially loved the flat iron w burnt onion and the off-menu fish tacos!! 💖💖 definitely coming back again
author: Karyn Ooi

review_text: My wife and I were warmly welcomed and entertained by Patrick, whose engaging charm set the perfect tone for the evening. Every dish was a revelation—artfully balanced with smoky flavors that enhanced rather than overpowered the natural taste of each ingredients. The mastery behind the wood-fired techniques was evident in every bite, transforming each plate into a celebration of culinary precision. Stellar service and a vibrant, relaxed atmosphere round out an experience that stands out in Singapore's dining scene. Highly recommended if you're in search of top-notch BBQ that hits all the right notes.
author: Leander Yohanes

review_text: Terrific restaurant that lives up to the hype. The service is excellent and attentive without feeling like theyre hovering over you. The food was terrific - well seasoned and cooked to perfection.
author: Jason Kurtis

review_text: Despite waiting and trying for a year to get a reservation the food was amazing. The chef was really generous and gave us a goody bag after the meal.
author: Susan Ha

review_text: What a night! The atmosphere, food and service from our server David was exceptional. We booked for a special occasion and we were not disappointed. Each dish was amazing and the attention to detail was second to none. Highly recommend.
author: Glenda Turnbull

review_text: it’s SO HARD to get a table reservation especially the counter table. but then when i saw they had a slot available i took no chances and immediately booked it. had the most stellar experience. the chefs cater to your every need and delivered it perfectly.
author: lny ar

review_text: It is a fantastic and famous place in Singapore. Really difficult to have a reservation. But, really an amazing place and joyful experience. Food is great! Service is excellent! Everything is good. Price is fine for us! Will visit it again!
author: Yan Liu

review_text:
Great ! Nice food, nice cocktails,
Very cool place, with a beautiful room.
The staff is very attentive, and u feel warm from the very beginning.
I will come back
author: Ángel Martínez Capilla

review_text:
My third visit to Burnt Ends but it is just as good and exciting as my first. Strong dishes from start to the end. Simply unforgettable! Is it too much if I said that every single dish is so good?!

Their cocktails are great too with alot of effort put into them.
author: Chelsey Chen

review_text:
Really got to rate this place a 101/100 ⭐️
service is good and the chefs are all well trained. food is super good as well but will need some patience. anything for good food right ? 😛  overall, great place and great experience for friends/family gatherings. OH YES and do place your bookings earlier to avoid disappointment as they are most of the time fully booked 🫣 will definitely come back again !!
author: Crystal

review_text: Amazing!! We went for the chef selection menu and everything was perfect. Really good wine selection. Highly recommendable.
author: Jose Bilbao

review_text:
Always a treat to enjoy a meal at this local favourite.
Food is next level amazing- high end dining with a healthy fusion of cuisines and techniques
author: John C W Thomas

review_text:
Burnt Ends is an absolute must-visit for meat lovers! The lively, open-kitchen atmosphere creates an exciting dining experience. My family and I were blown away by the exceptional quality of the meat. The signature Burnt Ends were tender and flavorful, a perfect balance of smoky and juicy. We also loved the bone marrow, which was rich and creamy. The service was top-notch, with knowledgeable staff guiding us through the menu. While it might be pricey, the overall experience is worth every penny. A truly unforgettable meal!

Tip: Be prepared for a wait, but it’s worth it!
author: Sayak Das

review_text:
Scuzzi moi for the dark photos coz the place is really dim (the bar area, not the dining hall)
Burnt ends serves up quite an assortment of highly creative dishes. Who would think of putting leek with hazelnuts? But the creativity on the menu is off the charts. And it works. I tried a tasting menu which comprised of most of their favourites. Unfortunately by the end, was already unable to squeeze in anymore meat so we had to leave it at the pulled slider.
Every dish was thoughtfully prepared you could tell. Mind u, the food here is meant to be savoury which is right up my alley. Strong tastes and heavy seasoning is used. I love that.
Endless banter with the wait staff also made for a good evening.
If I could even remotely be able to get a table next time, I’d surely be back.
author: david chong

review_text:
Absolutely outstanding, from start to finish the team is really on the ball,

Service was amazing, so were cocktails, sommelier recommendations, and stellar food to top it off,

Very rock and roll 🙂
author: Filip Palfi

review_text: The chicken neck was exceptional, a quiet contender but total champ. Caviar with quail egg was great to start but because it was so good that expectations was push up higher right from the start (and some dishes that follows became a disappointment). Overall the starters are better than the mains for sure. Service at the restaurant was nice and attentive. Choose the counter seats!
author: Sandra Aw

review_text:
First time here and like everyone else we came in with high expectations considering all the hype and rave reviews about this place, not forgetting the challenge in getting a table here.

Overall, service was good, Jane, Bock and the team were very helpful and friendly with sharing about the menu and wines. Food was generally decent but there were hits and misses across the items that we ordered. The flat iron steak, pork, bone marrow, octopus, burnt cheesecake and marshmallow were very well executed and each outstanding in its own. However everything else was just alright.

Would recommend Burnt Ends as a must try at least once kind of place but personally we felt that the food couldn't justify the price.
author: Timothy Lim

review_text: Had the most wonderful gastronomic experience here! Ordered the burnt ends classics set menu for 2 pax, and all the dishes were absolutely splendid - we were so stuffed and satisfied by the end. Service was really good, and the interior is simply beautiful and so cosy, it almost felt as if we were being transported into another era. We were also given a special dessert as it was my husband’s birthday. Would definitely love to come again and try their other dishes and perhaps some of their drinks as well.
author: Aye Mon

review_text:
Snagged a dinner for two on the same day when it opened up after years of never getting a spot.

Didn’t disappoint.

We had like 5 of those tiny little starters but the standouts were the
Maitake Porridge - Umami Overload
Pig Ears - Amazing texture
Duck Heart, Tacos were good but not special.
Steak Frites was abit underwhelming.

For the entrees and mains -
Lamb Chops were wonderful.
Flat Iron was amazing.
Cube Roll was spectacular.

Split over the marrow bun, I didn’t like it, wife loved it.

Dessert was a lava cake that came with a really interesting Smokey ice cream as well as some marshmallow and tiny treats.

100% would go back if I can get a goddamn reservation. Patrick and his crew made the experience amazing.

Thank you!
author: Vinod Varma

review_text: Third time at Burnt Ends and it's always a fantastic experience here. Food is impeccable, vibe is fun, and friendly staffs. Somehow I enjoy the bites more than the main dish each time - favourites are the grissini, beef bite with pickles, quail eggs.
author: Rachel

review_text: Great experience for a special meal to celebrate our anniversary.  Hands down the Best flat iron steak I’ve ever had. Best king crab I’ve ever had. Squid pasta and mistake mushroom porridge were also wonderful. Grissini was ok only (relative to the other amazing dishes). The warm Sourdough bread was the perfect vehicle to mop everything up.  All the dishes was rich, but without feeling greasy.  Super attentive service. I never had to raise my arms up more than a couple of seconds. Everything was done with such care and attention to detail.  We sat at the chefs table and it was inquisitively entertaining. The chefs and waiters were very happy to answer any questions we had.  The guy next to the furnace had a tough job!  Was slightly worried it would be too smoky indoors with all the indoor bbq cooking, but I needn’t have been. Price is high yes, but a couple of dishes especially the flat iron and the squid we felt was particularly worth it.  Looks like we may have to come back again. Nicely done team!
author: michael lin

review_text: Good tasting BBQ food. David gave a quick intro of the lunch menu and recommended some restaurant favourites. It was my friend's birthday and many thanks for the marshmallows (compliments from the restaurant). Service was quick and prompt and good lunch experience overall.
author: Cookie Monster

review_text:
The best fine dining experience hands down. We decided to do the chef's select and my god it did not disappoint.
The food was incredible and the combinations on the plates mind blowing. Definitely come here if you're in Singapore and looking for an amazing fine dining experience.
author: Lisa Bell

review_text: It was first time to visit Burnt Ends and it was worth it to have a great experience in here. All of dishes are so fresh and nice. The meat was tender, variance of cooking on meat was nice (such as starting with raw meat, pulled pork and whole piece)🙂 I asked to sommelier for pairing, it was awesome also. Furthermore, I could reserved the bar side, I can say it is the best choice. While having a dinner, I could literally feel the passion of chefs and the enthusiastic atmosphere there. The day was totally enjoyable and tasty experience:)
author: 박경용

review_text: This is our second time here and both times we were super impressed. We ordered the chef’s select - amazing food, especially their meats! Have to order their flat iron. Crab, lamb and peri peri chicken were all great too. As for their sides, I really loved their ‘fish and chips’! A shoutout to the bar manager, Makoto, for his perfect service. He made our experience extra fun and special - definitely one to remember. Thanks Makoto!
author: Crystal Low

review_text:
Nestled in the heart of Tanglin, Burnt Ends is the kind of place that makes dining an event. The bar seats are the prime location if you want to be part of the action, offering an unobstructed view of the open kitchen where culinary magic happens. There's an intoxicating buzz in the atmosphere, amplified by the tantalizing aromas of smoked and charred goodness wafting through the air.

The food here is nothing short of spectacular. Each dish is a masterpiece, meticulously crafted to celebrate the finest ingredients and bold flavors. The perfectly charred meats, cooked to succulent perfection on custom-built grills, are the stars of the show. But don't overlook the sides and desserts—they hold their own with surprising twists and thoughtful presentations.

Service at Burnt Ends is top-notch, with friendly and knowledgeable staff who enhance the overall experience. Their passion for the cuisine is evident, and they're more than happy to guide you through the menu.

In essence, Burnt Ends offers a dining experience that is both immersive and unforgettable. With its great atmosphere, exceptional food, and prime bar seating, it's a place that leaves a lasting impression and beckons for a return visit.
author: Russell Minter

review_text:
Update: 15th March 2025

We came here for dinner, and this time round we decided to be more bold in our choices. We go for off menu dishes recommended by the waitress - and it turns out to be the best one we tried so far (Japanese Mushroom with Congee). Will definitely come here again for good meal and time.

***************************************

The food is excellent and the staff is friendly as well. We were served by Hafidz, and his food recommendations was on point. Do remember to ask for “off-the-menu” items, to discover hidden the gems. Highly recommended “Leek and Black Truffle” and “Steak Frites”. Will definitely come back again.
author: Teoh PS

review_text:
Had the most amazing anniversary dinner here with my partner. Every dish we ordered from the menu and off the menu was executed superbly by the team. Each meat was cooked flawlessly, with the inside juicy and tender full of umami flavour. The king crab as garlic brown butter is a MUST!(Tip: ask for a side of sourdough bread to scoop up that delicious sauce with)

If I could give 10 stars to the service team - Richard, Vincent and others, I would. They went over and above from remembering details of our dietary requirements, perfect-to-the-t food recommendations, to the complimentary anniversary shots and pastries. When my partners pigeon had some texture issues, they didn’t even bring it out, and told us apologetically that they had to redo it. The service recovery was a salt pepper pork that was so heavenly we almost fell off our chairs (this needs to be on the menu!)

Thank you for a wonderful night, Burnt Ends. We will be back for sure!
author: Julian Soon

review_text:
Excellent food and service. We went all in for the chef’s select option which cost about $400 after all the charges (we ordered lots of drinks as well). The service is excellent with many notable dishes.

CRAB, PORK AND BLACK TRUFFLE ravioli has a very nice char to it which highlights the aroma of the shellfish. Another highlight is the grilled mushrooms risotto. The lobster with roe butter sauce was cooked so delicately. Ended the meal with add on slider with pickle bath. Excellent meal!
author: Dru Lu

review_text:
Well… I mean burnt ends has a lot of hype around it, it’s very hard to get in, it’s expensive, you need to kind of go out of the way to get there….. was it worth it.

Yes.

Outstanding food and wine. Service was outstanding. Great fit out and atmosphere, overall a very pleasurable experience.

I can very much recommend trying to get a spot at the chefs table to watch all the magic happen right in front of you. Also you can chat with them whilst they are working. (In fact I recommend doing this at all restaurants that offer it, I have never had a bad experience).

Thanks again
author: Mark Snow

review_text: Getting a reservation here is quite challenging, and that was why even if we got lounge seats, we took the opportunity. Most of the food was impressive. My favourites would be the smoked quail eggs, followed by the steak frites, then the berry tart. However, everything was well done. Except for the leeks with hazelnuts perhaps, wasnt much of a fan of that as it was a buttery dish and it wasnt served that hot. Having said that, the experience was fun and worth it. I enjoyed savouring each dish, the lovely ambience in the restaurant (there is a 2 hour max seating time, but there are outdoor seats if you feel like exceeding), and the friendly service. It was roughly 200+ per person if you order one drink. I also have chicken allergy and they gladly replaced one of my set menu dishes with a lamb one. The whole menu was quite filling. The tenderloin was amazing - melts in your mouth!
author: Maria Christine Asuncion

review_text:
My experience at Burnt Ends was nothing short of extraordinary. Initially, attempting to secure a reservation more than a month before our trip proved challenging, as they were fully booked. However, a stroke of luck came our way when a fellow foodie from one of my groups suggested trying a walk-in. Intrigued, we decided to forgo a hosted dinner and give it a shot. To our surprise, we arrived at 6:15 pm, and within 30 minutes, we were comfortably seated at a table - the staff informed us we had until 8:15 pm. It felt like we had won a small lottery, and the anticipation for the evening grew.

The atmosphere was everything we hoped for - chill, relaxed, and with a front-row seat to the culinary action. We enjoyed watching the chefs expertly grill our dishes, adding to the overall dining experience. The two-hour time frame was more than enough for us, and the feeling of exclusivity made the evening even more special. 🥰

As for the food, it was a symphony of flavors. From the perfectly cooked steak to the delightful cocktails, every dish was a masterpiece. The ambiance, coupled with the superb culinary skills on display, created a dining experience that was truly sublime. Burnt Ends exceeded our expectations, and I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone seeking an unforgettable culinary adventure in Singapore.
author: Loren Pastrana

review_text:
Excellent food and service. We went all in for the chef's select option which cost about $400 after all the charges (we ordered lots of drinks as well). The service is excellent with many notable dishes.
CRAB, PORK AND BLACK TRUFFLE ravioli has a very nice char to it which highlights the aroma of the shellfish. Another highlight is the grilled mushrooms risotto. The lobster with roe butter sauce was cooked so delicately. Ended the meal with add on slider with pickle bath. Excellent meal! An absolute culinary gem nestled in Singapore's vibrant dining scene, Burnt Ends is a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts. From the moment you step in, the rustic yet inviting ambiance sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience. The menu boasts an exquisite selection of perfectly cooked meats, each dish crafted with precision and passion. The burnt ends, in particular, are a revelation – tender, smoky, and bursting with flavor. Accompanied by attentive service and an extensive beverage list, dining here is a journey for the senses. Whether you're a barbecue aficionado or simply seeking culinary excellence, Burnt Ends promises a gastronomic adventure like no other. A definite highlight of Singapore's culinary landscape.
author: Elijah Chan

review_text:
One of the best restaurant in Singapore. Used to be an occasion restaurant for us.  We kept coming back, its now our regular place to go. Never disappoint and always surprise.

Dishes are excellent and Leon is best server. We hope to come back whenever there are new dishes.
author: Hui L

review_text:
Every visit to Burnt Ends is an incredible experience that never fails to impress! This restaurant is always a highlight of my travels and often the main reason for passing through Singapore. Dave and his team consistently deliver exceptional food that delights the taste buds, paired with impeccable service that makes you feel welcomed and valued.

From the moment you step in, the atmosphere is vibrant, and the attention to detail is evident in every dish. Each visit leaves me eagerly anticipating the next, as they continuously raise the bar. If you're in Singapore, Burnt Ends is a must-visit destination for an unforgettable dining experience!
author: Danielle Perrow

review_text: My partner and I had a dinner session from 9pm in the cocktail bar. We couldn’t recommend this highly enough, the staff at this venue are impeccable. They had such a wide variety of knowledge and took such good care of us, making it a memorable evening for us both. The food and drinks were sensational and I couldn’t rate it more highly. This is a go to venue !
author: Emily Paterson

review_text: An elite feed in Singapore. The staff were amazing, especially David. Highly recommend the chefs select menu, amazing experience
author: jack lowes

review_text: After what felt like forever, I finally made it to this steakhouse, and oh my, it was worth the wait! Being seated right at the kitchen felt like a dream come true – watching those chefs work their magic was like dinner and a show rolled into one! The food? Pure perfection. Each bite of that heavenly steak was like a taste of culinary heaven. And the service? Let's just say they made me feel like royalty. Definitely a great place to have a romantic night – I can't wait to come back for seconds – and thirds, and fourths! This place has officially stolen my heart.
author: Thesa T

review_text:
My wife and I recently visited Burnt Ends and had a fantastic experience from start to finish. The staff were incredibly attentive and each brought their own personality to the service by offering genuine recommendations from the menu. It was refreshing to see staff genuinely share their thoughts, unlike other places where suggestions can feel a bit rehearsed.

We went steak-heavy and ordered 250g of the flat iron and 250g of the Blackmores strip loin, both cooked to perfection at medium rare. Each cut was flavorful and perfectly seared, showcasing the quality and skill at Burnt Ends. One highlight was a special off-menu item we tried – the beef marmalade with house pickles (pictured). I highly recommend it for anyone dining here; it’s an experience all its own.

To accompany the meal, we shared a bottle of Singaporean craft beer, which paired deliciously with the rich flavors of the steaks.

Overall, Burnt Ends ticks all the boxes for a memorable dining experience. The only downside? Due to its popularity, securing a reservation here takes time, so plan well in advance. Also, keep in mind that this place is definitely on the pricier side, but absolutely worth it.
author: Panos P

review_text:
Truly a privilege and pleasure to dine at such a fine establishment.

To get a spot for reservation took months and it was well worth the wait.

Service was attentive and impeccable. Food quality was stellar and sublime. Steaks cooked to perfection. The smokiness was superb.

Well worth the price and wait. Truly deserving of its michelin star and top 50 restaurants tag

Thank you to the Burnt Ends team for such an experience, and oh don’t forget to eat their bombolonis.

Star dishes - beef marmalade and pickles, cube roll  steak
author: Y-Dub Dub

review_text:
Food was amazing, definitely order the Grissini, Leeks and Flat Iron steak! The fennel dish unfortunately leaves a lot to be desired, with the orange too overpowering, but dining experience overall was great!

Our waiter, David, was incredibly helpful from the get-go - taking the time to explain all the items in the menu one by one and giving us the space to choose and make our decision. After we finished he took the time to chat with us as well and made sure our experience was good!
author: James Ross

review_text:
Very nice lunch at burnts end . It was incredibly hard to make a reservation here so quite thankful we managed to
Recommended are the offmenu items like beef taretare on hash brown ; quail egg
Also The flat iron beef is definitely worth
Last surprise we got was the marshmallow which was roasted just right; and inside was a explosion of orange flavours
Definitely worth and will be back (if we can book again)
author: Kevin KW

review_text:
Celebrated our first-born 18th birthday here at Burnt Ends. Reservations are impossible to make, so big thanks to my bud for helping to secure the slot.

Our counter seats were right in front of Executive Chef Patrick and he took excellent care of us. The night was perfect with fantastic food, a nice bottle of Tignanello (her birth year vintage of 2006 no less) and simply spending time together.

It was our first time in Burnt Ends so we decided to go with Chef Patrick’s recommendations. The only decision we had to make was the choice of the steak cut, and the 49 days dry aged cut was it. Omg, it was melt-in-your-mouth with outstanding flavors.

The other standouts for me:
1. Chicken neck… freaking amazing taste bomb!

2. Maitake mushroom w congee & egg yolk. It was so so so good with the earthiness and char of the mushroom paired with the creaminess of the congee.

3. The king crab was out of this world and he gave us sourdough to wipe the plate clean, unbelivably good!

Wanted to do a wefie with Chef Patrick but he counter offered by taking a proper photo of us, so sweet of him. Thanks again, Chef for making the evening a perfect one for my daughter’s 18th ❤️
author: Ching San Lim

review_text: We had an incredible dining experience at Burnt Ends! After multiple attempts to secure a booking, I finally got lucky. We opted for the à la carte menu and ordered the grissini, eggplant miso, lamb koftas, pulled pork sanger, roasted chicken, bone marrow bun, and butterhead lettuce on the side. Every single dish was outstanding. The lamb koftas were bursting with flavour! The chicken was so tasty and not dry like I often find at other restaurants. The service was flawless—the waiters were so attentive throughout the meal. My tip: don’t share the grissini—get one for yourself, it’s that good! I was hesitant about the bone marrow bun at first, but after reading some reviews, I gave it a try, and it was amazing. We ended with the berry tart and roasted marshmallow, and my only regret is that we didn’t each get our own tart, it was absolutely delicious. I can’t wait to come back here next time I’m in Singapore!
author: Ellie

review_text:
Food here is interesting. Been once for a private event and once for birthday lunch. Enjoy their quail eggs with caviar, the flatbreads, and pulled pork sandwiches. They can do wonders with grilled meat. Strong cocktails.
Love their bakery too. Regularly come for cinnamon rolls, banana bread and donuts
author: Vick C

review_text:
I recently had the pleasure of dinning here after a long battle with the waiting list for a reservation.

Dining at Burnt ends is an unforgettable experience. The food, service and atmosphere are all top notch.

Starting with the food, expect dry aged, charcoal grilled prime cuts of some of the worlds best beef and lamb paired with spice filled sauces. Full of rich flavor and umami. The sauces offered helped elevate the flavours to the next level.

The staff were the perfect balance of friendly, approachable and professional. They were always happy to chat and share about the food and wine provided.

Overall this was definitely a memorable experience and I look forward to my next visit.
author: Sheldon Wile

review_text:
We went for the chef selection.
The portions was small so can try many things.

Taste wise are beyond average, but not to the extend of giving a lot of excitement
The dessert was great. Wines was great.

Definitely nice environment for sure
Very good service.
author: Luo TJ

review_text: The food is amazing! Even my Asian platter husband gave his approval and we can’t wait to go back already. Love the smoked egg tart, uni slider and caviar, maitake and egg. Honestly it’s was hard to just chose 3 out of all the dishes I had.
author: M Mmm

review_text: This is gonna be an unconventional opinion, while the tomahawk steak and starters were great, we were absolutely blown away by the lettuce butterhead salad — it was so unassuming we didn’t even take a picture. Both my husband and I agree that it was the best lettuce head we ever had. The lettuce itself was very fresh, and the sauce just took it to the next level. Huge props to whoever came up with this combo. And big thank you to the waiter for giving us a small tub of the sauce (it’s heaven).
author: Sophie Li

review_text: Beautiful venue, especially when overlooking the open kitchen and seeing the fire in action. We tried a variety of dishes over a long lunch and everything was delicious. The staff were all friendly and helpful in advising on the right amount of food to order and what will pair well together. Personal favourites were the eggplant & miso, the Onglet with the bone marrow bun and the berry tart. If you're lucky enough to get a reservation this place is a must try when in Singapore.
author: Luke Scott

review_text: Absolutely delicious. 250$ for 2 pax for the tasting menu of their classics. Initially thought the dishes were small but ended up being good amount by the end. The beef marmalade was our favourite. Drinks also very unique and spot on.
author: Jeremy Vo

review_text: A truly remarkable experience in a unique setting. Chef Dave Pynt, who happens to be a very friendly fellow, does magic by cooking with fire here (even the dessert). Amazing quality of ingredients, these were some of the best steaks I’ve ever had. The team made our evening worthwhile by being friendly and forthcoming hosts. Absolutely worth a visit if you can make it on the guest list.
author: Markus De

review_text: Like what EC Patrick said. Took me 11 years to visit them. I must justify that it’s so hard to get a slot on their website. No excuses but Anyway guys, I love my meal so much today that I want to share to the world how good you guys are! Love the vibe, food and people. I have my fair share of being to nice places but really love how your team works together. Attentive too. Special call out to jasmine too! Vibe and people very Impt to me. Their chef menu is interesting. You are billed what you ate, not what you need to pay. See you guys very soon and thank you once again. Really made my day.
author: Ray Er

review_text: Super fun, super yummy, super people, burnt ends is such a lovely place to dine at and worthy of their Michelin star! This is a place that focuses on flavour bombs and not looking pretentious at all. Love the touch of fire and smoke in all their dishes that add a beautiful layer of complexity of flavour. Special thank you to the team for looking after my friend who doesn’t eat beef by replacing it with something equally delicious, small touches like this show that this is a restaurant that really cares for its diners. Don’t miss out on burnt ends!
author: Michelle Leong

review_text: Finally got a reservation at this new location after they moved over. We had the chef selection and it was great revising the classics along some new dishes. Our host Jasmine and Clarence also took great care of us, making the experience one to remember. Don't forget to tour the wine cellar. It's definitely hoarding some great Aussie wines
author: Chris New

review_text:
Tried the chef’s menu where the head chef Vincent prepared for us highlights of Burnt ends plus some new items.

Really enjoyed the dinner. Firstly, the service was exceptional. One person on my table doesn’t eat raw food or beef and Vincent prepared a menu that catered to that for her.

The food was also mind blowing. The food really made use of amazing fresh ingredients that are cooked to perfection. The beef steak at the end had a nice char to the crust. The uni on the crab toast was mouth wateringly good. The marmalade beef on toast was also so soft and delicious.

Overall, a superb dinner. The cocktails and wine selection were also amazing, and I highly recommend ordering.
author: Brendan

review_text: Came here for a birthday celebration, and gosh, the food is so good. Even though there were set cocktails, the bartender on duty was very kind in mixing custom drinks and mocktails (for pregnant folks). The attendants were super attentive and made sure that all dietary restrictions were met.
author: Daniel Bok

review_text: Fantastic place with great service, drinks and food - everything is top class 👌 we sat at the bar but found that the food options were amazing and sufficient for a nice quiet, intimate boozy evening. Even though the timeslots are adhered to strictly, the staff manages to make you feel relaxed and immersed in the atmosphere. The somewhat steampunk decor is amazing for someone who appreciates these things!
author: M C

review_text: Had a few rounds of cocktails at the bar table, drinks were amazing and interestingly complex (in a goodway)! Bartenders and staff were really friendly, overall great service, great vibes and interactions. Unfortunately did not get to try any bar snacks as we were too full from dinner. Would definitely recommend to others and would go back too.
author: Becca Eng'

review_text: We could only get a reservation in the cocktail area but it still didn't disappoint. Between the two of us, we had a smoked quail egg with caviar (delicious bite) and we shared the duck cigars, buttermilk fried crumpets (both good), the leeks with hazelnut and black truffle (amazing flavour and a must order), tenderloin (steak was melt in mouth) with butterhead lettuce and fried frites with chipotle (both a good accompaniment for the steak). For dessert, we had a marshmallow each (nice) and had the mint and chocolate (this was just okay, can be missed). The two cocktails I ordered, the "Edward Stickyhands and "the stocky dog" were both tasty and balanced well. The staff were super helpful with recommendations.
author: Christine Kim

review_text: The food and service were good. Very hard to get reservation for lunch but was lucky on the day itself to have a table for me and my wife. Tried a few side dishes before finished it off with the main course of steak. Overall was really good with the unique taste of food.
author: Danny Woo

review_text: Everything is as you’d expect at such a well known upclass restaurant. The food was fantastic and so was the atmosphere and service. We got the private room (can’t remember what it’s called) which was great to have our own private space and conversations. The food was truly well thought out and executed by the team and each course was well presented and explained. The ambiance was great and I appreciate the interior design and concept very much.
author: Ricardo Seah

review_text: Experienced both main dining room and bar. Excellent food, wine and cocktail! Make the reservation 45 days in advance to secure your spot:-)
author: Eileen Lee

review_text:
I had been trying to get a reservation at Burnt Ends for YEARS. By some stroke of luck, I managed to get a reservation. We had the following dishes:
1. Smoked egg caviar - Small and packs a punch. However, I won’t order this again at 18 a piece.
2. Chicken Neck - Highly recommended by the staff. It was sold out shortly.
3. Grissini & taramasalata - The leeks, hazelnut, and white truffle dish was a very good combination.
4. Chicken for 2 - The chefs took a while to cook this, and they had a lot of technique. I found the accompanying sauce a bit too sweet for me.
5. Beef - Dining companion had it. Thumbs up.
6. Berry Tart - Really good. It looked really simple and home made but very well done. Loved it!
7. Marshmallow - It was smoky and had a citrus taste to it. Good but you may want to skip this.

Total bill: 381 for 2 pax.

There’s alot of action going on when seated at the grill area. Tensions ran high, and alot of respect for the chefs who were putting their heart and sleeve into the food. You may find the grill area a little too warm. Another couple mentioned about the heat repeatedly, and they were shifted away after her third mention.

We ended off with some lovely doughnuts at the bakery with coffee. Highly recommend.
author: Angeline

review_text: First time here, and very happy with the experience. Everything was tasty. Among the appetizers, I liked the grissini and the pig’s ear the most. Between the two mains we got, I preferred the chicken more as the tenderloin was a bit rich for me (maybe from the marrow)
author: Derek Rodriguez

review_text: One of the Best Grilled Dishes You could ever find on the planet!!!
author: Savet Savetsomphob

review_text: After a long awaited booking, the food did not disappoint. The dishes were intriguing to my taste buds, and the cooking perfection of simple ingredients did spark a lot curiosity and questions of how its made. The food served will bring your sensing to the next level as they put together the simplest of ingredients and their perplex seasoning over their handle of fire/BBQ style cooking.
author: James Wong

review_text:
An experience worth waiting for.

It was nice of staff to recommend taking half share of some of the food items.

Overall, my burning 🔥 desire to eat there ended well 😋
author: Gloria James

review_text:
Burnt Ends is an institution in Singapore. An example of how fine ingredients, together with skilled preparation and excellent service together is greater than the sum of its parts.

The counter seats are the best in the house in my opinion; front row to all the action. I have never seen such a busy and well orchestrated kitchen, it’s like an episode of Chef’s Table!

I would definitely return for the fish & chips grissini and king crab legs.

Shout out to chefs Patrick and Kenny, and super attentive CY for the wonderful experience.
author: Jeremy Ng

review_text: Seriously the most Awesome Cafe Ever! Kumar took great care of us and the owners are super duper friendly. I don’t come here often enough!!!  I want to come back and try everything on the menu! They don’t use oil in anything!! But you can enjoy a mix of healthy, hearty and happy! 😊  See you guys again soon! Thank you for the fab good and service! xx 💋
author: Kara Bensley

review_text: Amazing food! We got the burgers...pork porchetta...shrimp curry. Atmosphere is amazing and service was good and so fast! Better to make a reservation for easy seating. Got a fast response on whatsapp too!  Kumar was really helpful and explained the food options to us! Will be back here again!!!
author: Karthikgayan

review_text: Visited My Awesome Café and really enjoyed the experience! The coffee was good, service was friendly, and the decor was beautiful with a cool, vintage vibe. A great spot to relax and enjoy a chill afternoon. Definitely lives up to its name!
author: iamjess

review_text: This cafe is seriously the cutest place I've ever been, like, ever. 🥰😍🤩  The fairy lights and comfy chairs just make you want to stay all day. 🛋️✨💖  And the food?  Don't even get me started. 😋🤤💯  I had the most amazing Quesadilla, it was pure heaven. 🧀🔥🌟 Every bite was a flavor explosion, honestly. 💥😋🤯 The Pork Porchetta was just out of this world. 🐷🌎😋 The coffee was rich and smooth, the perfect pick-me-up. ☕😌👍  I even grabbed a pineapple upside-down cake, it is tooo die for !! 🍍🍰😋 I can't wait to go back and try everything else on the menu. 🤤🍽️😋  This place is my new favorite spot, hands down. 💯🥇💖 The owner and everyone there will go out of their way to help you out pick what would be best for you. 😇🙏💖 They also help taking photos you and your group ;) 📸😊👍
author: Varun Bakshi

review_text: Kumar provides excellent and attentive service, going above and beyond to ensure we had a great experience. His dedication and professionalism truly stood out, making our visit even more enjoyable on top of the lovely café atmosphere. Highly recommended!
author: Eve Chan

review_text:
My fiancée recommended this place after we had shortlisted it for a while. One of the main reason is the parking available. It's close to our home but quite a walk to the restaurant. One this Sunday we decided to drive there as she has to attend church afterwards.

The restaurant live up to it's hype. Waitress, Jo, was very helpful and friendly. Recommendations she made was spot on for us. Rendang Mushroom Burger, Spicy Thai Beef Quesadilla, Awesome Tonic hits the spot. The buns are so soft and fluffy it's simply delicious. The deco are traditional Chinese.. looks "messy" but it generates a good vibe. The place is relaxing although it can get crowd quickly.

I'd suggest you make reservations in case you have to wait. It's really worth the visit.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Second visit last weekend. Tried different things and just as delicious. Their bread are super fluffy. Highly recommended.
author: Melvin Lim

review_text: back to this Awesome cafe bar after 5 years, and I’m so glad I did! The food is still absolutely delicious, with every dish prepared to perfection. The flavors are vibrant and fresh – it’s clear they use high-quality ingredients. The service has also remained top-notch; the staff is friendly, attentive, and made me feel right at home. It’s a wonderful spot to relax and enjoy great food. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a welcoming place with fantastic eats and service. This place holds a special place in my heart as a beautiful memory of my time in Singapore. I’ll definitely be back again soon!！！！
author: 刘Liu

review_text:
I can't recommend Awesome Cafe enough! The food was absolutely delicious, and the service was impeccable. We hosted a private event here, and the team went above and beyond with thoughtful arrangements and beautiful decorations that made the occasion even more special. Everything was handled with so much care and attention to detail.

A huge thank you to the entire team for making it such a memorable experience for us and our guests. Truly a place that lives up to its name—totally awesome! We'll definitely be back.
author: Julia Chin

review_text: The food was surprisingly very good, had the trio burgers. The Brioche burgers really elevates a burger experience. Also quite a few creative mocktails, a little on the expensive for mocktails but a good ending to complete the experience.
author: Damian Singapore

review_text:
As awesome as the name suggests.
Charming blend of nostalgia and surprise — set in a retro old-school shophouse, it offers a creatively curated menu full of variety, fusion twists, and delightful surprises that keep the dining fresh and memorable.

Love its potato crust pizza and healthy/herbal drinks
author: Joe Lee

review_text:
Came here out of curiosity after hearing many good things about the place. The turmeric curry is quite delicious. It's thick and goes well with the baguette. It also has small cherry tomatoes inside which provide a small burst of acidity. Interesting!

We had the pleasure of interacting with Kumar, who explained the dishes to us in depth and was very hospitable!

Place was about 90% full on a Sunday brunch timing. They did keep the music down and the ceilings are high, so not too noisy despite the crowd. 👍
author: YY

review_text: This place has such an awesome and cool concept of chinese hospital but also mordern singapore touches. The have a wide  variety of food and beverages! We tried their signature awesome burger (duck) and omg it was SOOO good, bread taste, texture, flavour and all! The wings and the posagna were also good! The outer of the shop looks abit rundown but the inside is really nice and vibey. We celebrated my friends birthday and the staff Kumar was so nice to give us a pineapple cake(which was also so warm and delicious sia!) We asked him for food rec as we were avit overwhelmed with the options at first but he was so patient and gave us really good food rec! such a good experience
author: wan ying

review_text: This café is definitely worth the visit for both its food and its photogenic appeal. The ambiance is cozy yet trendy. We tried several items, and each one was a hit. My personal favourite was the Pineapple Upside Down Cake which exceeded expectations.
author: GKN

review_text: Big thumbs up to Kumar for his friendly and attentive service! He really took care of us and made the whole experience even better. Together with the cosy café vibe, it was a perfect visit. Thanks, Kumar!
author: Tay Lee Nak

review_text:
This is a hidden gem, as an interesting find of delicious food of Asian and French mix combined with preserved cultural heritage (old shop house Chinese clinic).
I went there for meeting someone, not being very hungry, but when the food came I had to taste it and we finished everything (the duck meat which just fell of the bone, the potato pizza, the curry and real baguette).
Definitely a place to recommend!
author: Götz Lohmann

review_text: Beautiful space and lovely brunch! Tried their Basil Pesto Chicken wrap and chef specials canape. Its so good and my daughter loved it! Amazing food!
author: Elizabeth Elisha Ms Kueh

review_text: Had an amazing lunch at Awesome Cafe, highly recommended by Kumar! The food was delicious, the atmosphere was cozy, and the staff were friendly and attentive. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and will definitely be back. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great place to eat!
author: Celine Tan

review_text:
Amazing food , friendly and humourous boss and nice staffs
Special pineapple 🍍 upside down cake with sparkler and birthday song! Such a lovely nite and great service🥰
author: alyssa chen

review_text:
I had an amazing lunch here today with two of my colleagues, and everything was just perfect! The lady who served us was fantastic, and her recommendation of the pulled beef burger with scrambled eggs did not disappoint—it was absolutely delicious! The service, food, and ambience were top-notch. Plus, the lovely dessert was a great surprise. I’ll definitely be back! 😊

P.S. The badge is REALLY cute! Love the vintage vibes <3
author: Angel Tan

review_text: Nice relaxing brunch on a Sunday morning, big and good value breakfast set, Kumar was so accommodating and helpful by replacing scrambled eggs with delicious sunny side up. Interesting decor, Awesome experience.
author: Nupur Gupta

review_text: We ordered the spicy Thai beef salad and duck confit flatbread which were both beyond our expectations. Service was awesome by Gretchan and Franck.  Gretchan provided excellent suggestions. We enjoyed ourselves and will be back again.
author: Belinda Chin

review_text: Food is served fast and delicious too! The ambiance is nice and dark, suitable for relaxing date but may be crowded. Would come here again
author: JethroT

review_text:
Gretchen is one of the best and accommodative waitress who has gone the extra mile to serve my coworker who is vegan. She can't take onion or garlic, so Gretchen tried her best to provide a dish that suits her. That's what I called customer service and thinking out of the box! Not every place does this. We appreciate.

The environment and ambience is comforting, with all the decos.. red lanterns, old school calendar and "man-made spider webs".

Cheers and good night my awesome cafe.
author: Jason Lim

review_text: Really great atmosphere and food! We had the camembert, curry, burger and pozza. Highly recommended to come with a group of friends so you can try more of the menu.
author: Clarice Ng

review_text: Chef Kumar cooks excellent food and very very well plated, too. Jo is very knowledgeable about their menu and recommended a table full of gluten free yummies which all of us love ❤️ 😍  highly recommended if are GF 👍
author: Blue Moon

review_text: Awesome time at awesome cafe with wholesome food. Delicious delicate delicacy by team, Simon, Gret, Clement, Jo and Bathu. Fantastic Five serving up fantastic dishes on a Sunday cooling afternoon.
author: new4sg

review_text:
I've been walking past this cafe almost everyday for years. Sometimes I'll ask my colleagues to try, but they always say this place is too expensive.

So I decided to give it a shot one weekend. And I have to say I'm glad I tried. Worth every dollar.

Jo was amazing with the service and recommendations. Look for her if you all decide to come by. She'll take care of you. The curry with bread is amazing. I'll probably do chicken and prawns together the next time.

Oh I brought my dog too. Pet friendly place. 👍🏻✨
author: Nickyman

review_text: My first time visit My Awesome Cafe with my friends! We are served by Khaliff, he was friendly and humorous. The food are great! And the atmosphere beautiful! ❤️ Highly recommended! Will come back again! 😆
author: Sheryl SQY

review_text: Ordered the chicken and bacon burger, and Parma ham bruschetta. Portion was insanely huge and worth the price! Drinks were great and staff were very friendly! Would come back again!
author: Soh Jia Le

review_text:
Jo made our dining experience really pleasant, it was a very different setting overall. The staff here were really accommodating to our requests for a photo & went above & beyond.

Recommend to at least come here once for the experience!
author: Carissa Tan

review_text:
Ok. Have been coming to this place for years now, actually I think it was our last meal before lockdown. Food is great, and the menu is bigger than you would think for the quality of the food. This time I had the Thai beef wrap and the berry crush. The decor is wonderful.

For people who like to take photos and the food is secondary, please take some time to enjoy the food.

For those that enjoy the food, please take some time out to enjoy the decor. As it rocks.
author: Luke Staddon

review_text: Best bar in Singapore! And the owner is just the sweetest! Can’t recommend enough
author: Héloïse Marlier

review_text:
Lovely place where we enjoyed great dinner, drinks and desserts! Food is on point (we tried the burger and the “pozza”, while for dessert we had the upside down cake)
Drinks were tasty and innovative - we got to walk away with a lightbulb!
Place has got a lovely athmosphere and it honors the history of its building. Staff is super friendly, attentive and flexible. Definitely will visit again!
author: Aleks G

review_text: We stumbled upon this charming spot and absolutely loved it! The extensive menu offers both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, making it a great choice for any mood. A frozen drink was the perfect refreshment on a hot and humid day. I tried the Herbalicious, which had nostalgic notes of traditional Chinese medicine that was flavorful without the numbing bitterness that we remember as a kid. It was a great way to start before transitioning to the alcoholic The Charmer, another frozen treat. Paired with a fun charcuterie board, it made for a delightful, laid-back Sunday afternoon. Can’t wait to come back!
author: Denise Wong

review_text: Had a great time here celebrating my friends birthday! Kumar even brought us cake on the house and sang the birthday song along with us! 10/10 duck confit burger as well😋😋
author: Xin jie

review_text: Met a friend for lunch here and I must say I am impressed at the generous portion size! Delicious lunch. The service from Gretchen and Kumar were splendid. Keep it up team and I’ll be back!
author: Nicholas Goh Shyan Wei

review_text: Pretty good food but the service tops the cake. Had a good time with family celebrating 2 birthdays here. Thank you!
author: Jeannette Arielle

review_text: Great food and service from the lovely Mr Kaliff! Portions were also huuuuge! First time trying My Awesome Cafe and we will definitely be back :)
author: Vel Tan

review_text: Amazing food with the friendly staff, nice place for lunch!
author: Preeti Sharma

review_text: Good food. Generous portions. Friendly staff. Quaint and cool space. Nice place for gathering / hang-out.
author: Benedict Goh

review_text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Absolutely love My Awesome Café! The atmosphere is a perfect blend of vintage charm and cozy vibes, making it a great spot for catching up with friends or just unwinding with a good drink. The service is warm and friendly, with staff who genuinely care about the experience.

The drinks are well-crafted, whether you’re going for a cocktail, coffee, or something refreshing. The food is also a pleasant surprise—tasty, fresh, and thoughtfully presented. I especially enjoyed the pineapple cake , which was a standout.

Definitely a must-visit in Singapore if you’re looking for a unique and welcoming bar experience! Will be back for sure.
author: SUN YUYANG _

review_text: Awesome food, friendly service and great atmosphere for hanging out after work.
author: Alex Ho

review_text: This café in Singapore is an absolute gem! The atmosphere is warm, welcoming, and effortlessly cool — a place where you instantly feel at ease and right at home. The vibe, the people, and the food all come together perfectly to create an unforgettable experience. Every visit feels special, and it’s definitely a spot I’ll always make time for whenever I’m in Singapore.
author: Patrycja Węglorz

review_text: It's called My Awesome Cafe for a good reason. The food really IS awesome. We ordered one "My Awesome Sandwich" and one "Fluffy Croque Monsieur" and both were utterly delicious. We did not expect the portions to be so huge! Did a quick Google search for a good brunch place near our hotel, and this cozy and very cool place came up trumps. Great atmosphere on a Saturday lunchtime. Managed to get a table without a booking. Highly recommended!
author: Soulla Georgiou

review_text:
I had the most incredible dining experience at this restaurant! From the moment I walked in, I was welcomed by a warm and friendly staff. The ambiance was enchanting, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that set the perfect mood for the evening.

The menu was a culinary masterpiece, offering a wide range of mouthwatering dishes that catered to various tastes. I started with the recommendation and it was an explosion of flavors that left me craving more. their signature dish was nothing short of perfection. Every bite was a delightful journey for my taste buds.

The service was impeccable; our server was knowledgeable about the menu, attentive, and made excellent recommendations.
author: Shim Kl

review_text:
I’ve been wanting to come to My Awesome Cafe for the last 2 years, but somehow kept postponing my visit. Finally, today, I called them up and asked if we could do a walk-in. Bong picked up the phone and jollily told me that we’re more than welcome to come in.

After we sat down, Bong approached us to personally walk us through the menu. Thanks to his recommendation, we tried the Duck Confit Burger. It was SO GOOOOD. The duck almost tasted like shredded beef without feeling overly fatty, and the bun paired with the cheese was to die for.

Safe to say, we won’t wait another 2 years to come back!

Special shoutout to Bong for his incredibly cool personality and warm service, and shoutout to Jo for her great service!
author: Prema Rahman

review_text: So many interesting, delicious food and drink options! Healthy focus! Unique in their own way! Burger, soft bread!  Staff and boss v. friendly! Had insightful conversations with them. Will be back with friends, to try their menu again! ;)
author: Amy Hoon

review_text:
Visited at a Friday night with friends. Attended by a staff member, call Jimmy, he is very friendly and fun. Service is excellent and attentive. We like the duck confit burger, spicy lemongrass mushroom flatbread, and awesome salad.
We have a great time here. Definitely will visit this cafe again.
author: CARROT PEK

review_text:
I am fascinated by this former 中华医院building, which has been thoughtfully converted into a bistro café. Kudos to the owner for preserving the original structures and furnishings, allowing the building's history to be appreciated. The food and service are excellent, making it an ideal spot for those who enjoy peaceful moments. Highly recommended!

Dessert: up side down cake- pineapple cake with dip of creamy cream. Not sweet not feel too creamy. Super like this. Special thanks to Simon. A young guy with good services and passion service
author: fion Lee

review_text: The baked salmon was the star of the show - perfectly cooked, rich, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Every bite felt like a treat!
author: Ette

review_text:
Excellent place for food and drinks
The vibe of the place is warm and cosy. Thank you to Mandeep for his food recommendations and commendable service.will visit again :)
author: simran khaira

review_text: Love this place. Awesome everything, the folks who work there, the decor, the food, the ambiance. So much fun. Visited during CNY week and their snakes were gorgeous. A very special place. Awesome awesome awesome!
author: Siani E

review_text:
Awesome to the max! Potent dragon martini cocktail 🍸.. generous gin at 44% from France and Sabatini gin at 41.3% from Italy were intoxicating fabulous!
We had the French duck leg confit cheesy fortune pocket and it was such a comforting must try! Gretchen served us with a cheerful smile throughout the night 😀🤩 We love the signature 🍍 dessert cake🥰
author: C S

review_text:
This place caught our eye with its warm and cozy decorations, complemented by touches of Singapore history that add a unique charm.

We decided to go for a light and healthy meal, and it did not disappoint! The food was not only delicious but also packed with wholesome flavors, making it a perfect choice for a guilt-free treat.

The friendly staff and inviting atmosphere made the experience even better. It’s the kind of spot where you can lose track of time, just relaxing and soaking in the vibe.

Highly recommend for a chill day out!
author: air des

review_text:
Amazing food - we really enjoyed the beef cheek and prawn curry! The portions were great. We left super full. Very healthy ingredients used too so you don’t feel guilty eating the big portions :).
The staff were really friendly and welcoming and helped us decide on which dishes to choose.
author: Vivien Bradley

review_text: My Awesome Cafe truly lives up to its name! I had heard about this place for quite some time through friends…and on my visit to Singapore from Toronto this time I am really glad I made an impromptu stopover. Was only planning to take a peep as I was on way back from work meetings…but I am really glad that their longtime team member Mandeep Kumar persuaded me to have a drink. Starting with wine…I ended up staying for a delicious meal……an excellent ‘awesome salad’… a fabulous ‘pineapple upside down cake’….served warm with coconut  icecream….and of course a double espresso to top it all. I love my desserts…and the pineapple upside down cake was DELICIOUS!! The restaurant has an AWESOME vibe…great crowd…packed busy even on a weekday…thus clearly very popular. I was sitting alone in a busy restaurant….but Mandeep Kumar was very kind to make sure I was looked after very well. He certainly did make all the difference in having someone just take a casual peep and walk away….to instead having a lovely meal and a very enjoyable evening. Certainly plan to visit again. Thank you Mandeep Kumar! I think it certainly makes a difference when restaurants have frontline staff who have also worked in the kitchen as chefs. Hope to see Bong, Frank & Roland next time to congratulate them on establishing My Awesome Cafe.
author: Shalabh Kayastha

review_text: Kumar is awesome! We had an awesome meal with awesome drinks in an awesome cafe! Pet friendly too! Crowd is awesome and service is the awesomest!!!! They served my furson a bowl of water as soon as we were seated!! Love the vibes here!
author: Jeannie Ong

review_text:
This was our first breakfast/brunch in Singapore after moving here.

We were welcomed and looked after by the excellent and friendly staff. Debbie, in particular, was very kind and gave us some much appreciated tips for our new life in the country.

The food was delicious and portions huge.

I’m sure this will have been the first of many trips for us to My Awesome Cafe.
author: Rahul Rajesh

review_text: We had a great time with great food here, the atmosphere and waiting staff were amazing! Special thanks to the chefs, Simon, Clement, David and Subash for preparing a special dessert platter for us since we were a big group! ☺️
author: Jamie Tan

review_text:
The food was really good. We had the pulled beef burger and the duck confit burger—both were really satisfying and flavourful (though I personally prefer the duck). The bread is also ridiculously fluffy and soft and so easy to cut through. Also tried the slutty potatoes, and they were pretty good hehe. I’m super satisfied with the food here and would definitely recommend my fam and friends to come.

The atmosphere is also really nice. The decorations are beautiful and the service is really friendly. Thank u!!
author: Faith Lim

review_text:
First time to eat here and we were fantastically surprised with how the food tasted.  Well done!
Service was impeccable, attentive and proactive with the diners .
Bong sensed that we were not familiar with the menu and have made great suggestions. (Thanks for looking after us!) We ended up with Quesadilla duck confit , leaky Hags Sandwiches , Seafood Salad  and wash down with fresh Berry Beautiful , pumpkin orange smoothie and iced lemon tea .
Great Atmosphere  and will definitely coming back for more with our business guests in town !
author: Theresa Tay

review_text: Visited My Awesome Cafe together with my wife for dinner. Debbie explained to us the different foods on the menu. So it was quite easy for us to choose what we wanted. The cold platter with cheese is very good. The cheese tastes like freshly delivered from the Alps. 😋 the oven baked chicken was so tender, light and juicy. Delicious. Atmosphere is quite vibrant and the interior is filled with CNY decorations. We will come again to choose other dishes from the menu.
author: Ernst Cerjak

review_text: A little hidden gem along Amoy Street, The ambience is fun and quirky, the service and food are warm and yummy.  We enjoyed the food, my fav is the tumeric & ginger prawn curry and salmon pasta (new dish). We had the pleasure of meeting the owner Franck.when  he and the staff surprised us with an energetic birthday song accompanied by a squeaky toy chicken..lol. Thank you for making this a memorable birthday lunch.
author: Jen Lim

review_text:
Our first visit to this unique place.
"Chinese-looking" cafe serving "non-Chinese" food. Nice environment.
Food was good. Service was superb.
Initially it was quite overwhelming looking at the menu but Debbie came to our rescue. Debbie is friendly, happy and chatty. She was very attentive and made good recommendations. She seemed to know when "check" on us, asked about if we need anything and how we find the food etc.
We left satisfied with what we had and privileged to be served by Debbie👍👍👍👍👍. Stay awesome!
author: Baoparazzi Tan

review_text: We’ve a great time with our friend. The foods are good. Kumar is great and friendly.
author: Carrie Hon

review_text: Food was good and tasty, especially the pozzagna! Kumar was super friendly and helpful with his service too, recommending the food to us.
author: Frederick Tan

review_text:
Love the ambiance, food and the people!!!! Great service and every one in their team are all accommodating! No hard selling .. ask them for their suggestions based on your cravings and you’ll get the best! Franck, the French guy. il est magnifique! Gretchen the Filipina, is super nice!

Come and visit them, you’ll love it too!
author: C LOVE

review_text: 2nd visit. Food is still as great! Debbi is friendly with great hospitality. Will definitely return. :) atmosphere was rather noisy though. Went on a Friday night. super crowded, can’t really chill and have a conservation
author: Tiffy

review_text: Jo’s amazing service made our Sunday morning so much more special! Thank you for the hospitality. Amazing atmosphere, great food. Highly recommend. Very special place
author: R

review_text: Great food with nice atmosphere, a good place to chill with friends and awesome service by Jo! 👍🏻
author: meixiang xu

review_text: Ordered Oven Baked Salmon, Spicy Lemongrass Mushroom Flatbread & Duck confit burger to share among party of 4. All were delicious! Staff were very helpful to offer recommendations. Celebrating birthday & were given cake & birthday dessert on the house ❤️
author: Claudine Chew

review_text: The team at awesome cafe are phenomenal, it was so easy to communicate with them for event planning, the staffs on ground were superb and everyone had a great time. The food were very delicious and the spread of the buffet was displayed so thoughtfully. We had a great time, high recommend. 🤩
author: Ka Yan Chung

review_text: We had an absolutely wonderful dining experience here! The food was delicious and beautifully presented, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Our server, Kumai, made everything extra special—he was incredibly friendly, attentive, and helpful throughout the whole meal. Kumai went above and beyond to make sure we felt welcome and comfortable. Thank you so much for an unforgettable evening! We highly recommend this place and will definitely come back!
author: Bastien Leautey

review_text: This cafe has one of the most unique and vintage decors among the cafes here in Singapore. But above all, the staff here, Simon and especially Jolynn, were really friendly and their service was just impeccable. Jolynn heard that it’s my birthday and insisted to offer us a slice of cake on the house even though we said we were full (which was really yummy btw!). The food portions here are really generous and good for sharing, which makes it a great place for group gatherings. I can see why this cafe is so popular during lunch time. Will definitely be back soon to try their other mains!
author: Kristal Chua

review_text: Their duck confit was very good especially accompanied by a pate de foie gras toast and smoked duck breast
author: Felicia Koh

review_text: I love the food and juice, they taste so fine and extraordinary. The ambience is superb and most the staffs are very accomodating. I’d love to comeback here again when I go back to SG. I had the chance to take a photo with the Cafe Owner and the manager.
author: Maria Rochelle Barit

review_text:
Great vibes and deco at this place! We had the duck flat bread and the tumeric ginger curry with chicken - both dishes tasted awesome. Curry went well with the brioche bread 🍞
Will be back to try their other dishes! The staff who served us was very friendly too:)
author: Shonda Ng

review_text:
Food was superb, waitress was very polite and gave great recomendations on food.
Dessert was on the house and really delicious!
author: Timothy Lim
