Dinner, family of 3 with a 7 y/o child. The service by the floor lead and team was impeccable and excellent!

Sea Bass Crudo, we love this starter! Highly recommended!
Prosciutto, can't go wrong.
Halloween Special "Witches Cauldron Risotto", a pleasant surprise - the beef was tender and great!
Aus Wagyu Butcher Steak, it was good but didn't stand out as much as the starters and risotto. We might have spoilt ourselves too much before the main.
Tiramisu, a perfect ending.
author: Chee Ming Tan

review_text:
Overall great experience as food was good quality and cooked well. Service was nice and attentive. Unique pasta dishes that were definitely worth a try!

♿️ accessible
author: Tony Chan

review_text:
Opening in June 2023 as the in-house restaurant of the Mondrian Singapore Duxton hotel, Bottega Di Carna is a modern Italian restaurant offering an elegant, refined dining experience. Headlined by "The World's Greatest Butcher" and meat maverick Dario Cecchini, with Executive Chef Alastair Clayton and Chef De Cuisine Kenny Huang, Bottega Di Carna offers playful and creative plates that pay homage to the gourmet ingredients used.
.
Ambience at Bottega Di Carna calls to mind a Wes Anderson film set. Bright natural lights filter through the vast skylight, casting soft diffused light upon the gentle pastel coloured walls, marble-topped tables, and cushioned booth seats. Greenery within and without, quirky cursive fonts in the decorative wall scripts, and rounded mirrors lend the signature feel. A large open bar and open kitchen offers a view of the activity.
.
Service at Bottega Di Carna befits its status as a fine dining establishment. Staff accord each table personalised attention, demonstrating good product knowledge in describing dishes or beverages. They fulfil requests efficiently, and clean up quickly when diners leave. Great that they engage guests in conversation, and also check during the meal for feedback. Service recovery processes are decently defined and executed.
.
Food at Bottega Di Carna is modern Italian fine dining cuisine, with a focused menu comprising use of gourmet ingredients. No surprise that meat is a highlight, with exquisite aged cuts of beef flame-kissed by their josper grill. Handmade pastas and inventive appetizers round it out. Portions are sized for individuals but can be shared. Prices are relatively high, budget about SGD $97 per person for a meal with drinks here.
author: Ivan Teh

review_text: This is the place for steak. The pastas and the wines are great too. Can't say enough good things about Bottega di Carna. Shout out to Martin and the team. Love this place!
author: J Kuan

review_text: Excellent and sumptuous lunch BD celebration. Staff are passionate in what they are doing, impeccable food, wine, ambience and service. Thumbs up to chef and staff for making our day special with lots of cheers. Will certainly be back.
author: Maycia Hong

review_text: This got to be the best Italian Restaurant that I had been. All the food (Steak Tartare, Pici, Branzino Filet and Parmesan Fries and Aioli) that we ordered are very nice and the service is really top notch. Highly recommended.
author: Melion Tan

review_text: Great meal! Had the 1.5kg tomahawk which was really yummy :) Received complimentary tiramisu and Prosecco for our anniversary from Danial who was one of our main servers of tonight! He was very helpful in taking photos for us and helping me pack the tomahawk bone which I wanted to bring home 😆 Only downside is that the seats aren’t the most comfortable
author: Nicia Leong

review_text:
Mondrian Singapore : Dinner Tasting with my bro

Bottega di Carna is the vibrant modern Italian eatery by Dario Cecchini, also known as “The Greatest Butcher in The World.”

We were showcased a playful gastronomic experience and Italian classics with elements of Dario’s rebellious spin. A true expression of the Mondrian concept captivating community, heritage, art, fashion… pillars of a modern globe..

Refined Dining comes alive at the latest modern Italian dining place by Dario Cecchini. We went to Bottega di Carna at the newly commissioned eloquent modern hotel right in the heart of Duxton, bringing excitement and life to this vicinity - the  @mondriansingapore which is a vibrant modern Italian eatery, the brainchild of Dario Cecchini, who is also known as “The Greatest Butcher in The World.”

An entire array of playful yet delightful gastronomic Italian classics were showcased upon us with elements of Dario’s rebellious spin in an awesome culinary format. We sampled the SEABASS CRUDO consisting of grilled zucchini, lemon & marioram oil - so wonderful as I have not tasted anything like this before; the DARIO'S SIGNATURE STEAK TARTARE was amazing with a neat selection of smoked paprika, olive oil and lemon and the CARPACCIO DI CULO with seiso verde was just amazing!

The lovely Veuve Clicquot Yellow Label Champagne was a trustworthy companion that brought out finesse when paired with this bevy of starters combination.

For the main course, we chose the BRANZINO FILET comprising  grilled artichoke & salsa verde, exquisitely done and also the STOCKYARD RIBEYE 280Gm .. Australian Black Angus.. immaculate!

We couldn’t leave without dessert so we were given a taste of the VALRHONA CHOCOLATE FONDANT - a selezzione of cocoa nib tuile and homemade vanilla ice cream and also the TIRAMISU which is served at the table for two pax, love

Overall Rating : 9.3/10
Highly Recommended
author: Warren Kok

review_text: New establishment within Mondrian Duxton. Loved the ambience and natural sunlight in the restaurant. Service was adequate and standards of food were rather good. Particularly enjoyed the lamb and tiramisu. Tiramisu is a must order.
author: JERMINE

review_text: Amazing service team leader by Martin.  Thank you for the 5 star food and impeccable service.
author: Carolina Sam

review_text: Delicious food, lamb, beef and fish are fresh , tasty, and real good. Service is excellent, setting is relaxed with view to the garden. Reasonable priced. Top quality restaurant.
author: Tag Eric

review_text: Was there for a company event. The place is gorgeous and cozy, and the food was surprisingly good!
author: Alicia P

review_text: Probably one of my favorite places to dine at in Singapore! Service staff are always so incredibly attentive and amazing! I didn’t manage to get the names of everyone that was serving us however they never fail to impress! Martin is absolutely lovely and generous, as well as the hostess and Indian gentleman :) not to mention the quality of the food is consistently great every single time! The steaks and pasta are amazing, the atmosphere is just perfect even their playlist! Don’t miss out if you’re reconsidering dining here! A million thanks to the Bottega di Carna team & kitchen :)
author: Amirah Ashraf

review_text: Lovely ambience, friendly staff, great food. Martin was such a gentleman for moving our table back to some comfy seats while we were at the bar. Loved the steak, Burrata, calamari!!
author: Jamie Tan

review_text: My first time here with my family to celebrate my daughter’s 21st birthday. The service staff were exceptionally attentive. Big shout out to Hari who gave us excellent food recommendation and was exemplary in his service as well !
author: Mathis Lai

review_text: Super attentive and friendly staff. The restaurant is beautiful and perfect for special occasions. But just go for the food. The chefs are creating magic. Every dish we ordered was perfect. Easily my new fave restaurant in SG.
author: Druvi Rodrigo

review_text: Great for both gatherings and date nights. Zucchini noodles were a hit and so was the ravioli with feta cheese. Definitely a must-try
author: Jaslyin Qiyu

review_text: Service was too notch. Enjoyed dining here. Excellent food selection.
author: Krist Ser

review_text:
Super IG able environment
Food is amazing with very good service. The wine we picked was not very good and manager even willing change for us. I’ve been back twice since our first visit
author: Weirdo Chan

review_text: Wonderful enjoyable lunch inn celebration of a friend's birthday. Very special  thanks to chef Alvin & chef Kenny for delicious appetiser, main course & dessert. Also thanks to Martin, Sherica, Biby & team for great service. Highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family.
author: Hong Kwen Boo

review_text:
Grilled scallop, chilli and lime - Fresh. Good sauce.
Branzino fillet, anchovies and caper oil - Excellent. Crispy skin. Fresh. Good flavours. Large piece.
Tiramisu - Good.
author: Royal Pears

review_text:
Savouring Italian dishes while in the lavish Mondrian Singapore Duxton? Yes, please! Bottega Di Carna promises a hearty variety of Italian eats by iconic butcher Dario Cecchini, who crafts his dishes with a hint of Tuscany. As the hotel’s flagship restaurant, you will be greeted with a glamorous interior that will make you and your group of friends feel like you stepped into a magazine.

Moving on to the food, any meat lover's dream dish will be their Crocchette Di Carne, known as their Wagyu beef croquettes and garlic aioli. But for starters, those who have a penchant for seafood might partake in their Seabass Crudo, which comes with grilled zucchini, lemon and marjoram oil. Ever heard of cucumber yoghurt before? You will be surprised at how it pairs so well with their Lamb Cutlets and eggplant caviar.

Also, check out their monthly signatures from time to time or catch their Sunday Roasts, Weekday Set Lunch, and Saturday Brunch menus to switch up your appetite occasionally.
author: Vanilla Luxury

review_text: Had a great time at Bottega! A welcoming space with cosy ambience and warm service. Enjoyed the conversations and bespoke drinks by Kai which had awesome flavour combinations. Excited to head back for their food items and drinks again.
author: Caitlin

review_text: Came to this nice restaurant at Modrian hotel located at Duxton Hill. Loved atmosphere and all the food served. Service was excellent.
author: Mindy Tay

review_text:
New restaurant/hotel open in 2023, new and good ! The all day dining is Italian restaurant! Food is good and wonderful service!
The bartender Gary is helpful! They have home make limoncello! One of best in town!
author: 張力仁

review_text: Hari Saravanan and his team did a wonderful job to make sure that our orders and needs were taken care of ... The food n drinks were very good.
author: Rajendran Vijayanaman

review_text: can’t wait to be back for the beef, service was great and tomahawk was perfect! desserts were alright, but I’ll still return for the mains
author: leticia

review_text:
Amazing diner ! Food is amazing, especially this Branzino filet, absolutely stunning !
Thank you Axelle for your professionalism and your advice!
author: Tom SUBILEAU

review_text: An amazing lunch dining experience i had here. Food was great, service impeccable. Go for their ribeye steaks
author: Donna Leong

review_text: Love the soft bread they Serve, the tuna salad every bite feel so healthy and pumpkin soup with sunflower seeds interesting combination. Fish was v nicely done live every bite. End with chocolate light cake. Best combination if all. Love it 🥰 …
author: Erica Ong

review_text: wanted to show my appreciation for the team at BdC after organizing a weekday company lunch. the team was responsive, the food delightful and the ambience was unforgettable. thank you BdC
author: Dennis Chia (Dennis)

review_text:
✨Great service, friendly staff.
✨Stockyard grain fed ribeye (med rare), Pici
✨Moody, bar-like interior with intimate setting
✨Clean, well designed toilets.

😢pricey (but you get what you’re paid for)
author: Sean Ng

review_text: Waitress kavitha was super attentive & nice. We enjoy her service as well as the food here! Will be back! Thank you! (;
author: Ptyb

review_text: Fantastic restaurant, amazing food. Service first class and lovely atmosphere. Requested a quiet table and was given a nice cozy spot. Shout out to Shiheng who was the perfect host for our table
author: Elt Y

review_text: Loved every dish I had the other day. Service was amazing. I would go back again.
author: Cheyanne Chan

review_text: celebrated my birthday here and had lunch. chairs were a little uncomfy and the lights give off some heat but all that was more than made up for by the excellent food and service! a really memorable experience! food tasted great and presentation was amazing. service was impeccable. special thanks to Martin Pandey who made the occasion one to remember.
author: Julian K

review_text:
Food was well made and enjoyable. I have fond memories of the pasta with very tender beef and the beef steak we ordered.

Martin made the whole dining experience very memorable. He made us feel comfortable and the energy he brought to the lunch experience was well appreciated. Kudos to him!
author: Ryan Tay

review_text: The food was great, the service was excellent. Would definitely come back again. Thank you for the experience
author: Keith Yong

review_text:
Celebrated a very important day here and everything exceeded our expectations.

The food was great, with exceptional service and recommendations from the staff.
The food was very reasonably priced for the quality and taste. Really enjoyed the Octopus, Beef Tartare, Pici Pasta and Tiramisu

The service staff were really attentive as well.

We had some enquiries about  venue bookings, and the manager Mr Maran very kindly spent time to talk to us in detail about all our questions and was very prompt with their follow ups.

Would strongly recommend a visit here
author: Tristan Chay

review_text:
We simply enjoyed dinner.  We had the wagyu beef croquettes and the eggplant parmigiana- which was yummy!  The fish was too food!
But it was the service staff who made the whole dining experience memorable. Special mention goes to Hari - who explained  in detail whichever food u were gonna select.

And the ambience - sinply loved it! Wud definitely come back here even if its  just for their vast selection of red/white wine & startes.
author: ANITHA

review_text: Excellent food prepared by chef Alvin/chef Kenny and good service from the staffs Sherica/Vivy/manager.  Highly recommended to visit.
author: Karen Koh

review_text: Celebrated a birthday there- really nice atmosphere, food (ribeye ravioli fries) were delicious!!!
author: Jeanne

review_text: Awesome delicious food !! Thank you very much especially Chef Alvin and Chef Kenny  😋😋 Great service  from n  Biby 🥰 will more friends 😍 Thank you !!
author: judy ong

review_text: Excellent service, great ambiance and food😋 Especially the PICI, trying the steak next!
author: Yu Shen

review_text: Amin provided excellent service, and the food was delicious. The ambience is really cosy, as the restaurant incorporates a lot of glass windows, allowing natural sunlight to provide a warmth to the restaurant. Would go again!
author: Samuel Yap

review_text: Lovely Restaurant Manager who takes care of your overall experience and quality of food. The atmosphere is amazing and not loud during dinner rush. The food is delicious but a bit punchy.
author: Edmond Chan

review_text: fillet mignon was so good, wonderful service team!
author: ehs s.

review_text: Had a really enjoyable dining experience at BDC! The food was great, with zucchini noodles, pici and tiramisu as particular standouts. As a pasta person, the pasta dishes are very traditional Italian (all handmade of course) focusing on the freshness and quality of the ingredients rather than being too “overcrowded” with ingredients in other lesser Italian restaurants. Service was spectacular and in particular, Burn was fantastic - naturally charismatic and pays good attention to what your preferences and recommending complementary dishes. All in all a great night!
author: Chen Yang Sia

review_text: Amazing service by Gary and team! Food was delicious too - the Branzino fillet in particular. Beautifully designed space, pity the room was a tad too cold with the AC blasting at high levels.
author: C Peh

review_text: had a super lovely time here, staff were all amazing and food was really good for the price, keen to come back! love the greenery and the overall vibe of the place
author: kate

review_text: I loved the steak tartare and the 500 g angus Striploin
author: ryan chua

review_text:
Had a great dinner at Bottega di Carna. Great steak, beef tartare and pici (pasta).

Special shout out to Vinod for his amazing service. He was attentive and had great recommendations for our dishes and wines. We enjoyed our dinner and are looking forward to returning soon!
author: Peishan C

review_text:
Pricy but food and wine are good.
Take note that they have a dress code.
author: Maurice Wong

review_text: I have to say that the service was impeccable. All the floor staffs were attentive to diners needs. I like to personally commend floor lead Mr hari saravanan for his examplary customer satisfaction in handling diners feedback. I order their signature steak tartare, ribeye steak. My pasta was frst delivered uncooked and he promptly had it recook again. After ending the meal. He asked if everything was OK. I told him the pasta was still not exactly good and he offered to extend me some desserts which I kindly refused as I'm not a dessert person. After handling the bill he offered to write off the pasta and i tried to politely decline and say it doesn't matter. He took it in his stride that he wants to offer diners the best. Such examples are rarely seen in today's restaurant dining. His willingness to serve and offer a complete dining experience was heartwarming. I have yet to try other other food on the menu. Will definitely be back again.
author: Gabriel Lin

review_text: Harry at the breakfast buffet has provided some of the finest service we have encountered on our many worldly travels. Definitely an 11/10 for every aspect.
author: Domenico

review_text:
Harry and Sini were very helpful. The best service I could have asked for.
I was so impressed, we will definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends. They made us feel so appreciated.
author: Joanne Kalergis

review_text:
Went there once during chinese new year eve, loved the atmosphere and the very accommodating waiters and waitresses.
Went once again in march for a birthday dinner, glad to say the staff were very accomodating with us bringing outside cakes in and even offered to cut it for us
Good place to come for meals
author: Strike11

review_text: Bold in its private little way, albeit a stark contrast from the person it was famous for.
author: A Chen

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:
I had a wonderful dining experience at The Halia in the Botanic Gardens. The grilled focaccia was perfectly crisp and flavorful, a delightful starter that set the tone for the meal. The pan-fried mixed greens were fresh, beautifully seasoned, and cooked to perfection.

Beyond the food, the ambience was serene and inviting, making it a perfect spot to unwind surrounded by lush greenery. The service was impeccable—attentive and friendly without being intrusive.

Highly recommend this gem for anyone looking for great food in a tranquil setting!
author: Whel Chiaoco

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:
I had an unforgettable dining experience at The Halia Restaurant. From the moment we arrived, the ambiance was serene and welcoming—nestled in the lush greenery of the Botanic Gardens, it truly felt like a hidden gem.

We were celebrating my boyfriend’s birthday, and the staff went above and beyond to make the evening feel special. Their thoughtful touches and attention to detail truly made the celebration memorable.

The service was warm, attentive, and professional. The staff made us feel well taken care of without being intrusive, and their knowledge of the menu was impressive.

As for the food—absolutely delicious. Every dish was thoughtfully presented and packed with unique flavors. The signature Halia chili crab pasta was a standout—perfectly spiced and beautifully balanced. The desserts were equally memorable, especially the ginger nougat parfait which offered a lovely twist.

Highly recommend The Halia for anyone looking for a peaceful, elegant dining experience with great food, top-notch service, and a beautiful setting—especially for special occasions. We’ll definitely be back!
author: Nur Amalina Aminol Rashid

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:
We recently celebrated our wedding at The Halia Restaurant (The Villa & Batik Ballroom), and it was truly a memorable experience for us. It was a joy to share this special occasion with our family, relatives, colleagues, and friends.

Lydia, who was in charge of events, was  patient and helpful throughout the planning process. She consistently went the extra mile to assist us, especially when there were changes to our plans.

The food was excellent—many of our guests shared that they thoroughly enjoyed it. A special thank you also goes to John and his team for their outstanding service. We felt very well taken care of throughout the celebration.

Overall, we are extremely happy with our experience at The Halia. The team truly exceeded our expectations, and we highly recommend this venue for any event, especially weddings.
author: Fizzly

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Celebrated birthday dinner here and the ambience is just perfect. Food quality is delicious with portion made for two. Jeremy has been amazing and very attentive. He took care of us from the beginning until the end along with his other colleagues. Five stars for the amazing experience given. Won’t hesitate to return again the next time!
author: Raja Noor Ashikin

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:
We had an absolutely wonderful experience at The Halia while celebrating my mom’s birthday with a group of seven. Although we initially didn’t realise that the weekend brunch menu differs from the weekday lunch menu, the staff (Malay lady with coloured scarf, without glasses) went above and beyond to accommodate us. One of our favourite dishes wasn’t on the brunch menu, but the team graciously checked with the chef—and to our delight, they made it happen!

The service was impeccable throughout—warm, attentive, and thoughtful. They even assisted us with wheelchair access for my mother-in-law, making sure she was comfortable and well taken care of. These small touches made our celebration truly memorable.

The setting, the food, and most importantly, the care from the staff made this a perfect afternoon. Highly recommended for anyone looking to dine with heart and hospitality!
author: Sufian Mawasi

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Lovely place to dine after walking in the hot Singapore Sun! Beef ribs were so good! Hallibut with rice was divine. Special shoutout to Jeremy who was our waiter for his amazing service and humour.
author: Irsyad Alif Abdullah

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: I'm so grateful for this special dinner with the people who matter most in my life. This place is perfect for celebrating love and connection. Thank you for making it happen Mr Wee, Family & ThaiPore.
author: Christopher Yap Ju Long

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: The food and ambience was great! Good vibes and good food! But what made the experience even better was the service given to us by our server, Fikri. Promptly taking our orders and offering recommendations, to helping my parents prepare a birthday surprise for me in the form of dessert and a candle! 😊 Thanks Fikri and Halia for making my 23rd a special one 🤍

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569

author: A. Natasha

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:

I have put 5* for all since the service is excellent, food good quality and price very competitive ($60+ for the 3 courses menu). Just note no alcohol because it's halal
