restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: One of the most nicest and memorable dining experience  I've ever had. Love the delicious food especially the rib eye and smoke salmon. Marvellous  and friendly service by Mr Jeremy. Thank you for the ice cream given to my son on his birthday. 🥰😋😋🥰
author: Nurbaini Yunos

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:
Great tasting food and excellent service!
I loved the cumin, ginger and cinnamon juice fusion! Sir Ryan is a great host and so hospitable.
The food is superb!!!
author: FURION GARLITOS

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:
I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant! The food is 100% halal and absolutely amazing — every dish was flavorful, fresh, and perfectly prepared. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, and the service made the experience even better. A special thank you to Rayan, our waitress, who was incredibly kind, attentive, and professional — he made us feel truly taken care of.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for delicious halal food and outstanding service!
author: Dr. Eman Mualla

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Organised a company dinner here. Seamless service from start to end. Delicious and filling 3-course dinner. Recommended for intimate weddings, parties and other events. Shoutout to Jenn, Mazni and Nabil for the great assistance in making our event a success!
author: FN N

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Great meal after a walk in the botanic gardens. The mushrooms were really good we got two of them:) The atmosphere is quiet and nice, definitely recommend! Thanks to John for the nice service!
author: Enya Seong

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Took us a while to reach the restaurant as we walk all the way from MRT station. Greeted by friendly staffs with nice food and atmosphere. Will come again.
author: Siew Lee Hiew

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Our 3rd visit here. It was raining heavily that night, so Francis called ahead to tell us so and remind us to bring an umbrella. Short of actually sending a valet service to pick us from the car park, it was indeed a nice touch. Food has improved significantly from before. We ordered 4 mains  - crab spaghettini, halibut, chicken and the ribs and 2 light mains - pulled beef and burrata. Loved the spaghettini, halibut and the chicken, ribs were so so.. or could it be because we were already quite stuffed when it was finally served? :). Service was excellent from John and Chan - Attentive without being intrusive. New plates were changed fairly frequently. Atmosphere could have been better had it not been raining - they had to put the blinds down to stop the rain from coming in but it still was rather cosy with nice subtle lighting. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience this time around. Thanks to John, Chan, Francis, the chef and staff of the Halia again for making it a nice night out for the family.
author: Hanif Mohamed

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Had an amazing experience at Halia restaurant. The food was so delicious. We had the lamb, truffle fries, octopus and halibut. The lamb was cooked to perfection. It was soft and seasoned quite well. The staff was nice and made guest feels comfortable. The whole ambience was cozy and warm.
author: Aliff Sarwan

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text:
Actually, there is not many halal restaurants that really taste good. But today I am so surprised that The Halia actually deliver it so well. Good environment, great service, food is amazing👍🏻 truffles fries is so good, steak done very well , flavourful and tender. Dessert was good too but quite small portion.

Will definitely come back again

P.s: just small recommendations, due to the main dish portion is small. Maybe can serve some complimentary bread stick , etc. it will improve the dining experience and compromising on the small portion of the main dishes.
author: Jenie Lim

restaurant_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
restaurant_address: 1 Cluny Rd, Ginger Garden Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569
review_text: Love breakfast so much. Bacon and sausage not too salty. Bread soft and has nice crust. Love vibes bf in open
author: Hula La

review_text:
Certainly worth a visit if in Singapore…
Choices abound - and prices are reasonable considering the high profile of this food destination.
Great that you can just leave an item to secure your seat whilst making choices (I left my backpack) and know it is safe.
author: PhotoCoffee Warnbro - Café Mead

review_text: A must-visit hawker centre in the heart of Chinatown, packed with history & local flavour. From the legendary Hainanese Chicken Rice to handmade Fuzhou oyster cakes & hearty porridge stalls, there’s something here for everyone. It’s open-air & gets crowded during lunch, so come early or in the evening for a more relaxed experience. Bring cash & come hungry!
author: L Chan

review_text:
The place boast many good food. So it isnt fair to rate it on what we ate...
We went with the intention to try their "western" food, seeing how the Q snakes all the time.

We tried from:
夜来香 (Ye Lai Xiang Tasty Bbq) - chicken chop (juicy!! The sauce's flavours really good too!) And fish and chips (crispy and flavourful. soft, note not mushy, inside) portion's huge and price reasonable as well.
Chicken chop was 9.50
Fish and chip 10.00

2) taste. Fusion hainaness chicken chop.
Salty. Eaten w rice is fine.
author: Jolyn Fang

review_text:
I came here on a mission,to try what many call the best Hainanese chicken rice in the world. The line was long, but totally worth it. The chicken was tender, the rice fragrant, and the chili sauce packed just the right punch.

The entire hawker centre is filled with delicious options, but this one stall stood out. You can feel the energy and passion from the staff, and the food speaks for itself.

If you’re visiting Singapore, don’t miss this. Just be prepared to queue!
author: ChuLuxe Explorer

review_text:
Maxwell Food Centre is hands down one of the best places to experience authentic Singaporean hawker food—a true paradise for anyone who loves bold flavors, local culture, and hearty meals at unbeatable prices.

Right in the heart of Chinatown, the vibe is buzzing yet welcoming, with locals and tourists coming together over steaming bowls of noodles, sizzling satay, and world-famous Hainanese chicken rice. And yes, Tian Tian Chicken Rice lives up to the hype—moist, flavorful chicken, fragrant rice, and a chili sauce that hits just right. It’s legendary for a reason.

But what really makes Maxwell stand out is the variety. From crispy Fuzhou oyster cakes to comforting fish soup, laksa, dim sum, and even fresh sugarcane juice, there’s something here to satisfy every craving. I loved that many of the stalls have been run by the same families for generations—you can really taste the passion in every bite.

The food is incredibly affordable, portions are generous, and everything is served fresh and fast. Seating is communal and casual, which only adds to the charm—just grab a tray, find a seat, and dig in.

If you want to eat like a local and experience the soul of Singapore’s food culture, Maxwell Food Centre is a must-visit. I’ve been twice on this trip alone, and I’d go back again in a heartbeat.

Rating: 5/5
author: Shane McLean

review_text: Food lovers delight and easy to browse everything before deciding. One of the cleaner food centres and easy intro spot for tourists. Tian Tian wasn’t opened at the time but we followed another queue for Haianese chicken rice and it was fabulous. Lots of noodle options and refreshing drinks for the kids. Would return.
author: A2B in an EV

review_text:
Delicious food, went there for lunch. Too many to choose from. Wanted to try everything 😂
Finally tried store 35. They make delicious fried oyster omelette 😋
Will be back for more next time
author: Will Kueh

review_text: Probability on of the best food centre in Singapore. Usually crowded, but the food is quite good. A lot of dealers do not take Mastercard or Visa, so make sure to have some cash. There are two ATMs so no problem withdrawal on place. Also a good place to meet new people. Enjoy.
author: Fuori Onda

review_text:
What a banger of a place! Absolute chaos, heat, smells and vibes!

Go with anything - you won’t be wrong once! However, Hainanese chicken is …
author: Morgan B

review_text: I came here for a late breakfast. Not all of the vendors were open but we still had a lot to choose from. We decided to try Laksa, popiah and hainanese chicken rice. Everything was delicious (especially the chicken). Service was fast and prices low. Amazing atmosphere
author: Michał Sidorowicz

review_text:
Visited Lau Pa Sat during the famous Satay Night and it was such a memorable experience. The whole street transforms in the evening—filled with the smoky aroma of freshly grilled satay, lively crowds, and that unique Singapore food market vibe.

Of course, we had satay, which was perfectly grilled and paired with rich peanut sauce. We also tried other stalls and ordered sugar cane drink, mango sticky rice, and luncheon meat fried rice—all tasty and worth it.

It’s not just about the food, but also the ambience. The energy, the flavors, and the mix of locals and tourists make it a must-visit when in Singapore.
author: Pat Dimayuga

review_text: An open street food inside an open dining food hall. The food options are plenty and food is really good. You can't go wrong and we ordered from the popular and less crowded stalls and to our surprise, some of the less popular stalls are really good too. Sorry for the eaten food in the pictures but I was really hungry 😋
author: Jimmy L.

review_text:
There are so many choices here—you definitely won’t be able to try everything in one visit. I’ve been here three times, and every food and drink I’ve tried has been absolutely delicious.

People say this place is also famous for its accommodations, though I haven’t had the chance to experience that yet.

It’s always busy and packed with people, especially during mealtimes, so finding an empty seat can be a bit of a challenge.
author: afrizal

review_text: Literally the best hawker that serves so many of us during weekday lunch time and turns into a lit satay party during the nights. I enjoy their hokkien mee and Butter & Cream the best. Just try as much of their food as possible!
author: Jolene Pek

review_text: The food is great and the atmosphere fantastic. There were so many choices to eat, we decided to purchase from different hawker stalls and share. I can see why this establishment is so popular, the building itself is a work of art.
author: Jeff OHalloran

review_text: Very lively hawker. Loved satay street! We liked it so much we went twice. Take your time and walk around to all of the stalls. Try stall 8 for satay! It picks up a lot after 7 or 8 pm!
author: Faraz Kajani

review_text: Lau Pa Sat is a must-visit in Singapore! There were so many food stalls to choose from, and everything we tried was absolutely delicious. The variety was impressive – something for every taste – and the food came out surprisingly fast despite the crowds. The lively atmosphere and historic setting made it even better. A fantastic spot for authentic, affordable, and tasty local eats!
author: Caitlin Rajkumar

review_text:
This place is so insanely good - you literally have tens of different booths with every possible Asian quisine there is - and some of them are just masters of their trade. Like the one with chicken rice. Man, this is a religious experience. Or like 20 years ago there was this Korean grill place. I was so disappointed not to see it again, but then I went all around and guess what? Found at least ten booths with amazingly good food. And I never tried even a quarter of them. Not enough time and my stomach is not big enough. Ask anything, if they speak good enough English, they will explain. If not, not to worry. Just get a small portion, it most probably will be worth a try.
And the prices! Man, it’s such a great value!!!
author: Maciek Goralski

review_text:
One of the most popular Food Centre you must visit in Singapore, well known by local and tourists.
Come in after 7pm to the satay street to enjoy the satay, BBQ prawn and many... and embedded in the fantastic ambience.
There are many local and foreign delight to be discover here.
author: Loh Ricky

review_text:
Such fun!!!
Satay street out the back.
All sorts of cuisines inside.
Yum. We were repeat visitors.
Atmosphere, atmosphere, atmosphere.
Open 24 hours.
Options for breakfast, lunch and dinner!!!
Knock yourself out!
author: Stefan Poropat

review_text:
Lau Pa Sat is one of my favorite food courts in Singapore. There are so many food options here and the whole place is lively and full of energy. Today I tried grilled stingray with curry paste. At first, I didn’t even realize it was stingray until my friend told me, but it was seriously delicious. The curry paste tasted like Thai panang curry, but milder. It came with a dipping sauce that reminded me of Thai chili shrimp paste with a sour and salty kick and bits of shallot. I loved it so much I wanted to bring some home.

I also had grilled chicken wings with crispy skin that felt almost like roast duck. And of course, we had mixed satay with pork, chicken, and shrimp. We ordered a small set, and even with three people, we couldn’t finish it all. The satay was really good and there are so many stalls to explore. I also tried the garlic fried prawns and they were packed with flavor.

If you’re in Singapore, this is a must-visit spot. Great food, local vibe, not expensive, and super satisfying.
author: ChuLuxe Explorer

review_text: We had an amazing food experience at Lau Pa Sat, especially at Best Satay 7 and 8! The smoky aroma from the grill was irresistible, and the satay was flavorful, juicy, and perfectly grilled. We tried both chicken and beef, and both were tender and well-marinated. The peanut sauce was rich and complemented the skewers perfectly. The lively street vibe added to the charm, making it a must-visit spot in Singapore for authentic local street food. Definitely a highlight of our trip!
author: Rocky Cyre Frilles (Arky)

review_text:
It is the only hawker market I visited in Singapore, so I have nothing to compare it against.
But we had a great time there..!

The satay (stall 8) was delicious! Though the person controlling the line was quite rude to a lot of people.. But the meat was well cooked and worth the 10-15 min wait!

The entire area was bustling, crowded, and high energy with everyone having a good time!

The food inside the hawker market was amazing too!

Incredible choice and variety and very reasonable!

Overall it was a really fun experience…!
author: Sanaya Bharucha

review_text: After visiting Singapore for over a decade, it seems ironic that this was only our very first visit to this iconic eatery and we had an incredible time. The decor and history of the site were fabulous and there are so many choices. It is very spacious with good ceiling height and ventilation. There is literally something for everybody. Although there were lots of people, it never felt crowded at all and you have choices to sit both inside or outside. We ordered a mixture of seafood, noodles and satay and all of them were delicious! We had an absolutely fabulous evening!
author: DR. ALVIN TUNG

review_text:
This review is for satay street alone, specifically stall 7 and 8. Yes, they're the busiest stall with a line. If you don't mind the wait (about 30 mins to get the food), then this is the place for you. If you don't like waiting , there's like 7 other stalls , some with more exotic items than others. I saw stall 6 had satay squid and coconut rice in addition to the normal chicken , beef , and shrimp. If I had more room I would've tried it!

As of the inside, there's plenty of seatings. If you like to be outside and have an ice cold beer, there's seats for that too! Do not miss out on lau pa sat!
author: Jack Chau

review_text:
Absolutely awesome and one of the best street food markets in the world, basically because is under a roof. As every street marked there’s plenty of vendors among tables and seats to eat.

This market serves most Asian dishes, specially focused on local dishes but not limited to Indian, Thai, Filipino and Chinese (among others)

Of course it’s a place to go eat affordable and fast dishes and although isn’t a reason not to leave 5* it gets overcrowded and it’s hard to walk around with a  tray
author: Marcos O. Diogo

review_text: The vibes & atmosphere are amazing, esp at 7:00pm when the roads are closed for the Satay Club (Road), hot tip: order just before 6:45pm so that you get a table right at 7:00pm and you can start enjoying your meal quickly. Even as a local, I enjoy being here and appreciate the Lau Pa Sat experience. 👍
author: Clinton Goh

review_text:
If you're a foodie like myself...Lau Pa Sat is not to be missed when you’re in SG. Me and my mom had dinner here and we had Fish Sauerkraut and it was just wow! For the price of about $25 nothing else to ask. Hawker food  is unlike anything I've experienced.

Absolutely awesome and one of the best street food markets in the world, basically because is under a roof. As every street marked there’s plenty of vendors among tables and seats to eat.

This market serves most Asian dishes, specially focused on local dishes but not limited to Indian, Thai, Filipino and Chinese (among others)

Had the sugarcane juice after that and that was the very first time I have had it. My gosh travelling really makes you try different foods /drinks you have never had before!!
author: Maricar Peralta

review_text:
This is my first time visiting Singapore. I was walking from my hotel looking for halal food, and I'm amazed by how inclusive Singapore is. It's a very informative country—they even separate halal and non-halal food.

Lau Pa Sat is like a food court with a lot of food choices: Chinese, Japanese, Indian, Indonesian, Malay, and Western cuisine.
If you're a Muslim, just look for the halal logo, it is easy to spot. Or you can just ask them.

The food is good, although I've only tried one dish so far.

Most of the food here is self-service. You place your own order, and you need to return your food tray to the designated area based on halal or non-halal categories.
author: Handi Prabowo

review_text:
It was raining, but in the name of food, my husband and I still went to Lau Pa Sat—no regrets! I love the place! It’s clean, lively, and packed with so many food options. There’s Korean, Thai, Malaysian, Indian, and even some Middle Eastern food (I think?). I even spotted a Filipino stall, which was a nice surprise!

The place was absolutely jam-packed, but that just made it feel even more exciting. There are also lots of drink options, including alcoholic ones, so you can really enjoy the vibe. Overall, it’s a must-visit if you love food as much as I do!  Sorry I only took a few photos.
author: Mary Ann

review_text:
“A food paradise in the heart of Singapore!”
Lau Pa Sat is a must-visit. The satay street that comes alive at night is iconic — smoky, lively, and full of flavor. So many food options, from local faves to international picks. Affordable, authentic, and always buzzing!
author: Raditya

review_text: Good and can enjoy food with different type. Singapore food, Chinese, Indian, Japan, Arabic and so many different food items can be enjoy with great variety. Also sweet items, coffee and tea, different juices are available. Can enjoy a lot. Also sathe are available to enjoy.
author: Uthpalavi Dias

review_text: Great food options on a budget. We had dumplings and hot pot. The place is much cleaner than all the hawker streets I have been to in Singapore.
author: Shovna M

review_text:
Great Hawker centre, I highly recommend.
Amazing authentic & delicious food at every stall.
Can get very busy but worth it.
Only been in Singapore 2 days and been twice and will return.
author: Justin Keyte

review_text: Fantastic dining experience in Singapore CBD. It has amazing food and drinks. It offers classic food and some exotic food but for me I searched for Vegetarian and had a good bite of Indian Biryani. Lots of foreigners and office employees visit. It seems like it's a great hang out place for CBD office gangs as well as for those who like to visit Merlion afterwards in which we did. So it's a great combination to visit Lau Pa Sat and after that we walked to One Fullerton area and Merlion place. Evening stroll is amazing and the weather was nice for us. From Merlion side you can potentially see the music water fountain from Marina Bay Sands as well. What a wonderful sight to visit especially after fulfilled dinner at Lau Pa Sat.
author: Nanda Linn Aung

review_text: One of the famous hawker in Singapore, located in the city center and easy to reach. There are many choices of food ranging from snacks to heavy meals. My favorite here is Best satay no.7 & 8 for dessert there are Butter & Cream and Munchie pancake.
author: Laila Lathifu

review_text: We had dinner at Lau Pa Sat today and it was amazing. I love this concept of hawker centres which bring together numerous sellers doing multiple cuisines which not only offers choice of food but also provides the convenience. We had a mix of black pepper crab with vegetables, mix duck and rice, chicken beef and prawn Satay with Won Ton noodles. The food was reasonably priced and is made fresh. A great way to have dinner out, the only complaint is the heat which on a night like today will get extreme. Highly recommend a visit there.
author: Sanka Illangakoon

review_text:
We had a great time with friends. Easy to get tables. Lines are reasonable and do not get too long. Priced reasonably compared to other establishments. Great selection of food. Clean and neat environment.

Expect it’s crowded and noisy. But overall, great place to explore food.
author: Kristia Añonuevo

review_text: A must go for all foodies out there. Has a diverse choices of restaurants to choose from. All dishes you like to try will surely be available here. Drinks are also available and there lots of choices to choose from. They even close a portion of the street for the rows of satay bbq stalls. So fantastic and festive feel and ambience.
author: SHARE TV

review_text: There was a party vibe on the satay street that was like a huge party in the middle of the street. There is a lot of smoke on the street, and it can be seen and smelled from a long distance away. As we ordered satay sticks from 'Best Satay 8,' all the other satay sticks that we tried were equally good and not different from the one we ordered. So many options for drinks on different stalls. The satay sticks were so good that we ordered like almost 50 of them.
author: Priyanka Patel

review_text: Adam Food Centre is one of to go-to whenever I’m craving local food. So many great stalls in one place — from nasi lemak and mee goreng to satay and prawn noodles. Everything is packed with flavour and reasonably priced. It gets busy, especially at night, but totally worth the wait. The vibe is lively, and there’s plenty of seating. A proper makan spot for sure. Highly recommend if you’re in the area!
author: Lau Guan Zhen (Sean)

review_text: Nice and cozy hawker center. The foods are delicious and value for money.
author: Rajes Varan

review_text:
was here with friends for early dinner (around 5pm-ish). the place wasn't crowded (yet) during our visit. just feel that the quality of food is not as good as before and compared to the ones in newton.
what we ordered:
seafood fried rice (from the chinese stall). it was tasty enough. however i think the seafood wasn't fried together with the rice. it was placed at the bottom.
satay and bbq chicken. the taste was good. chicken satay was juicy but the mutton and beef were quite hard to chew.
stingray was also good. i like it spicy that way.
fresh lime juice was a little too sweet. but probably just had to wait a while more for the ice to melt so it'll be less sweet.
overall the meal was okay.
author: Karen Kalad

review_text:
"Nasi Singapura" stall #3 (bright yellow signboard) within this food centre, serves THE BEST nasi lemak in Sg in my opinion...their sambal is superb! Brought me back to my childhood in pri sch where sambal used to be solid, more spicy than sweet than it is nowadays. The abang and kakak in the stall also super friendly and best part, dont stinge on the sambal.
Whatever Ingredients u wanna add to nasi lemak dont matter so long as u have the rice n sambal...ENJOY!
author: Metal Bhai

review_text: Adam Road Food Centre, established in 1974, has a rich background as one of Singapore’s most beloved hawker centers. Conveniently located near the Botanic Gardens, it’s a great spot for late-night food and my favorite hawker centre of all time. Famous for dishes like the iconic nasi lemak from Selera Rasa and the rich mutton soup, this hawker center also offers a wide range of local favorites, including satay and mee goreng. With affordable prices, a clean and bright atmosphere, and generally available parking, it’s a must-visit for both locals and tourists.
author: C

review_text: Free sitting, usually no chopping of table. No cooking smells in the hawker centre, Cleaners are efficient, well manner. Simple food favour by many. Repeat visits as Hawkers have a good attitude. Price is affordable. Parking is easy, Public transport is convenient.
author: Christopher Lim, CLU, ChFC

review_text:
Adam Road Food Centre- a place to get cheap local food.
Wide variety of local yummy food.
I am here for the prawn noodles. There are also a lot of other food to try, including halal food.
The place is clean, all thanks to the super efficient cleaners.
Maybe a bit warm in the afternoon, best to sit at the table near the fans. And luckily, there are many fans around.

Do note of the queue during peak period and the need to queue for a car park slot as well.
Best to avoid the lunch crowd!

A sure must go place to eat!
Strongly recommended.
author: DR DAVY GOH

review_text:
If you’re a fan of nasi lemak, this hawker stall is a hidden gem you absolutely need to try. The coconut rice is fragrant and fluffy, cooked to perfection without being overly rich. The sambal is the real star – slightly sweet, with a nice spicy kick that lingers just enough to make you crave the next bite.

Their fried chicken is crispy on the outside and juicy inside, well-marinated and full of flavor. The ikan bilis and peanuts are super crunchy, and the egg is always cooked just right. Everything is served hot and fresh, even during busy hours.

Portion sizes are generous for the price, and the service is friendly and efficient. Whether you’re here for a quick lunch or a hearty breakfast, this nasi lemak will hit the spot. Highly recommended for both locals and tourists looking for authentic local flavors!
author: L Sun

review_text: Adam road food centre has really good prawn noodle! it is slightly pricey at $12 for the big prawn but it’s quality prawn and broth justify the higher pricing. Would be better if they give more soup as it is really addictive haha. Tried the mee gorang got surprised by the wok hey taste. Awesome skills
author: Byean

review_text: Amazing variety of food even though not all the stalls were open at certain timings. Some popular food would be the seafood, prawn noodles, oyster omelette, Indian food and nasi lemak, and many more! Bright and clean atmosphere during the day and night, with parking directly outside
author: Wei Liang Ng

review_text: Many lasi lemak options available, many excellent. There’s a stall that names its sets after poker game hands which I usually buy from.
author: Min Ee Koh

review_text: This place was packed despite CNY.  I went to Nasi Singapura stall and managed to order nasi lemak,which was still delicious, after all these years. My kids did not like the hokkien mee and carrot cake but one cannot expect a lone worker to perform miracles. Place looks small but if u know what to order u will be satisfied.
author: Len Kwok

review_text:
A medium size hawker centre with a good variety of food choices - chicken rice, seafood bbq, satay, nasi lemak, rojak, mutton soup, mie soto, prawn noodle, etc.  Good choices of typical drink stalls, fruit juices, and desserts (ice kacang, tau suan, green bean).

Plenty of tables and usually can find an empty table unless it's weekend lunch time.  Parking can be hard to find at time as it's a small lot.  Across the bridge from the Botanic Garden and a convenient stop after walking in the garden.

Tried Teck Kee Hot & Cold Dessert, Fruitopia, Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak, Warong Pak Sapari Mee Soto & Rebus and they are good.
author: Saifu Angto

review_text:
Lots of malay and indian stores with halal options. Home to legendary nasi lemak and mee soto store. There are basins to wash your hands. Mostly breakfast and lunch crowd

The drinks stores will approach you for business so usually there is no need to queue for drinks
author: Tania Koh

review_text: Always a place to go for hawker food. Serving mostly halal foods the Indian rojak is a can eat. Nasi lemak, kambing soup, satay are good choices. The Fish ball noodle from a non halal store is also a can try!
author: Yew Liong Goh

review_text: Finally opened after closed for quite some time. Place had been renovated and cleaners are more efficient. Food taste just like how it used to.
author: Imran H

review_text: The best avocado ever !!!! Got real fruit juice/ and premium series a lot of type of smoothie 🥹🥹 everyday my family have to drink here😻😻
author: Chutimon Udomsri

review_text:
No aircon but airy with many fans. A wide range of yummy food, award winning ones. A concentration of hawker flair. 😋

Tiktok: SA Soln
IG: sgfood13
author: Gohht 13

review_text: Tasty ! The chilli uplifted the nasi lemak to a next level. 😋
author: Kelsy Liau

review_text: Offer wide range of Chinese and Muslim food, including the two famous Nasi Lemak stalls,  Michelin Bib mutton soup, Mee Soto, and the delicious big prawn noodle.
author: derek neo

review_text:
Easily accessible by bus or mrt. Food is good. Not only the famous Nasi Lemak.
This prawn Mee cost $6. It is expansive compared to the rest of the stall. I think others with the same pricing taste much better.
The Indian Rojak is nice. Dessert store ice kacang $2.50 only. Very nice.
author: Steven Lau

review_text: Lots of good food here, especially the nasi lemak. Place is generally kept quite clean. It may get quite crowded at times, and there are limited parking available. Other than that, definitely worth to come here for your meals.
author: Kelvin Chye

review_text:
Really amazing place even after so many years.
Food was great. The lack star was for a no so flavourful fish soup.
Carrot cake - OMG man. Fried to perfection.
Nasi Goreng combo was a real surprise and twist of innovation from the stalls.

Steady Pom PiPi.
author: Nicholas Lam

review_text: Patrons have to return tray and the tables are cleaned up by the cleaners efficiently or just request them to clean up. Today I had yu kee duck dry kway teow. It simple and suits my taste buds.
author: Jacqueline Poh

review_text: Nasi lemak, mee rebus, mee soto, mee goreng mamak special with cheese fries, teh halia… seriously food paradise.. special shout out to the mee rebus stall, amazing. had it due to my wife’s craving just before she popped..
author: Zulhairi Awaruddin

review_text: Worth the queue! Crowded at peak lunch hour on a Saturday so come earlier or past 1pm for a shorter wait. Queues, seats and walkways altogether makes the area a tad cramped so I don't recommend coming with kids. The sugar cane juice and prawn noodle soup was good as well! So good that I forgot to take pictures 🤣
author: Michelle K

review_text:
Nice small hawker center, good after trail walk in Macritchie, bus 10 minutes to reach Adam Food Center. Seems like the stall number #1 has very very nice Nasi Lemak.
Very clean bathroom.
author: Thanh Hoang

review_text: Wow, the power avocado made it so easy for me to continue my ride to holland v. I just came from a hard ride from potong pasir. 3.50 and it’s enough to give a tasty boost! The milkiness and sweetness are well balanced. Well done muscle man.
author: Michael Ng

review_text: Adam road food centre is small but still good selection of nice food.. mostly malay and indian food. Most stalls are closed on Monday too. Lunch time is packed so do go slightly early if possible.  Nasi Lemak, indian rojak and prawn noodle is a must to eat! Will be back to try the mutton soup!
author: Axis Creative Hub - T Shirt Printing Singapore

review_text: Visited this stall in Adam Food Centre yesterday.  They have fried carrot cakes, Oyster egg, Char Kway Teow, Hokkien mee… Ordered a plate of white fried carrot cake.  It was nice!  The carrot cake was not too soggy (some places I ate the cake was very soft and wet).  and it was not too oily and the egg was fried just perfect (to me lah😄).  Saw people eating their char kway teow looks yummy too.  Will try next round!
author: alice lim

review_text: Ordered mee goreng from stall number #16. Friendly cook n cook it to the way I wanted it. Charred n spicy .
author: Chan

review_text: The food there is great and there is a wide variety of it. I especially like the chicken rice and their freshly squeezed juice is the best . Would definitely recommend
author: Julien L

review_text: Very good food, but cheap  only 3-5sgd dollars, tidy area, laksa, hainan chicken rice, nasi lamek, indian coffee, prawn noodle... All are good, have this great opportunity to be there, and the boss of the hawkers stall are nice... Worth to go
author: Yui Man Lee

review_text: So much better after the renovation. New tables and chairs, big circulating fans, and more tray return counter. Food as usual are fantastic.
author: Robin CHAN

review_text:
Adam's road nasi lemak was closed when I visited on Sunday. Few other shops seem to be closed as well.

Tried other shop selling chicken rice. It was tasty. I would go and buy again.

The other shop who sells chicken rice also tasty. It was wrapped with omelette. And the uncle was friendly. He gave my son wafer while waiting for the food to be ready.

Rojak was great but quite small portion for the price.

BBQ seafood and satay look very appealing however it look like it might take longer waiting time that I didn't order.
author: William Lu

review_text: Love the famous fishball & laksa noodles here, my comfort food. Prices are reasonable and quality always consistent. service is always good.
author: Agnes Goh

review_text: I ordered a roasted chicken rice set from Hua Ji Hainanese chicken rice stall and Masala tea from one of the drinks stalls. Both were reasonably priced and tasted heavenly to a hungry soul. Despite being crowded at lunch time, the place was airy and well-ventilated. The availability of wash basins for washing our hands is much appreciated.
author: Jimmy Tan

review_text: This place came into existence 3 decades ago and has gone through many rounds of upgrading projects. Clean and well organized, be it store sellers or the sitting arrangement. Good food and price is reasonable. When you are there you must not missed out 3 important stores, the BBQ seafood, dessert and the fresh fruits drinks (Avocado). Parking there can be quite challenging.
author: Ma-ku Gan

review_text: At Adam, the stalls owners treats everyone like family... The food there taste like home cook food. Especially the Nasi Lemak from Selera Rasa.
author: Raizan Vijaya Kesuma

review_text: Many Attentive, hard working crockery collection staff. Tables are always super clean before next user. I drive, so visited many Food centers all over Singapore. Adam has Cleanest tables & toilets. Keep it up!
author: julie kee

review_text: A small food centre which serves a small variety of foods. Though small, there should be something to eat for most people. A few of the famous stalls, like the ones selling duck rice, prawn noodles and Nasi lemak, can be found here.
author: Kia Guan Ng

review_text: Accidentally eaten the best kway chap in Singapore 2 weeks before writing this review. Stall no. 26 Yew Kee House of Braised Duck. I came back to take photos for this review. The braised meat is tender and flavourful. For $4.50 set, its a treat!
author: Kb N

review_text:
Great for local Malay breakfast dishes. I tried Selera Rasa's Nasi Lemak (Coconut Rice) today and it's nice!

Lots of other choices too but from lunch onwards. Breakfast more limited.
author: Amos Hoe

review_text:
If you want a gastronomic experience, try this lad's fried oyster.

Michelin grade. Bar none.
author: Rogue Valor

review_text:
A fantastic Hawker store to eat at!!!

The owner was a very friendly and kind woman and her employee/friend was a hospitable and nice man

Their Chicken and rice was fantastic and everything was home made,definitely check them out when in the Adam food centre thanks again Ms Guohua and all the best:)
author: Dhiren Rodrigues

review_text: Many halal stalls serving favourites Mee soto Nasi lemak Satay Rojak mamak and many more. Chinese and halal mamak stalls too. Deserts and drinks stall like sugarcane and chengteng ice kacang.
author: Muhamad Riduan Borhan

review_text:
#22 for Carrot Cake!! #6 for drinks.

Very busy, internationally diverse hawker center with nice selection of local foods. Couldn’t decide which of the two long nasi lemak queues to join so I went for the chicken rice with a slightly shorter queue. Chicken was over cooked but flavorful and the rice was really nice. Picked up a carrot cake from the nice woman across the way. This carrot cake has since become one of my favorites. The chef only burnt it the first time but since he knows my face, each time has been great! Highly recommend. Overall, would happily return to this place but not at peak lunch hours.
author: K Eyth

review_text: Nasi lemak is a locals favorite.  Prawn noodles and fishball noodles are my own personal favorites.  Avocado juice is also a must.
author: Sanghyun Lee

review_text: Medium-size hawker centre. Famous stalls are the two stalls selling nasi lemak side-by-side, each with its own following. Another one is the prawn noodle stall.
author: biyan tt

review_text: When arrive almost all close, except mamak fried rice
author: Yudhi Susanto

review_text:
A small food center that serves a variety of food. This place has been my daily go-to for quick meals. There are so many stalls but I recommend the roasted duck rice, fishball noodles, fish slice noodles, chicken rice and nasi goreng.

Sometimes if you arrive after 6p.m, most of the non-halal stalls are closed or closing. Hence, I going there at 5:30p.m.
author: Lester L.

review_text: A good hawker center near botanic garden! It's easy to get here, and they have various stall of foods and beverages. What impressed me is they separate places for halal and non halal food, so it will be save for moslem like me. Some of the stall were famous so be ready to have a long queue there.I always love selera rasa nasi lemak and also siti nur liyana mee rebus! So authentic and delicious..
author: Aditiya Adit

review_text:
was there for brunch and chanced upon a short Queue Mee Soto and Meet Rebus stall. No second thoughts, definitely a must eat dish at Adams
friend had Charkwayteow which was good too!
author: Richard Lee

review_text:
Tried the duck noodle. Shiok 👍🏿
Requested for large bowl of soup and i finished it!!
Will return to try other dishes.
author: Lim Frederick

review_text:
Ordered Happy Duck Rice and Char Siew Roasted Pork Rice big serving and delicious.

For drinks, we ordered Michael Jackson Drink and Bandung Grass Jelly. Bandung Grass Jelly taste better, love it so much.
author: Lorz Muana

review_text: Love this Adam Road Food Center. The choices available is sufficient to cater for your tastebuds. Great place to handouts with friends and family. Must try the Zaiton Satay ($0.70 each for Beef/Mutton) as the satay is superb. The Teh Tarik at Thajudeen Teh Tarik is one of the best I’ve ever taken.
author: Micheal Foo

review_text: Still the same good after renovations. Minus the birds. Much cleaner feel. Tried Siti Nur’s Mee Rebus for the first time. It’s actually very good. On par with Warung Pak Sapari’s. The 2 Nasi Lemak stalls at the corner seems to have dropped in standard (but queues are still long).
author: Jeffrey C

review_text:
Fishball noodle stall was worth the try! Noodle was bouncy and flavourful, generous ingredients for $4! Portion was just enough!

Teh tarik from drink store has a floral fragrance and it’s not too sweet when I asked for less sugar!

Overall great experience, would love to come again!
author: Lee Miao Wen

review_text: This is a pretty cool food court. In the beginning, this red building does look ugly. Not pretty at all. However, this building has nice car park around this building so that people can bring their car here. Also, they have famous nasi lemak and shrimp noodle stalls which are hot place to eat. Also, for those who visit Botanic garden, thisnisnthe right place as it is closely located to Botanic Garden MRT station. Convenient place to eat something.
author: Junho Yun

review_text: Nice place for cheap hawker food. I got chicken rice and prawn soup. Both very good.
author: Ryan

review_text: Great pork prawn noodle
author: Krzysztof Pestkowski

review_text: When in Singapore, you gotta do street food. This place is top. Try Adam's nami lemak and all the amazing satay.
author: saman rahbar

review_text: One of my favourite hawker centres in Singapore and its not all about the famous Nasi Lemak. Many great stalls to choose from and the quality is always great
author: Gary Harford

review_text: Small and convenient, all type of food even dessert
author: Yu Eujet

review_text: A small hawker centre near Botanic Gardens that houses a variety of delicious halal foods, such as Nasi Lemak, Maggi Goreng, and Mee Soto. Crowded for good reason. Great for a simple meal after a morning hike. Stalls start closing after lunch.
author: Xian You Lim

review_text: Dabao-ed prawn omelette and still so good. The chili is great!
author: Paepae S

review_text: The giant prawn noodle is so worth your singapore dollar, it’s about 8 dollars. You get 3 huge fresh prawn, on top of that you get pork ribs. The soup/broth is so well brew that you don’t actually have the smelly seafood smell in the soup. One of the best in Singapore.
author: Jia Kent Sim

review_text: A small but good hawker centre with many good foods  there.  Just on the other side of the botanic gardens, it is so convenient to get there.  Enjoyed my lunch...
author: S L

review_text: Best hainanese chicken rice stall at Adam Food Centre. The lovely Lady Boss and Uncle runs this hainanese chicken rice (No. 23) stall by themselves. They are open everyday, from 11am- 8pm! Aunty makes and takes the orders herself so please be patient with them as queuing time might take a bit longer during peak periods. Their prices are affordable and soup is complimentary too. The menu has a wide variety that also caters to kids and she fries the fried items upon orders so you are guaranteed freshness. I am a picky chicken rice eater so her stall is my go- to whenever I'm around the area.
author: Chang Wen Li

review_text: Supper clean table. Saw the Cleaners going round  and round checking and cleaning the tables. Never see sg hawker center tables so clean 👍👍
author: Spring

review_text: Nice clean hawker centre that was open for later night dinner. The food was delicious.
author: John Psaras

review_text: I had mutton chop. The mutton chop was tender and well marinated into the sweet and slightly spicy red sauce, that the fried egg can also be dipped on! The fries comes with lots of cheese and were crispy Nice. They may have birthday promotions.
author: Syazzy Slackster

review_text: A small and compact food center that is clean and comfortable. Even though that's a crowd when I visited, it's still comfortable and not cramped. The food stalls variety are very good and the quality of the food are above average. However the price point is still on the high side as compared with other food centers. Ambience is good and place is well ventilated. Some food to recommend include prawn noodles, nasi lemak, Indian rojak, satay, fried carrot cakes and fresh fruit juices. Overall a 5 star rating for a food center.
author: Scott Ng

review_text: Still love the simple Singaporean favourites! Yummy! Relatively clean and not cluttered, comfortable and able to enjoy a good meal!
author: Calvin Huang

review_text: God its simply the best dish ive ever eaten in Singapore, and i WILL be back for it😩😩😩
author: Rifdah Tsabitah

review_text: My favourite maggi goreng combo in the whole Singapore. The red signboard stall at beside one of the exits. Try it!
author: Wen

review_text: Good enough for hawker centre. Best food in-the area. The atmosphere bit noisy but ok. The food and the service is quick and fast. They have Satay,Chicken Rice and most famous their big prawn noodles soup. Haven’t tried that yet though. Bee Hoon is decent and it is relatively clean. Renovated recent. Love this keep it up.😍🥰
author: Rithul K

review_text: A long time since I go to Adam road Hawker centre. Still crowded though and limited carpark space. 2 entrance points,  Trace together and can seat up to 5people. Very limited seats also. Nasi Lemak queue still very long.
author: Parry Chong

review_text: Great food at a very reasonable price. Boss was friendly and ready to custom to your level of spiciness.
author: Koh Alvin

review_text: Great place to eat different types of local food. The prawn noodles is quite famous. Quite a lot of people queue to eat it.  The Nasi lemak here is also famous.
author: Kin Hee Teo (ZenTKH)

review_text: Always delicious.. Their kambing sup IS SO GOOOOOOOOD. As well as combo, teh tarik, Indian and Chinese rojak w century egg. Satay and chicken wing not recommended
author: Siti Raidah

review_text: I found this hawker center after looking for halal food in Singapore. It is located pretty far from the airport, but you can quickly go there using MRT. It is located near the Botanic Garden station. Their food selection I think pretty limited particularly because of the limited space. Yes, this hawker center is pretty small for my standard. One of the best delicacies here is the Nasi Lemak. I choose the Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak stall because it highly rated on Google, and also it has long queue of locals. A complete meal cost only SGD 6.00, which pretty affordable for Singaporean standard. It tastes great with rich flavor on the rice and the chicken. Their sambal was not spicy, but rather going to the sweet side. Overall, an enjoyable experience for me.
author: Arief Hidayatullah

review_text: Had the famous big prawn noodle, it was a good sized prawn for the price. The broth was slightly more savoury for me, but overall, not too bad.
author: Giju Gnanadhas

review_text:
Thought of trying their famous nasi lemak but the queues for the popular stalls were very long, so I ended up going for a stall selling Ayam Penyat, which later I found out was pretty popular stall as well.

I really like good Ayam Penyet and this one was really good. The chicken was crispy and tender and not overly dry just the way I think all Ayam Penyet should be. The chilli was also pretty spicy and I actually couldn't finish all of it. But spicy lovers will definitely enjoy this Ayam Penyet and their chilli!
author: amelia teng (Mayu)

review_text: Many nice food stall. Very good pricing. But parking abit problem....
author: Tony Fong

review_text: enjoyed dinner from Adam Rd food centre. prawn noodles, char tau kueh, sting ray, satay, cheng tng and more... :D help the hawkers!
author: Priscyn L

review_text: Food options have improved compared to covid times. Chicken rice is affordable
author: Yong Jian Rong

review_text:
All hail basmati rice nasi lemak

Even after a decade I still can’t resist stopping by if it’s on route
author: B. Khoo

review_text: Nasi Lemak is tasty but the queue can be quite long especially during peak hours. Both the Selera Rasa and No 1 stalls offer great nasi Lemak although the former is known for the fragrance of the rice while the latter offers crispy chicken
author: Ruey Xuan Lee

review_text: Nasi Lamak is absolutely amazing. We took a 45 min train here to have breakfast and we were not disappointed. There is a stand to the right of theirs that serves fresh fruit beverages. The honeydew is to die for. Just a fabulous experience on our first day in Singapore.
author: Mohsin Khan

review_text: Good hawker centre, should visit.
author: Casper Kole

review_text: It is busy place on weekends but it is a must stop during our annual visit to Singapore. Few things you must try here . 1. Selera Nasi Lemak 2. Teh Tarik or Halia 3. Mee goreng 4. Mee soto and 5 fruit juice
author: Sam K

review_text: Having lunch at Adam road food center. Ordered chicken briyani and kopi to go along. Place is bustling with people 🙂 …
author: Gerald Ang

review_text: Must try Power Avocado Fruitopia stall29. I tried Power Avocado and Dragonfruit Soursop snow nice and refreshing
author: Amy Tan

review_text:
Adam Food Centre is my go-to spot whenever I’m craving a comforting bowl of Noo Cheng Prawn Noodles. This place never disappoints. The prawn noodles here are famous for a reason—perfectly cooked noodles, juicy prawns, and that rich, flavorful broth that always hits the spot. It’s the kind of dish that warms you up and leaves you fully satisfied.

A tip for anyone visiting: come early or late if you want to avoid the parking woes. The food centre is quite popular, and parking can get tricky during peak hours. However, despite its popularity, Adam Food Centre never feels too crowded or too hot, making it a comfortable place to enjoy your meal. The open-air seating and well-ventilated space contribute to a pleasant dining experience, even when it’s busy.

No meal here is complete without a refreshing sugarcane drink from The Sugarcane Plant. There’s nothing quite like washing down a hearty bowl of prawn noodles with an ice-cold sugarcane drink. It’s the perfect way to recharge and feel refreshed, especially if you’re heading back to work. The combination of comfort food and a revitalizing drink makes for a fantastic lunch break.

Whether you’re a regular or a first-timer, Adam Food Centre offers a great selection of local hawker fare, with Noo Cheng Prawn Noodles and a sugarcane drink topping my list every time.
author: daddydrives

review_text: best place for nasi lemak in singapore. better than other places. like the sambal and fried chicken.
author: Edmund Heng

review_text: Its near and one of the oldest and famous food court that is still going strong  and food have variety to choose
author: MELLIZA QUIBUYEN

review_text: Loved the nasi lemak, orh jian (best I've eaten in a while) and black carrot cake. Look out for the red signboard for orh jian and black carrot cake. Stall owners were friendly. Enjoyed my food! :)
author: Daniel

review_text: Adam Road Food Centre have mostly Muslim food and some Chinese food. It is  slightly more expensive than other food centre. But worth trying. Would recommend the seafood Bee Hoon. 🤭👍🏻 …
author: Roger Roger

review_text: Sad my fav store is not open
author: Terence Lee

review_text:
Went for the local-voted mee soto. Best top up with chicken gizzard. Serving is good.

Adam road reminds me of newton food cntre. In itself, there’s lots of sataaaay and malay and indian food inside.
author: Casey Ordoña

review_text: SATAY STALL AND NASI PADANG SUPER DELICIOUS. INCUDING ALL THE GRAVY FROM BOTH STALLS.
author: MOHD SHAMSUL AHMAD SININ

review_text: Nice hawker center..i ate prawn noodle which is great..price is cheap..i have to queue though..in here also has nasi lemak stall which is also great..recommended
author: iussoe

review_text: The refreshed Adam Road Hawker Centre is so clean and airy. Most importantly my favourate Mee Soto from Warong Pak Sapari is still power!
author: Jude Hansen Fernandez

review_text: Love this hawker centre. The char kway teow ie fried noodle at this stall is genuinely great. Not too dry and not too moist. Service is great too. Very friendly stall holder.
author: Richard Tan

review_text: The best place for your goreng combos here is at a stall named Al Sheik. Look them up! Won't disappoint you!
author: Md Zulkifli Aziz

review_text: Good nasi lemak and very centralized location
author: Edwin Tan

review_text: Good and reasonably priced food. Selera Nasi Lemak as good as advertised.
author: Boon Inn Loh

review_text:
It's a well know hawker center ..though not as popular as newton hawker centre. Lunch time fr 12 - 2 can be very crowded. Great for bfast with many varieties available. Mainly Indian , Chinese n Malay cuisine.  Tea break for as nice teh tarik or others with snacks is highly recommended. Dinner time aft 6 is also very crowded but worse over the weekend. So go for bfast , early lunch or tea
break.
author: jack sidhu

review_text: Nice and convenient place to eat. Lots of Indian Muslim options including the increasingly rare Tulang Merah. Also one of the only places to get mutton soup with organ meat. It's also worth trying the oyster omelette (generous portion and good taste) and the avocado coffee from the juice stall.
author: Jordan Alsagoff

review_text:
First visit after its renovation last year. The food court is much cleaner & comfortable now. I m particularly impressed with the services of the staff and store holder there. My sister spilled a big cup of Teh Halia. You can imagine the big mess we created. The cleaner was very quick to help clean up the table & chair, and the stall holder came to offer us a replacement drink (with no charge).
We are proud that Singapore is offering such high standard of services level 🇸🇬
author: Sheila Leung

review_text:
The place is clean, plenty of carpark lots but little bit difficult to access by bus or mrt.
The food choices are many and the portion given are big. You should try the sup kambing (mutton soup). Delicious and affordable.
author: Muhd Faizul Abu Samat

review_text: Most the food stall open for bisness at around 10 am on Saturday, Most of the good food stall are with long queue. Most of seat almost full.
author: Abdul Karim

review_text: Mutton Soup was the world's best.
author: Regu Pillai

review_text: The fishball noodle couple very warm and friendly. Food is good too!
author: Augustine Lim

review_text: Spoilt for choice! But the Kuey teow kerang (Cockles) at stall no.14 is definitely a must try! Love the teh tarik from taj mahal drinks stall!
author: Roz Ismail

review_text: Try different indian muslim food stalls on every visit and you'll discover your favourite 😁😁👍👍👍. That's what I did a long time ago.  Good choices of hot drinks,cold drinks and fruit juices. Friendly vendors. Food are well priced. Plenty of  Malay food to choose from, nasi lemak, nasi ayam , mee soto , satay and many more....Muslim owned btw😁.
author: Red Sharkz

review_text: Must try Mamak Mee Goreng Combo..A mixture of Mee goreng ,mutton chop ,cheese fries and egg on one plate...
author: Meera Di

review_text:
This is so far, together with Alexandra Village, my favourite hawker in Singapore.
Relaxing and local atmosphere, kind vendors, good food, clean, and only 5 min walk from Botanic Gardens. Tourists seem to come only seldom to this place, despite the proximity to the Botanic Gardens.
author: Katrin Kröger

review_text: Nice foods and friendly environment
author: Jeffrey Lim

review_text: Sedap!! @ Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak. Be ready to queue ~30mins but the wait was definitely worth it ;)
author: Wei Le Lim

review_text: Very good barbecue store here. Adam seafood BBQ. 👍
author: xia helen

review_text: They have many halal food stalls here. They’re delicious and cheap.
author: Wahyu Firmanto

review_text: Stall number 11. The best I've tried so far.. Highly recommended
author: Faizal

review_text: Prawn Noodles, BBQ Sting Ray, Mutton Soup, Teh Tarik and tonnes of good muslim food. 😍😍😍 …
author: David Ho

review_text:
An iconic eatery since I was a schoolboy in the early 80s as my school is not far away along Dunearn road (DUNERAN SECONDARY TECHNICAL SCHOOL)
Had a reminisce affair with people there, the stall holders who some happens to be a 2nd and 3rd gen but the best magical part is the mee soto stall Haji Sapari was standing tall all these years and it happens to be my schoolmate Mr Azhari (2nd gen) who managing it now. Oh how this place brings back the good old wonderful years even serving my NS with SPF in the late 80s and it happens to be in Tanglin 'E' division sector this is our 'official' eatery other than TAMAN SERASI (BOTANIC GARDEN) food centre whenever I visited there will be lots of fond memories coming back from motorcycle gangs era til now oh wow..
I'm in my mid 50s
Those were the days where Singapore used to be a food heaven and you'll get spoiled with choices..
Oh I nearly forgot the wonderful auntie forgot her name who is very kind and very cheerful back then laa she sells fruit juices the stall is right behind the toilet when I was there in mid 90s I was told she was diagnosed with cancer but she survived till now..!!!🤗👍👍👍
author: Raden Enam Sembilan

review_text:
Adam Road Food Centre has been a local favorite for a long time! What's not to like about all the comfort food in one place. The prawn noodles (Michelin Bib), the Nasi Lemak, etc.. with queues snakeing around the tables of hungry diners.

Except the lack of parking space, if you drive. And this small Food centre is hot and crowded, but that is expected.. the charm of a Food centre in Singapore.
author: Serene S

review_text: Went for dinner here before our adventure to Botanic gardens. Cheese fries and roti john from one of the Indian shops were delicious and kids love it.  zaiton satay was closed so we bought Satay from the other shop and it was disappointing. Otherwise, nice place to have your dinner.
author: Zuleikha

review_text: Fast serving food to customer and clean environment
author: nornisah jumat

review_text: The ambience was very nice. A lot of halal options. Food choices pretty limited but enough. Price is very reasonable as well.good place to dine for classic hawker centre ambience
author: Mukilan Vs

review_text: Adam Food Center is a bustling hawker center that offers a wide variety of delicious local dishes. From the fragrant chicken rice to the savory satay, every bite is a flavor explosion. With affordable prices and a lively atmosphere, it's a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in Singaporean street food.
author: Sriram Chandrasekaran

review_text: Good place to get a bite of local food!
author: Diana Dawood

review_text: Great food, seating was abit hard to find to accommodate a large group during lunch rush but overall area is well ventilated with many well priced food available
author: Kenneth Tan

review_text: I actually went there specifically for the nasi lemak but the stall was close so I ordered something else .it seems more stalls open at night I guess or lunch time not too sure because when I was there a few stalls were operating.
author: Nicholas John Woodford

review_text: Mee rebus was really good, well the only mee rebus/mee soto stall there. Long q always, but worth it.
author: Sue Thompson

review_text: Good place to have a local breakfast.. famous for its Coconut rice ala Nasi Lemak.
author: Davianto

review_text: Had the Adam's prawn noodle with pork belly. Long Q but fast. Putting a bit of the chilli powder ready give the soup a boost. Found some soft pork skin inside the soup- interesting as I like to eat them. Recommend not to order with pork rib as it will take away the real taste of the prawn.
author: Doreen

review_text: Great place for breakfast if you craving for prata, nasi lemak, mi soto and other malay breakfast. freindly stall owners and also to mention that u can get good teh tarik there. Fo me, i usually go for masalah teh (this is a drink you dont commonly find).
author: ruzaini rohaizat

review_text: Good food, hot place.
author: O O

review_text: Ordered Stingray and Kangkung tdy. Was wonderful as always and tried Taj Mahal Teh Alia, not the old standard but still ok👌
author: Syed Baasha

review_text: I can't get enough of the Nasi Lemak at Selera Rasa Stall. The people working there are very friendly and   paired with the bustling atmosphere of the food centre makes my meal taste better.
author: Aaqil Nawfal

review_text:
A wide variety of vendors and cuisines.  Almost exclusively Asian cuisines(I don't remember any Western options) in an open-air (covered) Singapore traditional hawker center.  Every vendor is different but most would prefer you pay cash if they don't require it outright.

It's open-air which means it's hot.  It's also extremely busy so vendors are very business-like rather than chatty.  Many may not speak much English and be more conversant with customers who speak Mandarin or another language.  Order from the vendor you want and pay them directly, wait for your food and then try to find a table to sit at.  Great experience!
author: Paul

review_text:
A typical hawker center with lots of selection.

Very crowded!  Maybe its a public holiday.
A wide selection of food ranging from Halal to Indian to Chinese.
author: Raymond Ng

review_text:
We went that during lunch time but many stalls not opened. Due to Ramandan , most Muslim stalls are not opened yet. We enjoy the char kway teow n the oyster omelette. While my sister gobbled up the kway chap,  I had a bowl of lontong which is quite good.
Our helper was busy munching the Adam Penney. Good to karry on makan.
author: thomas tan

review_text: The size of this hawker is perfect. It is a very underrated area and I would highly recommend getting Carrot Cake, masala, tea, and Char Siew noodle.
author: Soumia Vellanki

review_text: Very delicious local foods in this Food Centre. Just cross the overhead bridge from Botanic Gardens MRT and you can have reasonable price foods here instead of spending a lots inside the Gardens. 😁👍
author: Linh Cam Lai

review_text: Had hainanese chicken rice which was good. Food centre was clean and tidy.
author: Steven Yeo

review_text: Adam Road Food Centre is definitely one of the few great supper stops I gravitate to when I've cravings. The wide variety of cuisine is also a strong factor that makes it easy for me to promote this to my foreign friends.
author: Nicholas C.

review_text: Good variety of food for all ethnicity and of high standard. A lot of famous store like Adam fishball noodle, Sera Rasa nasi lemak, cheng teng  Ssiti meed rebus and mee  soto, fried carrot cake and fried oyster omlett etc are all the must try here. Reasonably priced and of high quality
author: Rem Power

review_text: Visited this hawker centre after seeing an advertisement on social media. Truly a life-changing experience. The friendly All-E tray return robots with a great personality really made tray return easier! The environment was clean and cooling. I thoroughly enjoyed the performances by youths aged 15-18 as well. 10/10! Deserves an A for A Level Project Work!
author: 22S33 MOHAMED KHIDIR BIN MOHAMED HANES

review_text: Lots of food but very crowded place. Some stalls you need to queue for almost an hour for the food. Very small parking area as well. Love the prawn noodles. Have to queue for 30mins but no regrets. Soup is very tasty and prawns are very fresh. There is a new fruit stall selling avacado drink. Come and try it!
author: Han Seah Sim

review_text: Very clean place and good price.
author: Seb Sang

review_text:
Always my go to place for Malay & Indian-Muslim food!

A must have whenever i'm there - Mee Soto from Warong Pak Sapari - the soup is rich and flavourful with nice aroma of spices. Paired with a bergedil by the side makes it a perfect breakfast or lunch!

For Satay, i find Zaiton or Pondok equally as good.

Not to forget Soup Kambing paired with roti from Bahrakath Mutton Soup..perfect on a cold rainy afternoon!

Location is easy to find, near the MRT station and accessible by buses too.
author: Daniel Goh

review_text: The bachor meepok nearest to the famous prawn noodle is excellent.  We stop eating from the "famous" prawn noodles..only the soup is not bad...otherwise over-rated and over priced. Tao suan is one of the better ones too. The 5 star-rating is for the bachor meepok n tao suan.
author: Eunice Tan

review_text: Super duper teh tarik.  Spoilt for choices.  Found a very good Indian rojak; hopefully the good food standard is maintained.  Also 2 sedap nasi Lemak stalls; standards always high whether you get fresh chicken or not... 🤣😅 …
author: Anthony Chin

review_text: Has great seafood. Has one of the best Nasi Lemak in town. Indian food is good as well. The satay here is quite decent. One of the best places to have late supper.
author: Ahmed Mashalem

review_text: Visit this location early in the morning before 8am. This was my first visit after more than 5 years. At this time, the place is relatively not crowded. Most stalls are already in operation. The nasi lemak stalls are popular here. Few of the stalls have long queue after 9am. Seating was also a problems after 9am. As all the early birds have occupied it. Most came in groups, due to this the seating is occupied. Some of the familiar stall holder are no longer around, which I learnt from my friends. The hassle of eating here are still around. Maybe will visit again this hawker centre after 5 years.
author: Rafie Samin

review_text: If you’re looking for a hawker centre filled with good food near Botanic Gardens MRT Station, Adam Road Food Centre should be on your list! Although it may be considered to be rather small, it is one of the most popular hawker centres in Singapore! From Nasi Lemak to Mutton Soup, and Rojak to Prawn Noodles, Adam Road Food Centre offers a range of multi-ethnic cuisines!
author: sathu sathu

review_text:
Adam Road food is one of the hidden gems in Singapore. The famous nasi lemak always finish early. However there are other stalls selling nasi lemak which is as good as the famous one.

Adam Road milk tea is the best. Must order this.
author: Muhammad Firdaus

review_text:
Very Nice place to eat Muslim Halal Foods.Many many items shop are here,
I tried many things.
There everything great.
You can relax and enjoy to eating.
author: Siddik Mostafa

review_text: When I went around 7plus pm , its was crowded but seating was still easy and I chope a table for my two other buds. I had kambing soup while I waited. A mix of good food, more malay/indian but chinese was well represented by a few staples. As mentioned food is good, if its not your stall will not be around there for long.
author: gddigger Junior

review_text:
First time I'm here. Have been at a campus just across the street years ago and didn't know its existence! Think it's too well-hidden cos you couldn't really see it when you're on a bus, haha!
Anyway, it's a real delight to find so many Nasi Lemak/Nasi Padang stalls at one place. Since  there's a long queue at the famous Nasi Lemak stall, and I didn't want to miss my transport rebate, I da bao from the stall just beside it. Not bad at all!
author: Daphne Lee

review_text:
Popular Mutton soup , well known Nasi Lemak & Former Chong Pang Indian Muslim food Stall is located here ...
Chicken / Mutton Briyani among new dish available at the Mutton Soup stall ...
Delicious foods & all sorts of cold & hot drinks available too ...
author: Zakirudin Mahmud

review_text:
This is a go to place if you love Malay food and Indian Food. Plenty of good tasting variety.
Malay Food - Nasi Padang, Lontong , Mee Siam, Mee Soto, Mee Rebus, Nasi Lemak, Satay, Malay Chicken Rice.
Indian Food - Briyani RIce, Prata, Murtabab, Indian Mee Siam, Mee Goreng,  Roti John.
There are also Chinese Food - Prawn Noodle Soup, Friend Prawn Noodle, Chicken Rice, Duck Rice, Fishball Noodle, Fried Kway Teow, Friend Carrot Cake and Friend Oyster.
author: dogcom sg

review_text: Home to many many good food stalls, both halal and non halal.  Nasi lemak, Indian rojak, mee soto, kambing soup, prawn noodles etc
author: Danny Lien

review_text: definitely should visit!! this place has amazing nasi lemak, prawn noodles and bbq seafood!! price of food is cheap and good as well. if you feel like having ice cream just hop on over to serene centre for island creamery
author: Marcus Choy

review_text: Everything here is delicious, a true stalwart of the old hawker centres selling traditional Singaporean food. On my deathbed, my only regret will be that I didn’t dine here enough.
author: averruncushd

review_text: Great hawker spot - round design means you can see most of the stalls from your table. Good satay, good fruit juice, chicken rice we got was just ok
author: Taj Meadows

review_text: I was having the $4 power avocado, as always it was amazing and for someone who had a heavy lunch, this can be dinner as well. It’s $4 because they put in one whole avocado and he invited me in to have a peak at the preparation giving me the assurance there’s no cheating involved. :)
author: Teoh Teik Ming

review_text:
Had halal Nasi Lemak & Mee Rebus.
Both from stalls with a long queue. Worth the wait!
There are many other halal options.
author: Nurmaya Musa

review_text: One of the best nasi lemak in Singapore available here at stall no 2.. Be prepared to wait for some 30 minutes  in queue during the peak period though. Other local foods are also available, such as mee siam, mee soto, chicken rice.. Etc..
author: Sham Abdullah

review_text: Pleasant and place clean. Plenty of food choices but should have mix of other fusion food.
author: zanny k

review_text: Good variety of food and nice ambience !
author: Joanne Lim

review_text: This hawker centre has many hidden gems. At least half of the stalls have been there for more than 20 years, which speaks to the awesomeness of the food you'll find here.
author: Mikail Lo

review_text: Plenty of food stalls to choose from. Prices are from average to affordable. Food is definitely good! This hawker centre is one of the cleanest I've been to. Good job!
author: Cirillo Hutsonaw

review_text:
It's been my favorite hawker centre for the past 40 years! Renowned for it's wide array of Malay and Indian Muslim food.

Must trys:
Selera Nasi Lemak, Mutton Soup (Indian), any of the 'goreng' stalls (mee goreng, bee hoon goreng, nasi goreng, etc.), Indian Rojak, satay, Malay Style Chicken Rice, Briyani, Adam Road Mee Rebus stall, Adam Road Prawn Mee, Adam Road Duck Rice and any of the indian-muslim coffee stalls.
author: Leonard Thangavelu, PBM

review_text: Wow... Feels so nice after pandemic when you visit such a lively place. Tried the Indian Rojak, was super nice. Next time for the Nasi lemak with 20m queue hehe
author: Lorenz Gerber (NorrSwedeFPV)

review_text:
Open food court with everything in Singapore you would want to try. From Satay and Nasi Padand and 2 famous Nasi Lemak stalls with queues all day long but gone by 5pm.

All of Chinese and Indian cooking. And fruit juices at $2 for anything, cut fruit and ice desertts. So many drink shops with "teh tarik" and all kind snacks.

Hugeparking space but still streets nearby full parking usually no space at all meal times with parking warriors mercilessly issuing summons 24/7.

Just accross the two street Bukit Timah and Dunearn Road is botanical gardens, next to Cold Storage. Really a scenic corner of greenery such that Adam Roads Food Centre toilets are designed in open green trees concept. Pay 10 cents to old man for clean upkeep and toilet paper and soap.

It is great space for afternoon tea into dinner. Not much beer drinkers as crowds wait to take over departing diners. Spend a day after walking in the trails of world famous botanical gardens.

review_text: Great local place. Food is delicious and so inexpensive.  Love how there are many different ethnic cuisines here all in one place.

author: Jiayi Goh

review_text:
This hawker stall is visible across the street from Botanic Gardens Station via the overpass or crossing. In Korea, it's like a local food court.

I ordered the small fried oyster at No. 22, the chicken rice set (roasted and steamed half and half, with extra meat) at No. 23, and the Power Avocado at No. 29.

The fried oyster, unlike what you'd find in Korea, was a stir-fried oyster, egg, and meat dish. It's delicious dipped in sauce and should be eaten while it's still hot. It's even better when mixed with the rice that came with the chicken rice.

The chicken rice set was delicious with the owner's homemade chili sauce. The chicken was tender and flavorful, and the bones were removed, making it easy to eat. The broth tasted like chicken broth you'd get at a milmyeon restaurant, and the bok choy was also good. Above all, the owner was cheerful and friendly. The spicy Sri Cha Cha egg stir-fry, which wasn't on the menu, was especially delicious, but it's a shame they don't sell it. It's difficult to grind and grind the sauce myself, so it's hard to offer it on the menu. The food is delicious, so I highly recommend it!

The Power Avocado is served shaved ice, filling and delicious. This place is famous for their Avocado + Banana Mix (No. 2), but I couldn't eat it that day because they didn't have any bananas.

Aside from that, Rojak (No. 19) has its own distinct flavor profile, but I found it quite enjoyable. The peanuts, sauce, and other ingredients all contributed to the flavors. I enjoyed the pineapple and cucumber inside, but the wheat bread didn't quite suit me. I think it's because the texture was a bit dry. Still, it's worth it.

Finally, the ginger milk tea was delicious and warm.

There are more locals than tourists here, and there are also police officers and high school students, so I guess that's why the prices are relatively affordable and the food is delicious. After ordering and paying, you can pick up your food when it's your turn. After you're done, you can return it to the non-hala (tray) in the center. A separate staff member will clear your table. It's an open space with fans, so it can be a bit hot, but it's a fun place to enjoy a local atmosphere. Parking is available, and the place is clean. There are also clean restrooms. Please note that the entire restaurant may be closed on certain days for food preparation or cleaning.

*2025.7.31.
author: 긍정소년 (positiveboy)

review_text: The food was good, the tables were clean. The place is not air-conditioned, but there are many fans, which definitely help in the humid and hot Singaporean weather. Hawker is close to the botanical garden - you can plan to eat before or after sightseeing. A sheltered place from the rain, but there is a hole in the middle, so the sun and rain can be harmful there.
author: Natalia

review_text:
I found a super delicious Hainanese chicken rice!
I have eaten several Hainanese chicken rice restaurants in Singapore and they are all pretty good,
but this one completely caught my eye!

☀️ It is recommended to order "Chicken Leg Rice",
the chicken skin is elastic and smooth like jelly texture! The chicken is tender and smooth! The chicken oil rice has distinct grains, the chicken oil is rich, and the chicken soup is fresh and refreshing! ! The seasoning sauce is also salty and sweet, which fully stimulates the aroma of chicken! !

💰 The price is also super cheap!
Starting from 3.5, including side dishes, chicken oil rice, and chicken soup.

The renovated hawker centre is quite well ventilated and the environment is quite clean.

Drinks - sugarcane and teh Halia were diluted too. Maybe I didn’t go to the right stalls. Price points are high for almost all the food items.

Wanted to try the famous chicken wing and satay but waiting time minimum 30min

Will rather go to other food centres.

-update 13 Aug-

Tried the Selera Nasi lemak - OMG THE FRIED CHICKEN IS WOOSH! Love it. And the sambal chilli also. The mee soto was woah! I would eat it again!

Will be coming back to try the other famous stalls/dishes like mee soto, indian rojak and prawn noodles.
author: Hans Han

review_text:
As I tucked into this Mee Rebus with extras for my occasional cheat day craving this brings back memories of familiar starter morning kick off to a work day during my madmen days. The one that got a late old friend all excited not realising that this gem is actually just around the corner from his place when he popped back home. Alas he's no longer here but with each bite a piece of the many memories we shared is rekindled 🤲🏻☝🏻

A lot has changed at this food centre. The long queues for the two famous nasi lemak are no longer so evident. The first with the relatively unfriendly makcik stayed the same but the overhyped one that spawned Crave sadly allowed commercialism to spiral their own brand of nasi lemak into expensive blahness. Notably the (in)famous headband auntie with her stupendous famous Mee Soto with the delicious soup is long gone with her. We started not having friendly interaction for she was garang and uncommunicative but we ended up exchanging good tidings when my wife and I bid her well as she battled cancer when we met her in a wheelchair. She left not only with her quietly supportive kind husband who also passed but along with their memorable signature Mee Soto which I used to have with chicken feet and gizzard with the kick of her special chilli sauce.

Luckily this old skool style thick gravy Mee Rebus is continued by the friendly and sweet adik helper taking over from the Pak Haji who used to tend to the stall.

So with each bite I'm allowing the flood of memories to just bring back to the good old times here.
author: Hamzah Alsagoff

review_text:
