review_text: As part of the staff walk this month, our team took a walk through the Botanical Gardens and ended to the north near the Adam Food Centre. Decided to go for the Mee Soto and Mee Rebus stall to order a regular mee soto soup with chicken meat slices and noodles. We are not disappointed as the soup was savoury, rich in spices, dark in favour with their own blend of chilli. Finished off the meal with sugar cane juice with lemon, a good respite from the warm weather as most of us were sweating buckets after the walk. This time around, I did not go for the Adam Road Nasi Lemak, nor the Adam Chicken rice as it was not opened. Will come back to try any other time!
author: Matthew Chan

review_text: Haven't been here for ages.  Tried the Indian Rojak, still good.  The dessert stall that sells local desserts were great. Highly recommend.  Their tau swan is not too sweet yet very fragrant.  Had bbq stingray with sambal was also good.
author: Angie Fong

review_text:
Basic Hainanese chicken rice😊 I come around 5 for early dinner on Sunday.
Taste for the price is definitely compatible.
author: Tsoi Ka Man

review_text:
Ice kacang cost $2.50. I liked it! The ice is smooth. Syrup, topped with milk, is just nice, not too sweet or colourful. Finished all the ingredients, and there was a longan!

Kembing soup was tasty. Not much meat for a $10 serving.

Enjoyed looking at the 2 hens with their 6 chicks, at the lawn behind the food centre.
author: Chiong Hoe Ng

review_text: I went here for lunch before going to the Botanical Garden. It is only walking distance from the park. One of the famous meals here is nasi lemak. There was a long queue in front of the food stall during lunch. The food in this place is affordable. Both halal and non halal food are available here. Many employees in nearby offices apparently eat here for lunch. I could see a glimpse of local life here.
author: Emily

review_text:
Good variety of stalls offering spore's local hawker food.

Do give all the stalls a try. I would say none are bad!
author: Cookie Monster

review_text: Came here on a weekend night. Decent variety of food at a hawker centre. We ordered stingray, oyster omelette and fish soup. Affordable pricings and reasonable portion.
author: Zhi Yan Chiam

review_text: Still a good place for local eats, though the nasi lemak I initially went for was closed on my visit. Char kway tiao is decent (there are several stalls) but I wouldn't recommend the muah chee. Heard prawn noodles are not bad, either.
author: Josh Ng

review_text: Nice Prawn Noodles and other local fares like Orh Luak (Oyster Omelette), BBQ and fruit juices like avocado shakes are found here.
author: Danny Foo

review_text: One of Singapore iconic makan places to visit, still have the nostalgic surroundings..
author: Muhammad Firdaus J

review_text: Foods as usual was good by the cleaners need to be educational on hygiene. Image pushing an open dustbin right beside us while we were eating. Not a complaint but to inform them of the proper SOP. I pushed back the bins to the proper place so as not to disturb our makan.
author: Lee Steven

review_text: Nice food for Breakfast, lunch and dinner. Nasi Lemak is popular here. Selera is always with a queues.
author: ybanfong John

review_text: Great food, variety and portions! My favourite thing to eat here is the mutton chop combo ; has everything you want on a single platter so you get to sample a few things at a go. Signs are put up against touting so feel free to sit and order from wherever.
author: Ruzana Rahim

review_text:
My coworker took me to the Adam food centre for nasi lemak. This Hawker centre caters to a more local crowd and gets really crowded during lunch time.

I had the nasi lemak from Selena Rasa Nasi Lemak. They make everything to order so the line will move pretty slow.  I ordered the royal flush which comes out to a little over 5 Sing dollars.

The fried chicken is crispy and juicy and my favorite part of the plate. The rice is fragrant and aromatic. I didn’t care so much for the paste component in the banana leaf.  Additionally, I would have my egg cooked over easy and not have a fully cooked yolk. Overall, the dish was tasty but wouldn’t want to wait in line for 30 minutes again.
author: Vincent Quan

review_text: It's not crowded if you feel like having the famous Adam road nasi lemak and delicious fishball noodle at 8am in the morning.  Be warned that the cleaners will insist that you return your plates and trays to the designated point after you finished your food. Wish more stores are open.
author: catherine toh

review_text: Conveniently located opposite the Singapore Botanic Gardens and Botanic Gardens MRT station, the food centre is suitable for tourists looking for lunch or dinner. Indian Muslim food is rightfully popular with strengths in flavour and variety.
author: Athanasius Koh

review_text: Yummy food at this hawker center: indian, Chinese and Singaporean food. Water basins available to wash hands, but I didn't see a washroom. It's a smaller hawker center, maybe around 30 stalls. Tables with shade and under the sun available. Drink sellers were very persistent; many came and constantly asked if I want something to drink (no, I didn't).
author: Ana Woo

review_text:
Regular place for excellent Nasi Lemak and drinks. It's also a regular place for a bike stop
Nasi Lemak stalk starts a 7am.
Several is my favourite...was told the Sultan of Brunei orders from this stall
The 2 guys working in the stall are a jovial bunch...always talking & smiling
author: Steve Lai

review_text: Good food here. Not too much Variety of food, however there are quite a number of Muslim food stalls here. Ayam penyet was decent. Would have preferred it to be a tad cheaper at maybe $5.
author: TY W

review_text: Goog food options. Chicken fried noodles was good.
author: Mukesh Srivastava

review_text: Wide Selection of local foods, especially the famous, Sultan of Brunei, frequent visits, Nasi Lemak stall.
author: Max Ko

review_text: Nice hawker center, one of the most famous stalls is mutton stall, great soups there! Chicken rice is nice as well.
author: Anna Khanzhina

review_text:
Most people come here for the nasi lemak, prawn noodles, mutton soup and at night the BBQ seafood are good.

Recently there's a new added chicken rice store call Tong Fong Fatt. The chicken rice here is actually very good. Both the fried chicken and boiled chicken are good. Personally prefer the boiled version but my family prefer the fried version. We like it so much that we always buy a  whole chicken.
author: Sing Lim

review_text: Lots of notoriously Good Foods now operated by 2nd generation stall holders. Nasi Lamak, Pratas, Ayer Bandung... favourite with night owls.
author: LOO FONG HOW

review_text:
My favourite hawker centre since the early 1990ies.

Delicious local food 😋 and definitely a must to try the fresh fruit juices of Steward Fryit Juice. The taste is great with a huge selection of juices.
author: R C L

review_text: Great place for a meal anytime of the day. Wide selection of Malay dishes ..... From nasi lemak, mee soto, mee rebus, nasi goreng, chicken rice etc.
author: Rick Koh

review_text:
A must-go if you're on the Coast-to-Coast trail. Was there on a Sunday afternoon and it was very crowded. Due to social distancing measures, there aren't many tables at a time.

There were long queues at the popular nasi lemak, prawn noodles and dessert stalls. My friend queued for the nasi lemak for about 30 mins.

Thankfully, the crowd thinned when it rained heavily. Managed to try the ais kacang at the dessert stall, and it was good! The shaved ice was soft, ingredients aplenty and delicious. The lady taking orders was friendly and would remember your table if they took your order in advance for desserts still in preparation.

The boneless chicken rice was not bad, but quite expensive for the portion of chicken.

Minus one star for this food centre due to the crowd. Probably best to takeaway instead of dining in.
author: Joyce H

review_text: The food centre has quite limited stalls. Avocado chocolate shake is not bad, quite thick. Duck rice is nice but beware of the tofu. It turned sour (spolit).
author: C T

review_text: Quality of food has dropped a little since I was last there more than 20 years ago. But, the nice part is that it is CLEAN. Everything including the restrooms are clean. Way, way, way above normal Singapore hawker center clean.
author: Gavin Tay

review_text: Some ventilation issue here. Avoid if you cannot deal with it. Otherwise awesome food here. Must try the taosuan. People typically come here for the Nasi Lemak and other Muslim food. The prawn noodles is good too!
author: Michael Ong

review_text: It's been quite a while since I came here for food. Prices r kept low affordable! Roti prata still at $1/= a piece. Milk tea at $1/= :) Packed 2 famous Adam Rd Nasi Lemak for lunch.
author: Jn Leow

review_text: The food court offers almost exclusively Indian /Muslim food. The mutton soup is recommended by many and it's opening for dinner and supper. I ordered the must try mutton leg but it's rather mutton tendon (so order mutton meat/ mutton rib if u prefer meat than tendon). The soup is really tasty. $6/9 per bowl
author: CC F

review_text: On a Sunday morning 2-3 shops open to cater to any halal nasi lemak craving...4sgd for the basic.
author: Hal Serudin

review_text: We tried prawn noodle at Big Prawn noodle stall and kway teow soup of Siti Nur stall, they were quite ok!
author: pham huyen

review_text:
Bahrakath Mutton Soup King
Opening Hours: Open 1pm to 3am daily
Soup with bread, yummy yummy, match!
author: Wee

review_text:
Favorite place for lunch  after long walking along Botanical Garden,i like the Satay here,worth it!

4 stars because less seats and tiring to waiting next seat as most costumers here seems enjoying their meals & take time to move 😂(specially on weekends/lunch time)
author: Annie's Vlog

review_text: Crowded place. Difficult to find car park if you are driving. Nice food. Go for fried oyster, chicken rice, prawn noodles. I haven’t tried the rest yet.
author: Des C.

review_text: Alot of stalls closed.  Not sure if was due to a Tuesday or times have changed for the food center.
author: Kenny Cheong

review_text: One of my favourite hawker centre in Singapore. Couple of dishes that you will have to try when here: mutton soup and the fried beehoon with pork (猪脚米粉）.
author: Tong Yang

review_text: Adam Road Food Centre will always have a place in my heart as long as I live. My old Whitley Secondary School was just a 15 min away and my all time favourite has and will always be the Indian Rojak. I will also recommend the mee rebus and mee Soto and Kambing soup too. Nasi lemak is individual so u choose where the Q is. The fruit stall is also good with selection of fruits and it's juices. Awesome choice of hot and cold drinks to relinquish with your food.. parking can be tough during peak hours.
author: Dzulkifli BM

review_text:
TEH HALIYAH MEETS CARROT CAKE

Adam’s food centre is home to many famous stalls in the island. Well known for Nasi Lemak, Indian Rojak and Mutton Soup, it is a relatively small food centre with a semi open-air, Hexagonal arrangement right beside the Adam’s flyover.

The Hawker centre is emotionally attached to me since my first visit in 2014. Whenever I step into this area, along with nostalgia, I look for two items: a bottle of chilled beer from aunty’s stall and a $5 dark (Singaporean) Carrot Cake with chilli. I am surprised that not many people have mentioned the stall in their super list of Chai Tow Kway, but if I were to make one, this stall would top the list. But the two are closely followed by Teh Haliyah served by the Ronaldinho look-alike Malaysian Indian hawker. This time, I chose the ginger tea over Beer, simply to try a new combination.

We rarely get a proper visual access to the wok where the chopstick licking Carrot Cake gets done. But the orders are taken with all possible customizations. After a short wait, you could claim your piping hot carrot cake served in a leaf shaped green plate. I strongly recommend that you take no additives like chilli or sauce, but grab a plastic spoon to scrape out the tastiest final remains of sauce from the plate.

On the other side, it make no sense to watch Ronaldinho making Teh Haliyah. It happens in a time shorter than your brain would take process it. He quickly fills the Teh glass with black tea and strong ginger water and then performs a “scoop - throw” trick to transfer condensed milk from tin to glass. At this stage, most of the tea makers just give it a quick stir and serve. This guy adds tarik (a pull technique) to it to give you a 007 level “Shaken, not stirred” mix.

The ingredients in the two dishes complement each other perfectly that makes one  plug into nirvana. Fried garlic in the carrot cake combines with the ginger water to strike  the roots of our taste buds while caramelized sugar neutralises the bitter tea to add a new flavour to the milk. Its less likely that you won’t slurp the carrot cake and finish off the tea in minutes. And beware, you may feel warm and even sweat after the treat. So it is better to sit under the fan for a while, before you decide to leave.
author: Thiru Muruga AD

review_text:
Haven't been here for decades decided to visit this afternoon. The place is buzzing with lots of muslim and Chinese stores, and lots of customers. Tried the fried carrot cake and malay chicken soup. Both didn't disappoint. I remember many other good stalls too(from my dunearn hostel days)
This is definitely an overlooked hawker centre( by tourists). Can rival Newton Centre, Tiong Bahru, and other more famous ones in quality.
A must for hawker foodie.
author: e c

review_text: Lots of halal food in here. The most recommended stall here is the famous "Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak". Try the Royal Rumble menu, the most complete choice of nasi lemak with its sides: fried chicken, fried fish, fried egg, otah (kinda fish cake with asian spices), and potato perkedel (mashed potato batter with egg and fried). The trivia is: President of Indonesia, Joko Widodo and the sultan of Brunei loves this dish so much that they had this as breakfast when they visit Singapore.
author: Lenara Lathifah

review_text:
Not very crowded even on a saturday.

Food waz great, recommend the prawn noodle soup.
author: linchen xu

review_text: Prawn  noodle is good, especially the dry version.
author: Tiang Siong Lian

review_text: 5 minutes walk away from Botanic Garden. It is famous for Nasi Lemak.
author: 尾崎史享

review_text: Heritage of hawker center in Singapore. If you don’t mind walking, then recommend to try. MRT Station botanical garden
author: Winston Arethe Mulyadi

review_text: Small but friendly and good place for quick breakfast. Nasi lamak is traditional style. Walking distance from Botanic garden.
author: pdkrg1

review_text: had a “team dinner” here! didnt expect the place to be quite packed, but it was my first time so i dont know what types of food are famous here 😂 …
author: Mae B

review_text:
One of the old time hawker centre that has been around even before my childhood days. It is famous for its spread of delicious Halal food stores.
Very very crowded during lunch and dinner hours with super long queues at the famous stores. And can get quite warm in the day time.
author: Alex Chin

review_text: Place is small but lots of good food option. Carpark next to it is small too, parking is quite limited.
author: Lynn Gwynie

review_text: Pretty average food center serving mostly nasi lemak.  There is not enough variety food stalls and the taste of most of the stalls are just average
author: Sufan Siauw

review_text: Good food but prices are slowly but surely creeping up
author: S Y

review_text: Nice place to come for the Muslim food. Parking is very challenging.
author: Mantou

review_text: The one and only fishball noodles stall is excellent in terms of food quality & customer service as both the husband & wife team are very friendly & can remember regular customers by names.
author: Steven Lim

review_text: Always come here for the Adam's chicken rice. But choose the ayam penyet, the sambal is the best. But always sold out very fast. Must come early.
author: Fifa Tang

review_text: Good food but half of the shops are closed at night
author: Desmond

review_text: Food is fantastic of course. However prices are much to be desired. More expensive than your average hawker center.
author: Aldrin Tee

review_text:
Quite a number of stalls was closed when I went.

Saw there was Rojak, ordered it. Portion was abit small for $4 but inflation I guess.

Went on to ordered bee join goreng ikan bilis. Not bad.

I think go for lunch for more options
author: Gin Desmond

review_text: The hawker centre is not big, and partial stalls are opened at night, the environment is OK.
author: Cheryl Goh

review_text: After renovation, it's brighter and slightly airier. But the heat and humidity hasn't been fully taken care of despite the fans. Airflow should have been seriously considered during renovation... Food at some stalls is pricier than other food centres, comparable to Newton Circus. But generally, service is better than most other food centres in Singapore!
author: Victor Ng

review_text:
Adam Road Food Centre is a hawker gem!

The hawker center has a great laid-back atmosphere too. Be prepared to look around for an empty table as it gets quite busy, but the delicious food is well worth it.

I highly recommend making a trip to Adam Road Food Centre, especially for the Sam Lo Hor Fun if you love Chinese hawker fare. Will definitely be back to try more.
author: Marcus Neo

review_text: Delicious 😋 yummy food
author: Quincy YONG

review_text: The place is so much better after their recent major renovations.  Much more airy and well ventilated.  Plus the tables are a bit bigger too. Food wise still the same shops.   Best Indian rojak here
author: Ismail

review_text: Fried Hokien Mee is our family favourite here. The chef is nice & friendly. Food always served so quickly & tastes great. His radish cakes & oyster omelette are pretty good too.
author: Chada V

review_text: First time to try spare-ribs prawn soup noodles. The soup & spare-ribs were delicious. The prawns were fine. Don't order thick bee Hoon because they don't cook long enough so it tasted pretty raw & rough. I'll go for it again, but may choose kway teow next time. Queue may be long but they are fast workers. A bit pricey though.
author: S W

review_text: Lots of people during morning hours. Food is good and lots of choice. Price is great !
author: John Lin

review_text: This hawker center has been a favorite since my school days, featuring a diverse range of food stalls ideal for late-night suppers. I appreciate the longstanding stalls that remain and the overall cleanliness, though additional parking options would be beneficial.
author: Yan Sen

review_text:
Hong Lim Market & Food Centre is a culinary treasure trove that lives up to its stellar reputation. Nestled in a bustling locale, this hawker centre is home to 4 or 5 Michelin-recommended stalls, each offering a unique insight into the richness of local flavors. The energy of the place is palpable—always packed with locals and food enthusiasts alike, eager to experience authentic, top-tier street eats.

One of the biggest draws is the variety of food on offer. Every stall has its own specialty, ranging from meticulously crafted noodles and savory seafood dishes to irresistible satays and innovative twists on traditional recipes. Each Michelin-recommended vendor brings passion and expertise to their craft, ensuring that every bite is a memorable adventure in taste. The quality is consistently high, often rivaling that of more upscale dining establishments, yet served in a refreshingly unpretentious atmosphere.
author: Wisanu Tuntawiroon

review_text:
One of the best hawker centre around. Packed with about 100 stalls - many run by veteran hawkers with decades of experience. Some stalls are even Michelin-listed.

One can find a huge variety of local favourite dishes here - from smoky wok hei noodles & rich curry chicken bee hoon, to bak chor mee, Hokkien mee & even traditional desserts. Prices are fair & portions generous. Expect long queues at popular stalls, especially during the lunch rush (12 - 1:30 PM).

Seating can get a little tight & warm during peak hours, but the atmosphere is vibrant & authentically local. A must-visit for anyone wanting to experience real Singapore hawker culture.
author: L Chan

review_text:
If you’re chasing the ultimate plate of fried kway teow in Singapore, this legendary stall at Hong Lim Market & Food Centre is my top pick. Every visit feels like a reunion with comfort food done right.

The “wok hei” here is unmistakable—smoky, intense, and deeply satisfying. And that signature pork lard smile? It’s not just a garnish, it’s a promise. Crispy, golden bits that elevate every bite with rich, indulgent flavor.

The uncle behind the wok is a master of his craft. He’s meticulous with every plate—balancing sauces, controlling heat, and portioning ingredients with care. You can see the seriousness in his movements, and taste it in the results. Occasionally, a younger assistant takes over when the uncle’s on break. While the finesse may vary slightly, the taste still holds up well and is worth trying.

Be prepared to wait, especially during lunch rush. But honestly? The queue is part of the experience. It builds the anticipation—and the reward is always worth it.

This stall consistently satisfies my cravings. It’s a stall that respects tradition, delivers bold flavors, and never compromises on quality. Whether you’re a local or just visiting, this is one plate you shouldn’t miss.
author: Happy Belly Chef

review_text: Always love this hawker. Tourist spot so apparently price is a bit higher. This famous noodles cost me 7 sgd for small portion. Half boiled eggs are brought from coffee stall.
author: Alex Susanto

review_text: Iconic Chinatown hawker. First tasted sg chicken curry mee and traditional breakfast set here. Great spot for that authentic local makan vibe :)
author: Judy Huang

review_text: The best place for breakfast in Sg. Its a food complex that you can come here over and over again for different stall’s great food.
author: Catherine Ho

review_text: BEST hawker centre! Nearby Chinatown, Heng kee chicken curry noodle soup is just awesome! Morning bakut teh is also delicious, meaty rib! Will come back again for sure, 1000%!
author: Andreas Kurnia

review_text: Please support the VI stall at level 2 which sells $2.8 economic rice! The food tastes nice and homely. Uncle give a very decent portion of food despite the inflation. I love that the owner is keeping the cost low as long as he could for low income elderly. He’s even featured on 8days.
author: Kristin Thor

review_text: Wow we were staying at the Mercure icon hotel and were looking for an ATM. Happened on this little know Hawker centre. Got this number 11 from Yong Tau Foo Lady for breakfast. 6.50 Singapore dollars
author: P Nabsie

review_text: Ji Ji Wanton Noodles is by far the best wanton noodles I’ve tried. The taste is always up to standards, and the generous ingredients make it a must-try. Just be prepared to wait in line, as it’s always quite long.
author: Rowell Tan

review_text: I like coming here! Jian Wei and the team are always so friendly and welcoming. They really make you feel at home. What impresses me most is that they remember exactly how I like my coffee, which adds such a personal touch. Even when it’s busy, they keep things running smoothly and never compromise on service. The food is consistently delicious too, fresh, flavorful, and satisfying. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for great coffee, good food.
author: linda Lim

review_text: found this place via Google and loved the interesting setup. the staff were all smiles and friendly. easy to order via qr code. food is decent except the bacon from the big breakfast was too salty. but the presentation was nicely done.
author: Chris Quek

review_text:
The Ritual is a wonderful spot for brunch, with comfortable and clean setting with plenty of space. The staff are attentive and quick to accommodate my needs. While the prices are slightly on the higher side, the quality of the food and service reflects the value.

We ordered several dishes. The truffle eggs croissant was nice, with perfectly fluffy scrambled eggs enhanced by the rich aroma of truffle, all nestled in a buttery, flaky croissant. It was flavorful and satisfying.

The rosti with sausage is my favorite. The potatoes were shredded finely and pan-fried to golden, crispy perfection. Smoked salmon was included at no extra cost and the sausage (+$2) added a hearty and savory touch to the dish.

For dessert, the waffle with strawberries and vanilla ice cream stood out. The waffle was light yet crispy, with a generous portion of strawberries that added a tangy balance to the creamy vanilla ice cream. It was a sweet and satisfying end to the meal.

It’s a lovely place to enjoy a meal when you’re looking to treat yourself.
author: June Ang

review_text:
At Ritual cafe along Bukit Timah road.

All the food we ordered was delicious 😋. The rose honey cold brew was yummy.

Can come again.

Please keep us the good work guys.
author: Stephen Seah

review_text:
The big breakfast lived up to its name with the portion size! Was wonderfully prepared so it thought that it was the most worth it, given the price point of the food here.

The fries were a good side dish and the bulgogi chicken rice had a really interesting sauce and the egg was cooked wonderfully.

The peach fizzy drink was nice and refreshing but the iced matcha (didn’t get a picture) was a bit too milky and didn’t have the kick.

If you are here during a peak period might need to wait a while as there were quite a number of people working in the place, good place to study and do work I guess!
author: Samuel Roy

review_text:
Came on a Tuesday at 5PM just for Waffles.
Was sad that “waffle batter finish already”. Staff didnt offer to make the waffle batter again.

Ate a chocolate muffin. Unevenly warmed, warm on outside cold on inside.

Will give them one more chance in the next week or so. Hope they have waffles then.

—-
Came back again, they did have waffles. Fresh and of the right crisp. The berries a bit too strong but the chocolate gelato was lovely,

Service staff were friendly and helpful.

Would recommend!
author: J

review_text: A cool cafe if you need to get some work done. Food was good but pricey (what you get in Singapore). Free WiFi and generally comfortable space. However there is not much natural lighting, only 1 window which is the main door. QR code service.
author: Maria Conceição

review_text: The place is so nice and the breakfast is very delicious i tried avocado toast and truffle egg croissant i rate it 10/10 👌👌 ….staff are kind and friendly …..absolutely gonna visit it again 👍
author: ali aljowder

review_text: Food was delicious! The Truffle Mushroom Pasta was rich in flavor but the portion was too much to our liking. Love the service and would definitely come back again. 🤍
author: Celine Lim

review_text:
Price is on a pricier side but the flavours are really unique. They offer options different from the typical cafes and I’m here for it.

Loved the curry mango chicken sandwich. And their truffle kombu fries. The rose honey tea is amazing, can be less sweet.

I think it’s worthwhile for them to explore pure kombu fries without the truffle flavour. It did overpower the kombu taste.

Service is great and we were able to get a seat at around 2.30PM
author: P Lam

review_text:
Lovely place to have brunch at or if you’re (like me) hiking from Bukit Timah Hill and through the railway corridor and looking to refuel on a Sunday afternoon.

I ordered the Somen with ikura and scallop. The scallop was done nicely and still had the flavours of the ocean and just the right amount of char. I thought it was really good. It was a simple and light lunch which was perfect for what I was looking for.

Will be back.
author: Lionel Ong

review_text:
Hot matcha latte sgd6 was very creamy and nicely sweetened! Loved it. Latte was strong and creamy.

Avocado toast sgd19 had lots of avomash, great taste, sour dough bread was crispy without being too tough to eat, slightly pricey for a single serving of toast. Sous vide egg could have been slightly less watery. Served with pomegranate seeds which aren't a favourite of mine but passable and interesting. Ritual breakfast scrambled eggs was a bit too salty, great texture though.

Place doesn't get too noisy, plenty of light and nice high ceiling. Service was reasonably attentive. Minimalistic decor. Great place to chill with family, friends, or just alone. Walkable to Stevens MRT.
author: Joyce Lim

review_text: Delicious balance of sweet and savory items. Their truffle mushroom pasta is excellent.
author: Amie Hu

review_text:
Went there for a business meeting and ordered a dessert and a lemonade.

Though have a reservation but couldn't find a conducive seating. Have to give to the staff for being extremely friendly, attentive and helpful. He cleared a table and got me a good place at the corner for my purpose.

The chocolate croissant and lemonade were on point.

Definitely will be back as the place was great for coffee and tea but have to say it was too noisy for quiet work. But excellent for business meeting.
author: Chun Teck Ong

review_text:
We were surprised to see the place being quite crowded when we reached around 10am on Sunday. Driving there was a challenge as parking was within a service apt which was out of our expectation.

Food was very nice, although expensive. Waffle cost $15 each but very worth our calories. It was moist inside and crispy outside. It felt light and not taste all flour. We tried their new ah boy laksa gen Z style. Also quite nice although the sauce tasted more like chilli crab than laksa.
author: Polly Chia

review_text: This is an excellent place for Koenig coffee and the croissants are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! They are the lightest, flakiest, and most delicious I've had in Singapore! The almond croissant was PACKED with almond paste; no skimping there! It's bright, clean, and relaxing. Two thumbs up.
author: John Sloan

review_text:
The food was amazing! Truffle fries were super flavourful. The signature avo toast was different from most out there. There’s a taste to the avocado, not just your typical plain avocado. I love waffles with salmon personally. The waffles was perfect for brunch moments and increase the business owner kind o brunch vibes. Atmosphere was so chill for a Saturday afternoon. Haven’t been in a cafe on a Saturday afternoon in a long time and this vibes is perfect to spend time to catch up with family and friends after a super exhausting work week.
Totally recommend to chill out and hang.
author: Eleanor Toh

review_text: Overall had a good experience at this cafe. Lunch time can be crowded, the cafe doesn't really mind people hogging the table as I can see students and working adults ordering just a cup of coffee while working on their laptops. Booking is highly recommended. Food quality is on the very satisfactory side. From the way it is cooked, the taste and presentation gives me the idea that the owner of the place had paid attention to satisfy the customers. Coffee was on point too.
author: Alan Tan

review_text:
I only had 1 cafe latte here while chilling with my 2yo for an hour or 2,but I found everything excellent. First of all, the latte was pretty awesome - strong but not overly bitter or burnt, milky but not insipid, with a rich flavour. I didn't have anything else, but the menu was quite varied with all kinds of brunch food.

Next, let's talk about the ambience. It was very bright and airy on a weekend morning, , with various types of set ups. You like normal table and chairs? You can sit on those. You like counter type seats? They have you sorted out too. Bar stools and tables? Yup, they have those? Sofa seats? Scoot right in. You have kids? High chairs, children's cutlery and even children's books are available to save the helpless parent. Best of all, power plugs are also pretty much everywhere, so feel free to use your laptop over food and drinks to get some work in.

Lastly, while service wasn't particularly exceptional, I got everything I needed without being intruded upon, as all kinds of utensils and necessities are available right at the counter, and everyone was chill about my toddler walking and climbing and blabbering throughout my patronage.

Would definitely go again if I'm in the area.
author: Sihan Goi

review_text:
A neighbourhood gem in Bukit Timah. Excellent coffee. Delicious dishes made from quality ingredients. Decent service.
The decor is simple. Noticed some crumbs on the floor, but overall good ambiance.
author: Saleh Anam

review_text: Protein bowl and the truffle scrambled eggs were delicious.
author: C Crumbs

review_text:
✅ Friendly, helpful & prompt service by the staff 👏
✅ Very tasty waffle (crispy on the outside and soft on the inside) and the waffle has a hint of sweetness but not too much. Paired with strawberries and light drizzles maple syrup making it the perfect afternoon treat 😁
✅ Their long black is nice too
✅ I also like their web-based ordering and payment system so I can DIY the ordering & closing of the bill expediting the service and leaving the staff to focus on serving.

Overall it was definitely a 5⭐️ experience for me and will definitely visit this cafe again when I’m in SG.
author: Marthrie C Mahaldy

review_text:
Everything we ordered here was good; ordered crab meat aglio olio, truffle mushroom pasta, waffle with ice cream and iced latte. Truffle mushroom pasta is creamy but not gelat, with medley of fresh mushrooms; latte is smooth. One of the best ice cream waffles I've tried: crispy waffle with good vanilla ice cream and dark choc sauce isn't too sweet.

Staff are very friendly and patient, vibes 💯 family and work friendly place as well. Higher price point but quality food and service, highly recommend !!
author: Jane

review_text:
A rather cozy cafe to start the day energetically. Lots of sunlight and warmth from the interior.

Food was good. We had:
The ritual big breakfast
Avo toast
Truffle smoked salmon toast

Food is of good quality and taste is fresh!
I enjoyed the avocados a lot!
author: teaQ7

review_text: thoroughly enjoyed the experience here, really work friendly and nice atmosphere & interior. food is slightly pricier but worth it for the productivity! particularly love their truffle scrambled egg sourdough with smoked salmon. portion size is generous and filling. also recommend the butter "chicken" cauliflower rice, a super keto and vegetarian friendly dish! dessert wise, i enjoyed the scone a lot!!! their soymilk latte was really nice too, with a very creamy and smooth soy taste unlike some other places with a bit of grainy aftertaste.
author: heather t

review_text:
I've been here for a couple of times now and just tried their new seasonal menu. I ordered the entrée, A Barramundi's Voyage, and the dessert, Sweet Dreams Made In Thai.

A Barramundi's Voyage has great taste with the spicy coconut broth. Tangy and savory with a hint of spiciness make the dish not feel as 'heavy' as it seems. The portion was fairly good. The protein was not dry or tough. I'm not really a fan of fish, but this dish has proved to me that fish can be as good as beef! :)

The mushrooms and potato leaves, together with the fish and broth, make a great combination of texture and flavor in your mouth. Honestly, I wished the dish was endless.

The dessert, Sweet Dreams Made In Thai, has a strong tropical flavor with bits of chopped mangoes on top. There was a slight citrus taste to the mango mousse, which made it really refreshing and light.

The mango mousse may have overpowered the taste of the coconut cream, but nonetheless, the cream together with the mousse was great. The cake was surprisingly not dry as it was sandwiched between the mousse. On top of that, the brown rice puff enhanced the overall texture and feel of the dessert.

Was really glad that I tried it and will definitely recommend this seasonal menu to anyone's visiting!
author: Evelyn Lim

review_text:
Went there with wife and 10yo. Ordered big breakfast and beef with eggs. Overall the food and drinks were good except that the beef was slightly tough.

Highly recommended cafe with great ambience and free 1 hour parking within the building.
author: Michael Lee

review_text: absolutely LOVED this cafe; great environment for work/ study, full wifi and complimentary lemon water and there are plugs hidden by pillows for the seat at the back! they don’t offer the baked potatoes anymore, got the mango chicken sando and it was a very generous portion, recommend for sharing. the staff are super friendly too :)
author: aly

review_text:
I brought my family here to celebrate a birthday and everyone was so happy with Ritual!

The Truffle Kombu fries, Truffle Mushroom Pasta, Smoked Salmon Scrambled Egg Toast, coffee (Latte, Capuccino, Black Coffee), Waffle with Salted Caramel & Banana were all very nice. I also tried their crabmeat alio olio on a separate occasion and it was nice! Just remember to ask for less spicy if you can't take spicy.

What's good is that they have a wide range of food with western and Asian options. My mum ordered the Grandma Lee's congee and it was really good as well!

These were ok: steak and eggs, beef bowl rice - the rice is the short grain sticky type, which some may like, but I prefer rice that's less sticky. Rosti with pork bratwurst - my family said it would have been nicer if it were crispier.

Would definitely come back for more.
author: claire au

review_text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting RITUAL, a healthy breakfast and brunch spot near Stevens MRT. I was immediately impressed by the friendly and welcoming staff.

We got a rosti, which was perfectly cooked—not too oily yet still crispy. The scone was also delicious, with a crispy exterior and a soft, fluffy interior. We paired our meal with a dark chocolate mocha and organic hot cocoa, which were rich and flavorful.

Overall, I had a wonderful experience at the RITUAL. The food was delicious, the service was excellent, and the atmosphere was inviting. I would highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a healthy and satisfying breakfast or brunch.
author: Jade Wee

review_text:
Good and fast service. I had the chicken curry mango sandwich: portion was huge and can feed 2 ppl easily. Chicken portion was generous and it was very juicy and the curry gravy tasted amazing. The juice and coffee also taste OK.

Super strong AC, perfect for Singapore heat.
author: Anissa Sariatu

review_text:
5 stars for turning my prior expectation of portion sizes on its head. Had read a few recent reviews that said the portions here were small… but just take a look at the size of the katsu curry omu rice (tried using the fork as a comparison) 🤣. Could have easily been shared among 2-3 people!

The curry was made in-house and was tasty and not too salty — I was told dark chocolate was one of the ingredients that was meant to add a savoury/slightly bitter aftertaste. The katsu cutlet was very crispy and breaded to perfection. In terms of the drinks, the chai latte could have included more chai.

The cafe was spacious and looked like a part of it was catered towards working folks (abundance of power plugs, free wifi, comfortable seats). We were able to sit there for a few undisturbed hours doing our own things, which I would say made up for the pricier food in return.
author: wt

review_text: Loving this cozy cafe with awesome food and coffee, the vibe and menu offered reminds me so much of Australia and it’s now a place I patron once a week, be it dine in or take away. Would suggest dining in though, the staff are friendly great place for catch ups, or even a morning coffee. Parking was easy as well, would definitely recommend.
author: Jogious Devon

review_text:
New cozy joint opened at Steven’s road. Service is great and friendly. Coffee is strong and robust. Try the avocado toast, truffle scrambled eggs and waffles — simply amazing!

Free wifi and lots of power sockets around, a great place for meetings and work too.
author: Henry Madison

review_text: There is a handsome, friendly, kind and talented chef.
author: 김정주 (Jay Kim)

review_text:
Edit: adding photos from subsequent visits . Still enjoyed food

A nice cafe with very nice deco located just off the stevens MRT station. There’s a busy McD just beside it and a constant long queue of cars waiting for drive through making this cafe not very obvious. But I finally decided to try it
Their speciality seems to be the avo toast which my friend had, I had the scrambled egg salmon toast which was excellent. Also tried their scone w in-house made jam (also good)
Cafe appears to be laptop friendly as there are a couple of tables with people studying or working on their laptops which is not common for cafes nowadays but it’s a welcome change.
Overall had a happy lunch
author: Kevin KW

review_text: A cafe on Bukit Timah Road, close to Stevens. It has the location advantage as there is no other similar cafe nearby. Very cozy and food is tasty although the price is a bit pricey. Very crowded in the weekend mornings. Better to make the reservation.
author: Zoe Chan

review_text:
I love the service, ambience and simplicity of the arrangement. This place is a bright and cosy environment whilst sipping on your coffee.
Food is excellent with lots of vegetarian and gluten-free options. Avocado toast smacked with flavour and soft, fresh bread, all simply amazing!

Price is also reasonable for the quality of ingredients.
author: Eranda Steinbier

review_text:
One of my go-to study places! I often come here to get my work done as the atmosphere is very cozy and makes me more productive. There are also multiple charging outlets to charge your devices.

I ordered their Acai Bowl and Madame’s Truffled Egg Croissant. Their Acai Bowl is topped generously with fresh fruits and nuts and is not overly sweet. The splash of soy milk makes the consistency of the acai smoother. As for their Truffled Egg Croissant: The croissant was buttery and flaky, while the egg was soft and fluffy. The taste of the truffle also did not overpower the dish.

Even though the price is on the more expensive side, I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a conducive environment to get work done and to eat hearty meals.
author: Sieon

review_text:
Love the ambiance of this place. It’s very peaceful and relaxing. Choices of drinks are very broad. I am not a coffee drinker, so for them to have lots of non-coffee drink options is definitely a plus point for me. I ordered the rose milk tea and i feel that it’s very nice! (See photo for reference) the only downside is that they put a lot of rose petals into the drink, so you’d need to chew the petals. However, this place is perfect if you wanna chill and talk with your friends. Also a recommended if you want to just work and have nice drinks and food.
I haven’t yet to try their main courses, but I’m definitely looking forward to it’
author: Meilissa Johana Alexsaputri

review_text:
Very nice breakfast platter. The pomegranates in the salad are a very nice touch. I don’t usually like tomatoes, but instead of a whole tomato, theirs was made into a relish, almost like a thick ketchup. Goes really well with everything.

Will definitely come back again for this.
author: Kale Toh

review_text: Visited this cafe with my friends during weekend.  The staffs were super friendly and try to accommodate us even though the cafe was full house. The food tastes delicious and serving time was short . I will definitely visit this cafe again.
author: ru yee tan

review_text: Was really crowded on weekends morning , worth the wait though
author: Xue Ling Liu

review_text: Very nice ambience and great food. The scrambled eggs and toasts were done perfectly, food was a little cold but still quite tasty. Thai spicy wings were great and crispy, and the service staff were very pleasant and polite. They also took special care to set aside the sou vide egg for the beef rice when I told them that my boy had egg allergies. It was the first time I've received such caring service from a cafe. Highly recommended and we are looking forward to going back for more brunch! ☺️👍
author: Lester Kok

review_text: 6 of us came here to celebrate my birthday. Our recommendations are: earl grey chocolate tea. Lamb shank, salmon rosti, frangipani berry, burnt cheesecake and earl grey croffle. Cozy ambience, aircon wasn't too strong and sufficient lightings. Service staff were responsive. Carrot cake abit dry, smoked duck abit tough to cut, sandwich could be cut into smaller pieces to be easier to eat, lobster bisque was average. You have to pay at the counter, there is free flow cold drinks. Would come again to try the other dishes and bakery.
author: A T

review_text: just casually finding a cafe to sit and read a book and i must say it was a super pleasant experience:) ordered Oat One Out and the Salmon and scrambled egg waffles to satisfy my sweet and savoury cravings! good cafe to meet up w friends and best to make your reservations! would definite return again
author: XF Ng

review_text: Loved this place, it had such a serene and calming environment. It was so refreshing to see a cafe with an inclusive menu consisting of many vegan and vegetarian friendly options. They also support smaller local products and merchandise here! The staff there were also really friendly and accommodating. Definitely a cafe to look out for !
author: Erwin Francis

review_text: Love the Grandma Lee’s Congee they served in the cafe. Simple yet delicious, served with spring onion, fried shallot, diced soy chicken , onsen eggs and dough fritters (Altho bit oily and soggy but overall is delicious, not a common dish you can find in a cafe, pretty heart warming to have a bowl of congee in the early morning).
author: Geneva Glade

review_text: the RITUAL is a cosy, ambient cafe located smack at Bukit Timah Road. The food options were great, albeit a bit pricey. I got the Big breakfast, while my fiance got the Truffle Scrambled Eggs with Salmon. For drinks, we got the Caffe Latte and Cappuccino. Overall, a good meal after a tiring hike over at Bukit Timah Nature Reserve!
author: Varun Desai

review_text: Popped in for the avocado toast... and it was brilliant (thanks to a random review of the place we read when the wife asked for a good avocado toast). I also ordered a Grandma Lee(?) congee (being an old school local who likes his breakfast savoury), and it is definitely a hidden gem that is packed full of protein (chicken breast meat, I reckon) and uber tasty. I might go back alone some morning just for that. Aside from that, it was helpful that they had books and a wire puzzle thingy which helped kept the kid and toddler engaged for a bit (long enough for us to quickly eat before handling the restless toddler again). Will be back again... when the wife has her craving.
author: Roy Lim

review_text: The aglio olio is using penne instead of spaghetti but it still taste good! Avocado lovers have to try the smoothie as you can taste very rich of avocado. The staff here all very nice and friendly as well. They informed the dining hour due to busy period later if not I can stay longer which I can understand as well. Cozy place to work with nice wording ‘All We Have Is Now’.
author: 加油努力不放弃

review_text:
2nd & 3rd Visit:
Brought a dear friend here for brunch and I must say oh boy was I impressed at their portion of food, quality and the ingredients they use! Patronised a few cafes, but the food here at Ritual is really well done! Accompanied with the pretty, cosy interior. Suitable to do work here:) Came at the opening hour, and the cafe isn’t open, so hope it will be more consistent with what they put on their google page! That aside, happy to give them 5 stars this time!!

1st Visit:
It's a really pretty cafe tucked, just next to Stevens MRT. Happened to just hop in and get some work done, I've a huge thing for interiors, coupled with their LOFI and menu choice of different juices was really happy to come here.

However, when I wanted to stay here longer at 6PM, the cashier did not inform me when I ordered more food then, that it would be the last order or if their cafe was closing soon. I had a very important video call coming in, and wasn't able to move away from my seat, later than to be reminded by the staff I had to leave. I later checked the cafe closes at 6PM, but the staff mention 6.30pm. Felt was an unpleasant experience for me, although also may have caused some inconveniences to the cafe staff. I hope The Ritual's customer service would continue to improve by going the mile to inform customer of its last order so they won't have to rush their food.

besides that I truly like it's ambience, and it's fresh ingredients, and portion, look forward to a better experience next visit!
author: Esabel Tay

review_text: Brought my son here for a late lunch. We ordered the truffle mushroom pasta, avocado toast, beef bowl, truffle fries and latte. Everything was so good. Portion was just nice and quality of food is good.
author: Angelyn Ang

review_text: Had this cheesecake for the first time and it was phenomenal. I would highly recommend everyone to try it out. The cold brew was so creamy and satisfying. Thanks to my friend who recommended this place.
author: Sugan Chan

review_text:
Order Flat White & Vanilla & Strawberries Waffle for kid.
The waffle is huge and the atmosphere vibe is good.
We visit on last Friday around 2pm, is not crowded. But almost full house.
author: Ker Pearl

review_text: Sht you not, the best waffles I've had; interior tasted great and it had a lightly crisp exterior. Although, slightly funny that the eggs reminded me of fried rice (it wasn't bad tho). Drinks were pretty okay
author: Ho Sean

review_text: Visited this in the first week of December and tried their pre-launch menu. Got the big breakfast, acai bowl and flat white. Coffee was good and the acai bowl is seriously yummy. Sourdough bread that came with the big breakfast did not disappoint. The space is big and airy. I had the seat on the elevated platform and every table had a power plug (but didn't check to see if it was working). The staff were pleasant as well. This place serves beer on tap too, didn't try that though.
author: Nefta Chan

review_text: Nice work-friendly cafe located at Stevens MRT. Got their ala carte brunch items and the portion size is good. The smashed avocado doesn't really suit my taste buds. The coffee is strong and ok. A good place to chill and work.
author: Rose

review_text:
Nice and quiet cafe! Visited here a while back during a weekday afternoon and it was packed.

My iced latte looks milkier because I asked for one shot of coffee. Other than the colour difference, it still tasted great. Will come again.
author: Geraldine Chew

review_text:
Calming, Homely and Minimalistic Vibes. ✨

Located right outside of town area, it’s a wonderful place to catch up with friends over a meal.

Didn’t manage to try their food as we were still full from our lunch. Looking forward to try their all day breakfast the next trip down!!

Excited to see what else this new Cafe will be able to offer!!
author: Sin Tat Tan

review_text: Had a wonderful time with my girlfriend. Great ambience and service staff were really attentive too. Really enjoyed their coffee and I had their aglio olio while my girlfriend had their impossible beef burger. Absolutely can't tell the difference with a real beef patty. Really satisfied with my whole experience there. My girlfriend really likes their small book corner, she say it feels really cozy haha. Will come back during weekday to try doing my work there as the space seems conducive.
author: Lie Chang

review_text:
Love the friendly vibes and selection on the menu.

I really like the coffee here which is 85% arabica and 15% robusta - more heavy bodied and skewed to european taste.
For $6 a latte, it is cheaper than a lot of places in terms of quality and ambience.

I like it that everyone is very hospitable which is really rare in singapore!
author: Joanna Chang

review_text: Ordered Baked Curry Chicken Mango Sandwich and the portion is big that I couldn't finish the whole thing by myself. The atmosphere of the cafe is so chill and provides charging point as well.
author: Be Happy

review_text: Visited for late lunch and food was pretty good in particular the omurice. They serve good coffee as well. May need to wait to get a table if walking in as they can get busy
author: JM

review_text:
Love the ambience and the friendly customer service. The best croissant I had in Singapore and coffee is done really well too.

They have the classic steak and eggs, big breakfast items right now and I was told that they will launch pasta items soon.

Parking is convenient and sheltered under Alocassia Apartments. It is also free in the first hour.
author: Tay YongYang

review_text:
Awesome team, ambience and convenient. Very relaxing place to chill, read a book or do work. There’s high speed internet and lots of power points.

Food is great with lots of vegetarian and gluten free options. Price is also reasonable for the quality of ingredients.

There’s parking just right downstairs at Alocassia apartments and it is sheltered all the way. Very convenient for people who drive.

Overall it ticks all the checkbox of an amazing place to have good conversations and time.
author: mathew tham

review_text:
Hidden gem in the neighborhood. It's scrunched up between the McDonald and its drive through, but don't let the outside full you.

I had the BEST scrambled eggs in Singapore here. The eggs were well folded with layers. They were fluffy, but not super wet. The chef clearly took her/his time.

The sausage was perfectly cooked and wasn't greasy at all.

The place is very friendly and great with a little kid. They open at 8am in the morning, which was perfect for a morning ride with the kid there. Will definitely be back.
author: YK C

review_text: Lovely place. The food and coffee was very good. Avocado toast smacked with flavor and soft fresh bread. Waffles are definite must have. Crispy, Fresh and just the right sweetness. Staff amazing.
author: siddhanth sharma

review_text:
I go to gym nearby and pop in for a coffee and food.

They have a great selection of meals like protein bowls and vegan options which is great for people on a fitness program.

I also like their coffee which is less acidic than most coffee places and also cheaper than places like Dempsey and Orchard.

Location is very convenient, being just 2 mins walk from stevens road mrt.
author: Hayden Wong

review_text: Food was good, particularly love their Chai Latte and their Osmanthus Honey Green Tea- refreshing and eases the throat. The service from the staff is impeccable, immediately attended to me when they saw I am pregnant. Nice cafe to hangout with friends or do some work.
author: Meijia T

review_text: I was here to do some planning for 2023 and the people here were so nice! Gave us the spacious sofa seats and did not chase us out despite us seating here for hours 🥹 there was WiFi from McDonald’s as well as a power socket. Would come back again
author: Shikato Sakana

review_text: The food was surprisingly awesome. We thought at first that it was just all instagramable, but no, it was flavorful. The ambience was very comfy, the kind with good music and then can still make a sincere conversation with someone.
author: Mary Loureign Dela Cuesta

review_text:
Visited several times now especially when we are in the area. It’s a convenient walk from Stevens MRT.
Serves great coffee, the last I had it tasted more dark roasted and of earthy tones. Tends to get crowded during lunch times, I visited once on Friday afternoon and they were also bustling! Not to mention the weekends. Crowd is testament to their foods and coffee quality. Crowd here is also interestingly reflective of the demographics of the area.
author: Jia Jie Chua

review_text:
Delicious! Ate the omu rice and curry chicken mango sandwich, really on point and unique flavors.

Coffee came really hot and stay warm throughout the meal which was nice :)

Definitely coming back!
author: Jevin tan Jin yi

review_text: Frequent the Ritual for breakfast now and then. The oat milk coffee is really nice, and I usually opt for the full breakfast. The scrambled egg is absolutely delicious, and the bacon is really good quality. Ambience is nice, especially early morning [very bright & airy environment]. You've got access to good quality free wi-fi and tons of power points for the laptop etc. Keep up the good work team!
author: Ben Rush

review_text:
Lovely ambience, friendly staff and nice food choices.

Prices are similar to most cafes but the experience is way more uplifting and pleasant.

Love to study and chill with friends over coffee and brunch here. There’s high speed internet and lots of power plugs.

Will recommend friends around the neighbourhood to visit!
author: Theodor Starke

review_text:
Food and drink were great. Service was good as well.
Ordered takeaway on their tiramisu and croffle. 👍
author: Ivy Soh

review_text: Always good! I’ve been back a few times now and always leave satisfied. Portion size is generous but most importantly the food is delicious.
author: Natascha Milsom

review_text: It' hard to find the balance between indulgence and nutrition when it comes to eating out. the RITUAL has quickly became one of my favourite restaurants in town, because they offer complete guilt-free dishes that are deliciously nutritious. Not to mention the free Wifi, lots of power sockets on every table, it is a great place to "work from home".
author: Alice Zou

review_text: Cute cafe with a great atmosphere and good coffee.  There is a good selection of menu and cabinet food.  Recommend the ice black coffee.
author: Nic Keating

review_text:
Wow, the staff is so friendly, wonderful & helpful whenever u need 😻
Beside, the food with fantastic decoration is so delicious & dessert is so yummy ✨
Also, the order from Qr code so convenient so that we don't need to waste time & skip queue at the cashier counter 🤩
author: Lena Lena

review_text: Fabulous Breakfast spread ! Jian wei offered us excellent service ! kids loved the food .. highly recommended when in Singapore ❤️
author: DR.KUSHA HEMANI

review_text: The ambience is good, service is awesome! Staff is attentive, friendly, and very polite. Food wise the waffles, scrambled egg with cavier are good! Iced matcha latte is really delicious too. Any special requests with regards to food (e.g., change to hard boiled, or certain ingredients removed/put on the side) will be accommodated whenever possible too!
author: Angela Wong

review_text: Thank you to the warm staff and excellent chef Hayden for the beautiful lunch here at the Ritual. Good APT chicken, salted caramel banana waffles with ice cream and latte! First of many visits here to come! Good vibes as well, two thumbs up 👍🏻👍🏻
author: Jake

review_text: Within walking distance from Stevens MRT, was pleasantly surprised that this cafe was not over crowded on a weekend for lunch. The place is bright and cosy, food and service was superb too.
author: Amanda Yong

review_text: Finally a nice cafe ard Stevens - cozily tucked at this quaint corner. Drinks and snacks are fantastic, service is good, and good chill vibes all around. Have not tried the mains, but def will be back here either for more coffee runs or catch-ups w friends.
author: Benjamin Gan

review_text: their brownie had a rich chocolate flavour and their cold brew was delicious! i love the nice atmosphere and friendly staff :) it's the perfect café to hang out with friends
author: Joy Chew

review_text: Finally I'm here! Am very happieeey after I tried their pastries! Freshly baked everyday and they look gorgeous, taste perfect! Love the cozy space too! Btw, their wifi password is "themomentisnow", so cute isn't?
author: Bobby Chen

review_text: There have many choices for delicious and yummy pastry. Prefered for the muffin that was superr nice. Besides，they sell few types cool brew too. have a nice experience in here.
author: Chin Yonghao

review_text: Lovely place to chill with your friends or have brunch together. Would love to come again and do work or read a book while enjoying the lovely food and atmosphere.
author: Rozz

review_text:
Great sourdough! Love the way they fry it slightly before serving. Creamy buttery taste.

Fries were great too!

Coffee is decent too.
author: ollie T

review_text:
Really enjoyed a lazy weekend brunch here. Staff are very knowledgeable and extremely helpful.

I ate a delicious side serving of scrambled eggs and drank an oat latte. The eggs are some of the best eaten in Singapore! Unfortunately I didn’t enjoy the oat latte quite as much- the Pacific brand used is very sweet. Much prefer the more commonly used Oatly or Minor Figures brand.

Look forward to getting back again.
author: John S

review_text: Ordered takeaway and it was still hot and tasted amazing!! Truffle eggs = 100% and nice chicken breast !
author: Chan Vevean

review_text:
First time try. Nice! Food was delicious. I ate the Spicy Chicken Bulgogi Omu Rice. Service was great too. Keep it up!
👍👍
author: Joseph Lum

review_text:
Food is great and portions are huge. Would totally recommend!
They are also work/study friendly with multiple powerpoints and free wifi.
author: Elisa Tinto

review_text: cozy place near stevens mrt! flagged it in my list and was nearby so finally got the chance to go. avocado toast was creamy & the mushy were savoury, though i must say the sourdough was toasted a teeny bit much than i would normally have it, so it was a little tough on the edges. loved it nonetheless:) got peppermint tea as well and the cup is really cute haha! menu is on the slightly pricier end, but I think it's worth paying a visit!
author: clariri •

review_text: With the birth of many boutique cafes around the island, this cafe made its mark on creating a comfortable yet soothing environment whilst sipping on your drink of choice. Recommend its croissant and small pastries/desserts. Great place to relax with your close grp of friends.
author: Jonathan Peh

review_text: Love their food - order their truffle scrambled smoke salmon!
author: Tegan Ng

review_text: Have been eating at the ritual a couple of times now and every single time the food is always good! This time too! Got the beef bowl and the rice is something special (a little mushy though)
author: Melmeleats

review_text:
I recently visited The Ritual Cafe and had a fantastic dining experience with my cousin.

Here's a breakdown of the dishes I tried:

Big Breakfast: A hearty, satisfying plate loaded with scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, sautéed mushrooms, and toasted bread. The portion was generous, and each component was cooked to perfection.

Truffle Fries: Crispy, flavorful, and indulgent. The truffle oil added a rich, earthy aroma that elevated the dish.

Pasta: I opted for the pasta of the day, which was cooked al dente and tossed in a savory sauce. The flavors were well-balanced, and the portion was generous.

Iced Cafe Latte: A refreshing, well-crafted coffee

review_text: Passed this place a dozen times and was always curious about it, but never stopped to try it out as you can't really see the inside from the main road. So glad a colleague suggested we come here. Tried the Mama Lee Sambal Pasta and loved it. Came back today for it, but it's sold out! Tried the corn chowder, a monthly special, which was good too, but maybe I like my soups less creamy. The space manages to be both buzzy and comforting at the same time. Maybe it's the sunny yellow 💛  Can see myself coming back here to hide out if i need to get some work done.
author: Ann C.

review_text: literally here everyday for the best basque cheesecake and friendliest stuff! coffee is good, service is top tier, pastries are mindblowing, really love this community!

review_text: First time visiting for a working session with my colleague. Good ambience and plenty of charging points! Tried the dark mocha latte and it was great! Would definitely like to visit again!

review_text: Lovely experience with the kids two weekends in a row! We had the granola bowl (garnished beautifully with fresh fruits), waffles (kids can’t get enough) and their breakfast! Good portions and left us full and satisfied! I love that they have oat milk and vegan options too! Their chai tea latte and coffee is top notch! Will most definitely be back this weekend! Kids keep asking us to go back!
author: Tasneem Noor

review_text:
Great coffee and friendly staff in a chic modern coffee shop.
I nearly dropped the score to 4🌟 because the table service App takes much longer than a human (first time at least) and the Almond croissant, though tasty, was a bit heavy.
author: Tim Hall

review_text: Fabulous food and coffee!! Avocado toast was beautifully presented and delicious; steak and eggs (delicious tender steak perfectly cooked); wonderful bakery and coffee as good as Sydney.
author: Dimity MacDonald

review_text:
Went here after a morning walk on a weekend. Really nice decor and great service all around. I think it is quite popular so do make a reservation if you’re going later in the day.
We had a cappuccino, berry smoothie, croissant and a burnt cheesecake. Everything was ready good, particularly the cheesecake and croissant which I wouldn’t have expected from a cafe. Was up there with most good bakeries in the city. Will be back to try more of their food offerings!
author: Sudipto Guha

review_text: Delicious food and beautiful atmosphere. A new star in the neighbourhood. Be back SOON!
author: Kamini & Ralph Rambausek

review_text: It’s rare to find a cafe with beautiful ambience and great food that is consistent every time we visit. We love everything that we tried with top faves being the Big Breakfast, Grandma Lee’s Congee, Madam Truffle Croissant, Baked Curry Mango Sandwich, Cream Cheese Blueberry Muffin & Almond Croissant. Their seasonal menu also never fails to amaze us. Last month’s Hainanese Pork Cutlet Curry & this month’s XXL Mala Chicken Bowl both blew our minds. You could feel the love and care behind every dish and that they don’t skimp on high quality ingredients. Thumbs up to the friendly crew as well. Truly a great place for a weekly winding down ritual.
author: J W

review_text: I had a pleasant time when I went with my sister last Thursday. Healthy food choices and the ambience was really chill. Definitely a quieter cafe out of the other ones I went before. I really appreciate the large number of charging points over there. Had the acai bowl and it really wasn't bad as I had awful acai in other cafes. Overall not a bad experience.
author: Pamela Lee

review_text: First time at The Ritual. Great food and super nice peeps!
author: Ashley Tan

review_text:
Edit: Giving them the 5 stars already. ❤️❤️❤️

Supposed to put 5 stars but I am just going to make it 3 stars for the cafe’s improvement.
Glad there is already a coffee shop near our place and we won’t need to come to Other place when we really crave for bagel.
Me and my husband really likes coffee and we want it to be on a perfect temperature but it seems some of them making it so hot that you can’t have it by the time they serve it.
I made a reservation few weeks ago but we were just late for a couple of minutes but there was no more table available.
We need to wait for seats available or we can just have it as take away.
Food is okay and my favourites are bagel with cream cheese, scrambled eggs and big breakfast.
I want to try the other food on their menu but I keep on repeating the order every time we come there.

review_text:
Stylish cafe near Steven mrt

Steven This is probably the only cafe within walking distance in the MRT area.
I always stop by to get black coffee before working out.

Shiroki's simple interior has a high ceiling and feels spacious. There are many seats and counter seats.

There is a wide variety of menus, from bakery items such as croissants to meal menus such as salads and pasta, so you can choose according to your stomach condition.

This time I had time, so I ordered scones to fill my stomach. It was a crispy scone that went well with the butter and jam, which I liked. satisfaction.

The drink menu also has a variety of drinks, from coffee to smoothies. I've only ever ordered black coffee, but this coffee is refreshing and doesn't have a strong acidity, so I like it because it's easy to drink.

Best of all, the staff always greet me with a friendly smile, even when a casual old lady walks in alone, making the food even more delicious!


It's in the store.
author: Ai M

review_text:
The chef is very friendly and approachable!!

First of all, the food is delicious.

I tried the new menu.

The laksa? oil, a popular spice used in Singapore, gives you a taste of local Singaporean flavors.

It's a great place to stop for brunch before heading to the Singapore Zoo!

review_text:
The banana and caramel waffles, homemade gelato, and crispy, freshly baked waffles were a perfect combination. It was delicious. The cafe latte, served in a stylish cup, also allowed me to enjoy the depth of the espresso. The staff were friendly and the service was excellent.

Banana and caramel waffles, homemade gelato, and crispy, freshly baked waffles go great together. It was very delicious. I enjoyed the cafe latte, which was served in a fashionable bowl, and I could feel the depth of espresso. The staff at the shop were very pleasant, and the service was very good. It's a great cafe.
